review: Very nice experience at lunch thanks to bartender Kelly (sp?). She was very busy serving the bar and tables but still had a smile on her face.  She answered questions and made us feel cared for.  She is the main reason for the extra star. Lol Don't forget to check in for free chips and queso.  They have the best chips and salsa. Queso just blah.  We ordered the triple sampler.  You have a choice of 3 different. Chicken crispers are a must.  I usually like the egg rolls but they were extra smoky today.  My bf said the bacon burger was delicious. Fries were thick cut and fried well.  I had the quesadilla explosion salad and that was soo ono!! Lots of chicken and totally worth it. If you are worried about calories ask for the dressing on the side.  I will definitely be a repeat customer.  Don't forget to check in on yelp for your free chips and queso dip.  Chili's please don't get rid of the chips and salsa for checking in.  They are my favorite.  Thin and crispy pieces of heaven.

Chili's to go slowest thing in the world.  Slow slow slow slow slow slow slow slow slow slow Also thanks for not adding the chipotle sauce. Awesome job Would be nice to order bbq chicken crispers and actually get bbq sauce.

So after my last visit I was contacted by Chili's general manager, Alicia, regarding my last experience.  She assured me that what I experienced did not meet their expectations and welcomed me back for another meal.   My next visit did not disappoint.  Servers Alex and Mark were excellent and provided great service. They both had very friendly attitudes and made sure me and my wife got everything we needed.  We got the chips and salsa with queso and chicken enchilada soup. I never tried the queso or chicken enchilada soup with the chips before but they were excellent.  The manager on duty, Kate, recommended it and it will now be a go to when I eat here.  For entrees, I order my usual, steak and chicken fajitas, while the wife ordered the Cajun Alfredo pasta with chicken.  The food was very tasty as usual and came out quickly.  We were checked on throughout the meal by our servers, as well as Kate, to make sure we were enjoying ourselves.  After the meal, dessert was considered but we both were too full and regretfully passed. I really hold Chili's in high regards for the way they went out of their way to make sure me and my wife had a positive experience at their restaurant.  Alicia, Kate, Alex, and Mark provided me and my wife with not just a meal, but with a memory that we will remember for a lifetime. Even though Chili's is a nationwide "chain" restaurant, I feel that they really value their customers like a family owned restaurant.  I have memories of visiting Chilis with my parents and am now currently doing it with my wife. I will be a loyal patron to this restaurant and hopefully bring my kids here one day so we can continue to support a restaurant that has values.

It's been a while since FPO and I were here. Things have apparently gone down hill since our last visit. Incorrect food on our order and hair in the food. Maybe we should have gone to The Counter ... Add On: after finding the hair in our food and reporting it to our server (I think I heard him called Rodney, he never introduced himself) he went and got his manager, Alicia. She came over to our table to apologize for the hair and to assure us that Chili's has quality checks in place that usually catch these things. . Unfortunately, she was unaware of the first problem - that we ordered the Triple Dipper with Big Mouth Bites and not the Southwestern Egg Rolls. And that after being informed, Rodney took the plate back to the kitchen, dumped the egg rolls and brought back the plate with the rest of th food saying the kitchen would correct our order.  Alicia offered to get us something else to eat. (Considering what happened with this experience we declined.) She comped our drinks and gave us gift certificates and her business card saying if we give Chili's (any Chili's) another chance to make sure we give her card to our server so that they can involve the manager on duty and make sure to make our next visit superb.  While Alicia's follow through was appreciated and her offer very generous, after talking it over with FPO we are in agreement - it's going to be a long time before we go to any Chili's restaurant again.

Came in for a Saturday night dinner and the place was humming with people.  I checked in with Yelp and got my free chips and queso which is always great.  This time the chips were very greasy and a clump of them were stuck together.   We ordered a chipotle chicken bowl which is my fav go to.  The other dish ordered was the chicken enchilada with a sub for corn on the cob instead of beans.   Tawny served the food to us and to our surprise the beans were served instead of the corn.  We informed Tawny of the sub and her response was "well, this dish is served as is".  I told her that if that was the case, we would have been told by our server.  Thankfully our server came by and straightened out everything.

When you're at Kahala and don't want to wait 2 hours for CPK, don't discount Chili's as a place to eat. You'd be surprised how many people they can actually seat because the wait is almost never longer than 5 minutes. I've been here several times in the past and although this isn't a go-to restaurant, I always leave pretty satisfied.  Don't forget to Check-In with Yelp to and get free Chips and Queso. They are generous and it was a great appetizer. The food here is great! I've had their smothered burrito and other tex-mex combo dishes (when they had it) and it was delicious! My last visited entailed me ordering the Margarita Grilled Chicken and my boyfriend ordering the Triple Dipper appetizer as his meal. My grilled chicken was very interesting! The chicken had a nice sweet margarita sauce that was complemented well with the crunchy tortilla strips, pico de gallo, black beans and rice. The portions are enough to satisfy but not overkill. My boyfriend's Triple Dipper looked very yummy. The sauce for the chicken was quite strong and this may be good for some and maybe not for others. However, we were satisfied with the overall quality, taste, and portions. The staff working there is very accommodating and gives great service. They work very hard and do a wonderful job balancing all the customers they serve - props to that. Overall, don't count Chili's out. They have great food, a nice variety of menu selections, a well-kept facility, and accommodating staff.

While watching some tv, there was a Chili's ad and then that prompted us to try it out. It's been a while since I've been in a Chili's and it was the perfect opportunity to grab a drink.  It was a saturday and it was pretty crazy.  After taking a look at the menu, I decided to get a skinny margarita and my bf decided to get a watermelon cooler.  His cooler was too sweet for my taste, but my skinny margarita tasted like I was drinking juice.  I think they should've relaxed on added too much sweetner.  I forgot I was drinking alcohol.   I was randomly check in on yelp, and there was a free chips and queso combo to redeem.  I wasn't going to say anything, until one of the waiters caught a glimpse on my phone and gave us the free chips and dip. He ordered the chicken crispers and I got the bacon avocado sandwich with grilled chicken.  His chicken crispers were pretty good, but my sandwich was oil.  I have no idea why I had a lot of oil on my bread, but it was okay.  The fries were okay but I was more into the chips than the fries.   Overall, this place is okay.  The service exceeds the food.

Spotted a Chili's advertisement while strolling inside Kahala Mall which features their two new seasonal Watermelon alcoholic drinks.  This really caught our eyes and opted to head to Chili's to give it a try.   We both started with the new Watermelon Cooler, and enjoyed our drinks, as it is refreshing, tasting like a watermelon soda.  Happy with our drinks, we proceeded to share the Quesadilla Explosion Salad, another new item, and their infamous Chicken Crispers.  The Quesadilla Explosion Salad blew our minds.  This salad consists of sliced grilled chicken breast with cheese, diced tomatoes, house-made cilantro corn relish, crispy tortilla strips, a drizzle of ancho-chile ranch sauce & citrus-balsamic dressing and served with freshly toasted 3-cheese quesadillas.  The taste and freshness of the salad was perfect. Service at Chili's, in the past, has been spotty, but the food has always been pretty consistent.  The host was friendly, and our waiter was pretty attentive.  This was a good Chili's stop. Stop in and try their new menu items.  They are a change from the ordinary, and you'll be pleasantly surprised.

Consistently good! I can't complain too much about chili's I mean for a mainland business they are on point and there is NO difference between Hawaii  and mainland chili's! Had a great server! Great experience! Try the chocolate lava cake! It's my absolute fave!

I'm not sure if it was a change in management or if we just got really lucky. The last two times I came here the service and experience was great. I mean free stuff is always good to me.  We came here because we wanted to go somewhere to eat out last minute and the wait for CPK was nearly an hour... I was hungry and couldn't wait that long. So we came to chilis. It was busy but the wait was less than an hour so I was sold. I ordered the 3 items for $15.99 deal (salad, chicken fajita and molten yum!). I was told they were out of the mini molten :( but that they would be giving a free upgrade to the regular size because of it. Yes! Bf ordered his food and a cup of soup. They ended up messing it up and bringing an additional cup for free on accident. The soup was warm if that though. Meh but hey it's free. Service was good especially since they hooked it up.  Fast forward to a few nights later (birthday dinner). Great service again. One of us ordered steak and the server said she would check to see if it was the right size since it looked a little tiny. Come to find out she was right. It was the 6 oz instead of the 10 oz. so to make up for it they gave an extra 6 oz steak for free. Nice! We also got an extra fries for free. Not sure if these were just outlier occurrences but it definitely bumped chilis up on my list for last minute restaurant choices.

we like to come here to eat aftr shopping at kahala mall..convenient..we ordered n shared the triple dipper appetizers which is a platter of mini burger sliders, buffalo wings n southwestern eggrolls...and a plate of chicken nachos..all delicious n satisfying

OK! I guess 3Rd times a charm for another review lol, and usually I don't like to update my reviews but I think I should for this place at least.  FOOD: Let me just start by saying this time around I am actually VERY impressed by the menu! I had the shrimp/sirloin chipotle thingy except I subbed the asparagus for the Mexican street corn, and bruh! I seriously can't even tell you how amazing that corn was! My steak was cooked to perfection and the flavors OH MY GOSH. If you can believe it, it was out of  t h i s W o r l d! Lol my dad had the exact same thing as me and he loved it also. My husband had the build your own fajita and he really liked it. My brother and mom had some other chicken dishes and they loved it as well. Everyone kept talking about how great the flavors were and how well it just all came together. My mom, husband and I all had Margaritas and that too was also super delish.  Service: I wish I got our servers name, he was very attentive, he always came around to ask if we were okay, also to re fill our drinks. He removed plates fast when we were done with them. Overall our experience was awesome I would definitely come here again!
Service 5/5 Taste/Quality of Food 3/5 Ambiance 4/5 Cleanliness 4/5 Overall Experience  4/5  *Comments - No paper towels in bathroom. Awesome service.

There's something so simple and fun about corporate restaurants; you always know what  you're going to get. My favorite has always been Chili's due to their Mexican inspiration. It's a friendly neighborhood bar and restaurant; the host staff, bartenders, and waitstaff are all professional and friendly to ensure you have a good time. Our recent waiter David and the manager went out of their way to make sure we were happy, especially helping solve a problem with the orders we didn't even notice right away. With the closing of the Waikiki location, Kahala has been my go-to whenever I'm in the mood for their food. I've eaten here many times, sometimes at the bar, others at booths and tables. It's most fun to eat here with a group as the food is great for sharing. Portion sizes are consistent and not small. Prices aren't cheap nor expensive; you're getting what you're paying for. I always think the meats and vegetables are fresh, dishes are tasty and well seasoned. The menu is long, there's something for everyone. Be sure to pay attention to whatever specials are going on! For Yelp check-in, you get free chips and queso, so be sure to do that for some pre-dinner munchies.  They have an okay selection of draft beer and can make most typical hard drinks at the bar. This location is a stand-alone building on the Kahala Mall grounds. You can easily walk here from inside the mall, or park right next door for free. They have ample seating indoors and out. Restrooms are large and clean. The ambiance is fun, dark tile, with dim lighting. Fun place for comfort food!
Our server Karen is the best. She is the nicest person with the best service. She was friendly and super helpful and fast.

Okay so I read that happy hour ends at 6pm but last night they kept happy hour going for awhile after 6? Brooke is the greatest server ever! She always made sure everyone in her section was doing well, refilled drinks asap, and has an all around amazing personality!   Anyways not complaining just confused!! Hahahaha!! This location is closest for me, and every time I've come here I've never been disappointed. We've always been seated on the left side, aka bar side, this is where happy hour occurs. And even though there's only the bartenders and probably two or three other people working this side, everything goes over really smooth.  I've noticed there's always a manager walking around making sure people's visits are great, and if not she makes accommodations.  You can never go wrong with choosing fajitas from here! They're packed with veggies and nice slices of meats! Also their burgers seem to never fail as well!
The food was good. The service was spectacular. Overall, I enjoyed my experience there very much.

Well, the manager, Alicia, earned my 5 star review for her attention to customer's feedback. Previous shortcomings, in my view, were rectified in my recent visit. The chips were fresh, warm, and delicious, complemented with bottomless tasty sauce; these alone are worth eating in this fine establishment.  Also, the wraps that comes with fajita were outstanding and the best part is that they do not turn hard, like other places,  after exposing to air for a period of time; the shrimp and prime combo is hard to beat. Thank you, Alicia! Please keep up the fantastic work! Update: Another memorable experience at one of my favorite places. Just couldn't get enough of their absolutely delicious chips & fajita dish.  Liked their steak much better than prime rib for the fajita because the customer can request how the steak is cooked.

I visited this location this past weekend for the first time in almost two years, and it was nice to observe some updates/improvements: 1)  The interior has been given a much needed facelift and renovations.  Everything from the light fixtures to the tables and booths seems to be show room new(in the main restaurant area).  With these improvements, the center of the room looks vastly larger than it really is creating a wide open space. 2)  The entrees are now mostly served on actual plates and not the formerly used basket-lined with wax paper method.  I ordered the big mouth bites and it was served on a regular plate with the fries in a metallic basket.  Nicely done upgrade/improvement for sure.  Though I'm guessing there are more dishes to be done as well. 3)  There was a miniature device/computer at our booth which we used to pay our bill.  The server was kind enough to offer to split our bill three ways, and each party was able to pay their own share (including the tip) on this device.  Extremely convenient.  Cards only please.  4)  Service was pretty awesome.  Our server was very patient and knowledgeable.  Oh, and I mustn't forget polite.  He checked on us periodically throughout the meal, and his observation skills were quite keen as he kindly offered boxes before we asked. BOTTOM LINE:  Noticeable improvements.  Decent food.  Good service.

Take my review with a grain of salt (no literally, the new Salted Caramel Molten is A-W-E-S-O-M-E!!) SERVICE: Starting with our waiter Bo who's first day was today, was very attentive always checking on us, refilling our beverages, asking if everything was alright and if we needed anything. Also we didn't even know that our food was taking longer than expected until Kate one of the managers on duty tonight came out to let us know that it was coming out soon (she even offered to upgrade our desserts) which we really appreciated this!! FOOD: The CARNITAS FAJITAS were really oishii (delicious)!! The pork itself was nice tender and full of flavor. Loved the tortillas and condiments tray that came with it so that I could custom it to my tastes. Before I start talking about the SALTED CARAMEL MOLTEN I must admit that I usually hate caramel but this dessert is definitely an exception. It reminded me of a warm deep fried Twinkie (which I love but this was much better) with the ice cream being a bonus.  PARKING: Limited handicap parking. There is only 2 handicap parking in front of Chili's and 1 in front of CPK. None were available this time but we were able to find a spot very close by.

We stopped by Chilis at Kahala Mall for dinner on Sunday night. We've visited a few times before and the service has always been absolutely terrible. Tonight we were served by Courtney and Dalaney. They were on top of everything, we weren't really sure who was our server because they both refilled our drinks and checked up on us. They even brewed us a fresh pot of coffee. Our steak was overcooked but it was quickly corrected and we were offered a side salad to compensate. They remade our steak very fast and the manager came over and talked to us (guy with glasses and bright green shirt). I was impressed with their customer service. Entire staff was extremely apologetic. This is the first time I've actually been impressed with chili's.
After checking in on Yelp for free chips and queso, I got charged by Shaye.  What's the point of having this offered and then get charged.  Not cool!

Slowest service ever...... reservation for a party of 7 at 6:00. We sat at 6:10. It's now 7:25 and I just got my salad 10 minutes ago.  Soft porn on the t.v. 15 minutes for refills on drinks.  Food just came out @7:28 all the sides are wrong. Still waiting for a manager... Table of 5 sat down after us and they finished and left already. Update- 7:55 we just left. Manager came and  apologized- they comped our meal. We appreciate it but it wasn't necessary- we would have still paid our bill no matter.

Haven't been to Chili's for awhile but I know the food is always good and the prices are reasonable.  They currently have a 3 course special for only $16.  Get it while it's HOT!  hahaha  My niece and I coordinated our selection to get the best out of the deal.  Her and I shared the pork fajitas and the ribs and a small salad.  We got the nachos to share with the table.  Her and her bf shared her dessert while me and my daughter shared my dessert.  Food was all very good. We were so full from dinner that we had a hard time eating the dessert.  hahaha PROS: GOOD FOOD GOOD SERVICE GOOD PRICES TONS OF PARKING  CONVENIENT LOCATION TVS TO VIEW SPORTS HAPPY HOUR UNTIL 6PM

I took my daughter and some nephews here for some food since they've never been here. We were seated right away, and the waitress came right away to see if we wanted to start off with some drinks. We got some mango teas and soft drinks since they were unlimited refills which is good for kids. Lol  I got the smokehouse combo which came with so much things. It came with garlic bread, corn , French fries, pickled cucumber, ribs and jalapeño smoked sausage. I was super happy with my order. I got full off of it and it tasted great. My boyfriend got the exact same thing. Some other orders were enchiladas, burgers and a rack of ribs. Everyone was happy with their orders. The waitress was on it. Before anyone could take the last sip of their drink, she was already on her way to refill it for us. Thank you!  We could not past up dessert. We got the caramel molten cake and chocolate molten cake. It was so good that we demolished it within seconds. No joke. I was happy with my visit. Great service and food.

I'm not sure how I've never written a review for this Chili's when I come here fairly often! It happens to be at a very convenient location for the majority of my friends & myself so it's an easy option when we want to get together, last minute & nobody wants to drive far.  We all tend to order the same thing every time we come & in 6yrs of visiting, I can't ever recall receiving bad food or bad service. We all love their margaritas & desserts as well. We always order & share & always end up with the molten chocolate cake or the warm, gooey chocolate chip cookie served with vanilla ice cream in a skillet. At our most recent visit, we noticed they had a new salted caramel molten cakes so we tried that instead. I loved it but couldn't eat much because I was so full from dinner. A few friends mentioned it was "too sweet" for their liking so unless you REALLY love sweets like me, consider this your warning. The only con I can think of is parking, which is to be expected since its shared with Kahala Mall.

We wanted for go here for lunch to grab a bite before heading off. We arrived and there was no host at the front and when a host came by we were not greeted, we were just greeted by "who was here first" with the motion of a hand indicating us to follow the host.  Following that it took quite sometime for us to just get water and then another 7-10 minutes to order the food. Never got refills immediately. And it took over 20-30 minutes for our food. No one told us there was an issue as we just heard from other servers actually communicating their patrons.  Never the less, when my big mouth bites came... it was terrible. It wasn't cut in four sandwiches and my fries did not come. Only did my fries arrive when I finished my food. I was just disappointed in the food as I go to chilis often with family and friends.  Nevertheless, it never got better from there. We just figured out the check out system ourselves with no directions. Overall I am super disappointed for my overall experience
Great service, the waitress Karen was very helpful offered all the available discounts to us. Thank you Karen for making this experience with Chili's and our family this evening wonderful.

Don't really like to go here because there's always a wait to get in, last night was no different.  The place was half full but still a 20 minute wait.  I mentioned to the hostess we would go to the bar area since they had a lot of seats opened.  Still a 20 minute wait. The food was good but hardly Mexican food, more Tex than Mex. The service is slow and inattentive.

Just an aweful dinner experience. Poorly prepared food, poor service, totally unacceptable. Wont be back! Update: A gentleman from Chili's left me a message to please call him regarding my experience. He mentioned how very important their customer's satisfaction is. Well, I called him, left him a voicemail.....never heard back. #lipservice

I haven't been to chili's in a while, the menus changed again...but luckily they kept my favorite quesadillas! I came in with my family this past Sunday night & we had to wait 30+ mins for a table and another 40mins for our food :/       However the only reason why I'm putting 4 stars on this review is because my server Patrice was outstanding!! Even with the frustration and the waiting she made sure we all had refills on our drinks & kept checking on us to make sure we were okay while waiting for our food which made my family and I comfortable. I truly appreciate good service like this!! Keep up the good work!!

The last time I remembered visiting a Chili's was before the Waikiki location closed and if it hadn't closed, I'd more than likely eat there once a month. Alexander has been craving Chili's for quite some time and we finally gave it a go. Chili's in Kahala is hard to miss with their location being in the same property as Kahala Mall next to Whole Foods on Waialae Avenue. If I'm going to any restaurant chain, a surf and turf is my first go to. My family and I came on a weekday during spring break and the venue wasn't thankfully busy. We were immediately seated on an open high booth and next to the glass divide with the view of the bar. The bar houses a few TV screens angled on all directions for everyone to see. This would be a great bar for sports watching, drinking while socializing. The venue is comfortable with countless booths, and adjustable tables. The large Hawaii murals and colorful drinking glasses as light fixtures broadcasted an impression that you're indeed at a Chili's restaurant in Hawaii. David was our server for the evening and we had an offer for a free chips and salsa with guacamole or cheese. We chose the guacamole and it's not guac from a mixed package, it was real with chunks of tomatoes, bits of onions, cilantros. The chips were warm and fresh and we had two rounds of it. While the beverage menu is eclectic with cocktails and beers, I was hoping to have a virgin lava flow. But the bar couldn't make it. David returned and offered a virgin daiquiri and it was immensely sweet and good. The menu has an overwhelming selection of appetizers and mains with fries, wings, eggrolls, flatbreads, pasta, fajitas, seafood and steaks, and ribs. With a few customizations to the options, you can create your own perfect meal. I wanted the Honey-Chipotle Shrimp & Sirloin with asparagus, and loaded mashed potatoes. Alicia the general manager communicated with us that our meal would come out shortly and indeed it did. Our meal had a little bit of mix ups but was solved quickly. Initially I wanted my steak to be a medium rare and I got just what I had ordered. I had requested to have the steak be cooked a little more and David was very kind to take it back to the kitchen. The steak came back even better and melted like butter. The mashed potatoes were tasty and the asparagus was perfect. Due to the mix up I was happy to have inherited the extra corn and it was cooked just right without it sitting on the boiling water for a long time. I had a sample of ribs and it was delightfully tasty. She looked like she went to town and wiped the bone clean to the last cartilage. The quality of the meal is fair to the price and I wouldn't mind returning again to try the ribeye. The device on the table is entertaining with trivia for $1.99, survey options as well as an option to pay with your credit card. David stayed on top of his game and was never too busy to fill cups of waters and to chat a while. His manager asked that we leave a survey on the device at the table and we did just that. David left a lasting impression on us that night when we told him we would leave an honest survey. David said, "The truth is better than lying no matter what it is." Social media: Twitter/IG: Chili's Grill & Bar #chiliskahala FB: Chili's Grill & Bar (4211 Waialae Ave. Honolulu) Free parking is ample on the ground level and upper level of the mall or next to the restaurant. Checkin with Yelp for a free chips and salsa. Join the Chilis email list to get a free chips and salsa with guacamole/cheese offer.
chili's kahala is the best!!! KAREN is the most rockin server ever! Got us some table side chips and Queso!!! Full of that holiday spirit

Chilis Kahala which is next to Kahala Mall is a convenient place to come and grab a drink or bite to eat. Usually in the early afternoons there is no crowd and they have happy hour specials. There is a lot of parking and the wait staff is friendly. Sometimes they can get busy and drinks/food can take a while. If you check in on yelp you can get a free chips and salsa with queso which is a great pupu while you have a refreshing beverage.

First time at this place and I'd say it was a good one. I was happy w/ their Yelp check-in offer. The chips and queso is free w/ a check-in which I appreciate because typically places offer $1 off for their Yelp check-ins, but the Chilis check-in offer is great as the check-in offer is totally free!  Our server was nice and friendly. I ordered the chicken wings which I believe is an appetizer so we got it $2 off (I think) because it was Happy Hour. My sister got the Mac and cheese side along w/ a chili side. She was a bit disappointed that the chili came w/or rice though. We also ordered the cake/ice cream dessert (I forget the actual name). It was yummy and filling, so we actually weren't able to finish it all.  You make payment via the machine that's right on your table. Convenient! It also takes gift cards

Great service & loving the NEW AND IMPROVED MENU and drinks! The kids love the touch screen games and the husband loved the fact that he could watch his football  team while we enjoyed our food! Everyone was HAPPY!
Love this Chili's!!!!! Kelly the bartender is GREAT! They donate to my local classroom and school every year and the margaritas are AWESOME! Come here and sit at the bar!

Convenience played a key to our coming to Chili's. After shopping at Whole Foods, we decided to stop over here for lunch. Unfortunately, it resulted in a bad decision.  We like coming to Chili's. However, I think the change in the kitchen staff made a huge difference. I ordered the guacamole burger. It tasted too salty and way too spicy. I was hungry. I tried to eat it but it got worse. I felt the salt stay on my tongue and it made me feel uncomfortable. I took sips of root beer but that did not make a difference. The fries tasted salty too. It made me think that the chef wanted to preserve the left over food from yesterday.  I told our server of what happened. He quickly took the fries back and gave me a new one. I told him of what happened to the burger. He asked me if I wanted a new one. I looked at my half eaten burger and said no.  Needless to say, I felt a bit unnerved about the whole issue. Our server told the manager and he came out to apologize for the situation. I explained to him the issue. He said he will comp me for the meal. He said he will speak for the fry cook about it.  For the whole day, I felt a bit uneasy because of the high salt intake. Not a good way to leave Chili's.

I was pleasantly surprised at how good the enchiladas were - they were like a cross between a taco and a tamale.  I asked for all beans and no rice.  If only I had known to also ask for only half the amount of cheese on top on the enchiladas, it would have been perfect.  Next time:-)

1st time eating  The hostess didnt greet us, im not too sure she even knew what to do? She didnt seem like a snob, just maybe lost unless shes training? But their was another worker who came to us and seated us.  Our waitor was nice. Came in often to check on us, but idk if were suppose to ask for napkins or he forgot? I need more napkins for desserts, & I he forgot, but not a biggie. But I need napkins especially with the kids lols.  Another downside was that they only had 1 pasta dish & it was cajun pasta. Im not a huge fan of spicy. I can handle a little but not a lot, so I didnt know how spicy it was. I asked the waitor how spicy it was, but he didnt know as well since he hasnt tried it  I did however like the fact that their keikis menu was 1 same price for all; unlike othet restaurant, it varies. The food was AMAZING!!!  Chicken quesadilla was good!! Not oily and3 the crisp on the tortilla was perfect. And it waa ready to eat, not hot hot.  Bf ordered the steak, he loves it! Not much cooks can cook steak the way he likes it.  Surprisingly, the kids ate all the food! I like the amount given, just right!   Desserts was SOO GOOD!! I ordered the berrys with cake & ice cream. Omg it was good!! The others enjoyed their desserts too  It is kinda pricey (minus the kids meal) when you have a big family, but it is WORTH IT!! Everything was delicious. Coming back here for sure

In Washington Chilis always plays a ton of commercials and we don't even have a real chilis. The only chilis we have is at SeaTac airport and it's not even the same. So when we got to Oahu we saw chilis and immediately said yup let's go.  I've been to 1 other chilis before and that was in Denver. I remember it being amazing and all the commercials that always play at home makes me crave that ish.  So anyways it wasn't as good as I remembered. The group I was with felt the same so this is a kind of a group review. The food was just okkkk....  The chicken crispers weren't really crispy. The steak I ordered had a weird sauce and the steak wasn't even that juicy. It was supposed to be medium but more like well done. The shrimp that it came with was tiny and salty. The salsa and chips were probably the best thing we ate. You get a free chips salsa and queso if you check in on Yelp!  We all felt that the service and waiter Kevin was great. He even gave us to go chips and salsa. All in all, chilis, it was ok kind of like applebees.

We always get the best service at Kahala Chili's! Our bartender Rachel is awesome! We love the bottomless soup/chili, salad and chips and salsa deal! All for only $13.99 for the two of us. Best deal ever.  The fajitas are also another of our faves.

*Before I start my review, I just want to put in that I do not usually do reviews for large chain restaurants. As I said earlier, this is a very unexpected review for me, but the service that I received definitely made this review an exception. I go to Chili's enough where I already have an expectation of food quality, service, and atmosphere. The environment is usually loud, the food is alright, and from my earlier visits, the service was below par compared to other large chain restaurants. I went in with two other friends on Veteran's Day because we were looking at the sales for the stores at Kahala Mall. I was expecting it to be busy and for the service to be slow, but my friends really wanted to go to eat there. I was served by two ladies, Courtney and I believe the other girl's name was Laney. They were friendly even in the loud environment, serving us with a smile, and I really appreciated that. Our table decided to start with some appetizers. We ordered the Texas Cheese Fries and Chips and Salsa, along with some soft drinks. It was time to order, but I usually like to ask for suggestions just to see if maybe I will try something new. I usually go for the Old Timer Burger with Cheese. You cannot go wrong with a burger, and Chili's burgers are pretty decent. Courtney suggested a couple of items. She suggested the ribs , the Southern Smokehouse Burger, and the Cajun Chicken Pasta. She gave great descriptions on all the items, which I never knew about beforehand. For the first time there, I was stumped on what to order. My friends went first, getting the Steak Fajitas and Margherita Flatbread. I was indecisive at first, but I was pleasantly surprised that Courtney did not try to rush me. She told me to just let her know when I have decided, and she started asking my friends about why we were in the area and if we were from here, and other small talk. This made me pleasantly surprised, knowing that our waiter was definitely personable. While this was going on Laney came out with our appetizers, which I thought was very fast. I finally decided on the Southern Smokehouse Burger. Courtney closed up the conversation politely and left to put our order in. We only waited about 8-10 min for our food, and in that time Laney did not fail in making sure our drinks were filled. I never once had to think about if I needed to ask for a refill, which is very comforting for me. Our food came out steaming, and I was definitely pleased with my meal. My burger's sauces were amazing. There was a special sauce inside, a bbq sauce to dip in, and the onion rings were great. My friends seemed to enjoy their food as well, but I was too focused on my food. I was impressed when Laney came over to ask our table if we were okay, and then asked me if the burger was alright, or if I wanted to get something else instead. This showed that Courtney communicated to her that this was my first time ordering the burger, and that was very commendable. At the end of our meal (our drinks still did not go empty by the way) we were way too full for dessert. I paid through the Ziosk, which is very convenient, and we left a generous tip showing our appreciation for the great service. We all decided that whenever we go to that Chili's, we would ask for Courtney or Laney because of the great impression they left. This experience changed my whole perception on Chili's. I do hope that eventually they get promoted/rewarded for their teamwork, hospitality, and great customer service. Thank you again Courtney and Laney, my friends and I greatly appreciate your work ethic.

I had to get my table-side guacamole fix today. Love it! Keli provided us with outstanding service; friendly, knowledgeable, personable, yet professional. Upon check-in on Yelp, I had an offer for free chips and queso, which was absolutely delicious! I ordered the Cajun Chicken Pasta; Alfredo sauce, chicken, and Cajun spices, and it wasn't spicy, which I loved. My friend ordered the chicken quesadilla with extra sour cream. She added table-side Guacamole on top for a custom dish, which was also delicious.  There's ample parking during lunch hours. Evening parking can be a challenge, but not impossible. Service was quick and efficient. I'll definitely make a return visit.

Seriously disappointed!!!! First time trying the bite app & I honestly thought it was going to be good since I really like Chili's. I really didn't mind that I had to wait almost an hour for my food, BUT upon receiving it, my steak was RAW. Kinda upset about it. And I thought they would actually "check" on my food. Guess not.

Food was pretty good, but the service was slow.  Ordinarily I'd be able to overlook the slow service, but I can't get over when I get lied to.  The manager lying about the wait time was just pathetic.  Totally unacceptable.   Our server was friendly and apologetic though.  Refilled our water and chips.  Many times.

Haven't been to Chili's in years.  Attended a Christmas choir concert at Kahala Mall and decided to have dinner here.  We had a party of 11; the restaurant was full but we were seated quickly.  We were seated in the bar area on high tables.  It would have been fine if our party did not consist of small children and 2 seniors which made it difficult for them to get up and down from the chairs.  Also we could hear "everything" being said by those in the kitchen.  Innocent conversation between coworkers but inappropriate for patrons ears.  Service was good though and prompt; our waitress was very friendly and attentive.  Some dishes ordered were the salmon, fajitas, ribeye, sirloin, burgers and the kids had corn dogs & mac 'n cheese.  Those that had the salmon said it was really good.   I enjoyed my steak.

The service is Great here ! The food is good ! The Chips OMG! Please order them without salt ! I took one chip and it had like a tsp of salt on it! This one chip ruined my whole dinner! The chips was also very very very oily! How can u service this!

Not sure how to rate. Started off really really good and service went down hill from there. Had to ask for sauce three times. Then couldn't get our bill. Finally did. But only part of the group. My check was 14.31 and when my visa came is was $18.43. Huh. Two other people at the table gave a twenty and asked for change because their lunch was under $10.00. Never got change. Something is wrong with service when that happens.  Great Queso. Great food. Great portions. Better Mexican than you can find in some Mexican restaurants.

Karen was very friendly, patient and helpful. They have specials on the menu so make sure to ask!Today's special was the oldtimers with cheese burger for $8.99. I signed up for chilis e-club which gave me a $10 off $30 coupon so make sure to sign up if you frequent this place! Best thing to get if you wanna try some appetizers is the triple dipper which come with 3 apps. I got what was shown in the picture on the menu. A must try!!!!

Came in for the new Smokehouse combos. Guess I got there too early since they didn't have the BBQ chicken breast ready for service. So I got the ribs and chicken crispers instead. The ribs were good and the Dr. Pepper sauce was decent. The piece of toast/bread was too heavily seasoned while the fries were not seasoned at all. The crispers, while tasty, looked nothing at all like the ones in the photo.  The service was great.

Best chips and queso ever. Keli is the best bartender in Hawaii...Better than Tom Cruise in Cocktails!! I'm never thirsty when she is working cuz she always ready to bring me the next round of drinks.

During Xmas promotion.  For every  $50 gift card,  you would get a $10 gift card to be used by 02/08/17. I asked if I could use more than one promo  $10 on one bill. The answer was yes. I bought $150 gift cards. Got $10 x 3 promo gift cards. Tonight I tried to use the 3 promo $10 gift cards. Then the manager on duty comes to our table to tell us the bad news.  We could only use one, not 3.  Bad business. Please be aware when purchasing gift cards from chili's. NOTE: GENERAL MANAGER RESPONDED IMMEDIATELY TO MY REVIEW.  PROBLEM WAS RESOLVED EFFICIENTLY.   THANK YOU!

I came in the day before Veterans Day and the bartender Karen honored my Veterans Day meal a day early since I had to work that day. I have the Veteran endorsement on my HI drivers license, so that was all I needed. What a kind jesture! The service was exceptional and the food/ drinks were perfect. Thanks Chili's! The best Chili's we have been to!
Karen is really awesome! She is very attentive to our table and made a great conversation with us! We'll definitely be coming back :)

Update: We had a larger group of people today so we sat at a table. We had Keli as our server. We could tel she was super busy just because we are all in the restaurant industry, but she handled like a champ.  Kate was awesome as well always checking up on the tables and making sure everyone was happy.  I finally got to meet the GM Alicia! She was super friendly and took the time to talk story with us.  You must get the corn on the cob, idk what kind of seasoning they put on it but yuuuummmmmmmy.  Oh and the fried cheddar cheese curds. Oh em geeeee Old Review: Love love loveeeeeeee sitting at the bar when Rachel is bartending. Everything is always so on point! The food is consistently amazing!  I love that the blonde manager, I think her name is Kate! She comes around to make sure everything is up to par, every time! Good quality service from people who really care! This chilis is the best on island!
Ate at chili's on Sunday and had great food and excellent service from Karen!  I highly recommend sitting in her section. She was very friendly and accommodating.

We were there on a super busy night and the computer system crashed while we were there. The server was super good at keeping us up to date with what was going on and the manager came by a couple times to keep us in the loop. It was definitely a total mess but they were trying their best to keep it together. Kinda a mess but we will definitely be back to give them another shot due to the amazing service that we received even in the middle of a total disaster. Good job on a bad night guys I'm sure they were a wreck behind the scenes!

Chilis is not bad. The seem to update the menu. Or maybe it because I come only occasionally. The food choices are varied, but this particular location had slow service. Probably because they are short staffed. I ate the prime rib tacos and it was pretty good. It also came with rice and beans.

Went in and staff didn't know the new menu. They don't offer the promos you see on the TV. And the bigger by 30% more meet just seemed like a gimic. If the ribs I ordered was bigger I'd hate to see what it was before. So my order was screwed up with the sides. Sauces were wrong also.  I will not repeat. I'd much rather go to outback or ruby Tuesday.
Chilli's is one of our favorite place to go.  thanks for Karen who assist and serves us makes our dinner extra special.  (5 winks, 5 thumbs up & 5 stars!)

I love Chili's! When it's good, it's really good---but it's not consistent. Like tonight I asked for the burger to be pink and it was fried to a crisp, dryer than dry. Waiter was not very responsive. Overall disappointing, but more times than not it's good, you just can't tell ahead of time whether it will be a good night or not.

We come here at least once a month, and the food here is pretty consistent. Most recently my boyfriend got the ribs, which also came with a free small molten cake. And I got the shrimp and prime rib fajitas. The prime rib pieces were really tender and the shrimp was super flavorful! And since we checked in, we got free chips and a cheese dip. The cheese dip tasted like there was some chili flavor in it, which was pretty bomb. Easy to find parking since its next to the mall. Friendly staff and pretty clean. I like how they have tablets at the tables to make it easier to pay, and can even split the bill if you want to. Overall good experience.

LOCATION:  Across of the counter in kahala shopping center.  PARKING: they share parking with kahala mall. they have a parking structure and everything. may get busy though.  SERVICE: tonight our server was senichi. (hope i spelled his name correctly ) anyways he was on point with serving us today. he quickly came to us and asked to get us started with waters. then gave us time to think of what we were going to order. he took our orders and brought our food quickly. he would consistently come back and refill our waters, ask us how the food was and if we wanted something else. once our food came, he even went and grabbed my bf's sauce without my bf even asking. wow! he also kept coming back checking on us :)  FOOD: The food was suuuuuper good!!!!! i got the triple dipper. as always lol with the mini burgers, fried pickles & cheesy bites :6 so good! it was served hot & fresh. there was 3 sauces in the middle of my plate for each food desires. i tried them all and it was delish! i love the triple dipper because you get to choose 3 different choices in one plate :) my bf got the make your own combo. he got the ribs & steak with loaded mash & broccoli. he loved it! came out steaming hot that the steak was still cooking and made itself well done instead of medium rare lol but it was okay cuz he said it all tasted so good. he finished his plate so quick. no problems at all with our food. we got the southwestern eggrolls for our appetizer and omg! it was soooo good. hot & soft just how we like it.  SETTING: there is alot of seats everywhere. they even have seats to dine outside but it was rainy so we didnt even bother.  PRICES:  my bf got the make your own combo with ribs & steak for $25. pricey but worth it!!!!! the southwestern eggrolls are $12 also pricey but omg no wonder they're known for that! so good!

Came here a few months ago and had a few issues but this time we were taken very good care of. Our waitress Karen was really sweet and knew exactly what to suggest. The food was much better this time and the manager came to talk to us. Will probably come back.

Turkey Club sandwich.   5 stars  Side salad.   5 stars  Value.   4 stars  Excellent turkey club with lots of ingredients. Sandwich was nice and thick with great taste.  Price was ok for what you get at $13.   Side salad was a generous portion.
Love chili's vegan option Karen was amazing an super helpful. We had the black bean patty burger guacamole style. And the black bean patty vegan fajitas super delish.

Came in to Chili's on a Sunday night expecting it to be empty, it was full of people waiting to be sat. I told the hostess to put down my name and a few minutes later she came outside to tell me that there was a power problem in their kitchen and that servers were down and they couldn't order food. The hostess said it in such a way that I couldn't be upset and leave to go somewhere else to get food (I think I fell in love)!! Food was great and I didn't have to wait long at all! Such a nice staff and would come again!

A great experience with these great servers!!! Mahalo JUSTIN and KAREN for making tonight's dinner an enjoyable one! I would recommend anyone looking for a stress free night to come to chilis kahala! Top it all off only waited 7 minutes for a table tonight!!! Whoop whoop!  Good job to this team!! Go Kahala!

Karen and the manager Kate made our dining experience at Chili's wonderful. The food came out of the kitchen a little slow and they made sure we were very happy. Sometimes the dining experience is about the people who help and serve. We definitely will be back.  Try the combination meals, you get a lot for the money!

Customer service was alright. The food was...not so much. We came in a party of 6 people, and we ordered an item each person and drinks. They should make some improvement in their dishes, most importantly: taste. The pictures on the menu looked great but when they came out, they looked like fast food items and did not taste good overall. Nothing like the pictures, only the drinks did.

When you need something classic to remind you of the mainland...go here! PROS:  Our waitress was great, the place is clean and keeps people moving, the food is pretty good.  The chips and salsa are amazing and bottomless!  Thursdays they have cheap margaritas. CONS:  Food was slow, good thing we had chips and salsa.  They make you pay using the little tablet thing on all the tables, I know it's not 5 star dining, but what's the point of going out to eat if I have to do some of the work.  They don't have all the same deals as the mainland despite being a franchise  (usually free chips and salsa in the bar and always 2 for 1 drinks).  The prices are very Hawaii high for what you get.  Parking is at the Kahala mall so close spots are hard to come by.

I love happy hour here! $2 off margaritas starts at 2:30, which is earlier than anywhere else in the area. Food is always consistently good, but service at the bar is consistently slow (only reason for not five stars). Use the Yelp check in to get free queso!

Chili's has become my go to place. Located at Kahala Mall it is convenient and easily accessible. Parking can take some patience from time to time but over all it's good. The food and drink always hit the spot, and it's a place where you always know it is going to be good quality. Our server Kianna was awesome, she was friendly, attentive and did a wonderful job. This has become our regular place and Kianna remembered us, greeted us in a really friendly manner as if we were friends. It's makes it a really great place for my wife and I to hang out, enjoy a drink and good food.

We usually stop here to fuel up for a day of snorkeling at Hanuama Bay.  The triple dipper is a huge plate of 3 appetizers and 3 dips.  It probably has a billion calories in it, just enough to fuel us for a fun day of snorkeling.  Pictured on the menu are 2 hamburger sliders, fried cheese balls, and southwestern style egg rolls.  I substituted boneless buffalo chicken wings for the cheese balls.  The service is always warm and friendly.  I didn't give this place 3 stars because the food was bad; rather because this is a place to fuel up on fried foods and then leave.  The food comes out fast, which is a good thing if you have French fry loving kids, and the prices are very reasonable for Hawaii.  If I wanted a true dining experience, however, I'd go somewhere else.

Corntny and Delaney are amazing Sievers they are super nice and friendly to all people I would really recommend  them they do everything as you ask them to do they go above and beyond. They make your dinner even better than what you think it is;)

Now serving breakfast!  Had to wait a bit to be seated, but that's ok.  Watched some football in the meantime.  Got seated and ordered the breakfast enchiladas first because we didn't know what to try yet.  Came to the table and it was delicious!  Then, we ordered the rest of our breakfast. Didn't wait too long, which is amazing!  Husband thoroughly enjoyed his Loco Moco, near to local standards he said.  I'm enjoying the Southwestern Breakfast Skillet.  We can say that breakfast was pretty good here!
I'll tell the manager Karen Rock, uh she is the best Karen and Rock best presidential Margaritas anywhere on this island at Chili's

haven't been here for many years. came because i saw a special for 15.99 $ for half rack baby back ribs + side salad + mini molten chocolate cake. after checking in with yelp , we got a huge basket with chips ,  queso  and salsa for free. the food was surprisingly good this time . our waiter was very friendly and attentive .
Yummmm! Only thing is the service is a little slow. Other than that, I love chili's!!!
My family and I come to this location often! Very kid friendly, and the food is always delicious!! Servers are happy and very welcoming!!

Just had dinner there and the food was excellent.  As others said, the chips came out hot and crispy.  But the best were the server and hostess.  Our server was Shaye.  She did a wonderful job.  She kept us in her sights but didn't interupt our discussions.  Very considerate and professional person. Tthe hostes was also very helpful and made sure everything was fine - which it was.  Thanks for having such a good Chili's where my friend and I will return many times.

Karen is a wonderful server! The drinks were always filled, our food came out quickly and better yet it was delicious! I like my chicken well well done and Karen made sure it came out perfect. My bestie and I really enjoyed our time! We love this location!! The Aunty busser/host was exceptional too!

Worst service ever!!! First brings out my my meal with no fries... then 2nd my girl friends sizzler plate comes out stone cold.... 0 refills on water... waiter kept on talking about how he didnt want to work, so that he could go party... and last he couldnt even put in our order for dessert on time... keep in mind we ordered the dessert before hand... Its easy to look at our table and make an estimate on when to put in the order of the dessert and make it come out as soon as were done...  last the dessert came out with what looks like a spoon scooped ice cream... cant they use a regular ice cream scooper?  Lol Horrible service dont eat at kahala location... cooks and servers clearly dont care about service

Came here when they were busy. Their were people waiting outside. Gave our name and the host said it would be a 20 minute wait. We were fine with that. So we went outside and waited. Well 30min passed as we saw other people being seated. My sister went in and asked why we were not being seated. The host then said he went outside and called our name and they didn't see you so he crossed us out. WE WERE SEATED RIGHT OUTSIDE THE DOOR WAITING THE WHOLE TIME!!!! THEY DIDN'T CALL OUR NAME AND DIDN'T BOTHER TO CHECK OUTSIDE. The fact that you lied makes us not want to come here anymore. Time to find a new place, or at least not eat here when that soecific host is working.

I really like the food at Chilis.  I had the Fajitas combo and it came on a sizzling plate with which then the food was warm and cooked and yummy!  There was cheese, tomato salsa, and to top it off, I had a lemonade!  =p My brother Ian who I went with --- he had a turkey sandwich which came with plenty o' fries. ....:-] Its a nice place at Kahala mall.  But my friend owns that restaurant across the pavement with the windows!  So in the future we're also going to California Pizza Kitchen!!!

Are you a fan of rich NASTY food? Why, YES...........I AM! Lol!  Sometimes when I'm craving some Nasty Tex-Mex ribs.........I like to go to Chili's at the Kahala Mall Shopping Center. Yeah, the ribs are not the best that I've ever had, but at least they are consistent, and I know what I'm gonna get. They have two styles of ribs - the dry rib, & the bbq ribs. I've tried them both, but prefer the gooier sticky bbq ribs! :D  New on the menu, I hear they now offer a Dr. Pepper BBQ ribs, as well as a Craft Beer ribs too (will have to try that one day). With my ribs they offer several types of sides, but I'm a creature of habit, and I tend to get the same thing over, and over again............if it works, don't fix it right? Lol! I usually get the cinnamon apples, & steam broccoli for my sides.........so basically I'm getting a high calorie, high sugar meal........only to off set it with some healthy steamed broccoli. Well, two out of three ain't bad!  What can I say about the ribs.........tasty bbq flavor, meat on the ribs are not the meatiest, but it will do when I'm craving some ribs. The cinnamon apples are great! It's like eating a apple pie without a pie crust.........so basically your eating the apple pie guts! Lol! And of course the steamed broccoli, it's healthy........but nothing to write home about.  If you saw the Chili's web site on the calorie contents of their foods.............rest a sure, this is comfort food! Not the healthiest of food! The full rack of bbq ribs packs a 1240 calorie punch, and this doesn't include the addition 270 calories, and 24 grams of sugar for the cinnamon apples. For the steamed broccoli..........you know it's healthy as it's just 40 calories. For you folks that like to dine here, (and not feel guilty about it)..........they do offer some healthier fares too...........l saw some lower calorie entrees of fish, or chicken dishes, but you will have to read the menu & choose carefully (unlike me).

Welcome to your Pau Hana spot! Look no further for a fun friendly customer service dining experience with a touch of Aloha! If you want a stellar server be sure and ask for Sarah! She provides amazing customer service with a smile and goes above and beyond when she takes care of her guests. She is the type of employee that is destined for a management position. I had the bacon chicken quesadilla and had some special requests. Everything came ask I requested but served with a side of warm Aloha spirit I was not expecting especially during a dinner rush! Again come for the food and the great service but be sure and ask for Sarah! Even if you have to wait you'll be super happy you got her to serve you and your Ohana!

My friends and I came here in hopes of fulfilling our Craving for nachos. We immediately seated ourselves at the bar and was welcomed by the bartender. After putting our drink orders in, the bartender seemed to have forgotten about us for about 20 minutes which was totally understandable because he was the only worker behind the bar.  Finally he came by to take our food orders. We ordered the beef nachos and a few other appetizers....the food came out fairly quick. Everything was great EXCEPT the nachos! They were alright, but not what I was expecting. I was really looking forward to an overwhelming mountain of chips, meat, salsa, etc., but instead I got individual nacho chips neatly laid out and topped with cheese and single pieces of jalapeños. Again, it was still alright...just not what I was expecting. Other than that, the service was great....I just really wanted to get my hands messy with some "traditional" nachos!
Extra oily food, rarely saw my server. Refilled our own water got our own takeout. Horrible. Not coming back

Would rate it better it was busy and have to keep reminding server of items forgotten. First requested water with lemon got water yet no lemon, next requested a smoke house burger did not get the side of bbq sauce waited 10 minutes to finally ask where is the bbq sauce? Asked about terilungua chili and ordered it it showed it for $1.50 for terilligua chili was charged $5.29. Asked about bill was told hold for a manager waited over 25 minutes for managers customer service.  Although excellent chips and salsa. Will probably return to this location. Found out Why the wait for a manager took so long because other server told manager wrong table # Server did apologize for the miss understanding about the chili manager took chili off the bill. Other than mentioned above server was excellent service with a smile.
This is a great place to eat with your family! The food is delicious and the staff is friendly, especially Kevin always provides excellent customer service.

1 star for their beef enchilada ($13) which had hamburger (only a little) inside, which reminded me of canned enchilada.  i was hoping for shredded beef 'cuz Chili's is hey! what?  Mexican chow.  i guess one shouldn't expect much from a big chain restaurant.  beans & rice were too much starch, but that's the way it is.  on a prior visit, i had fajitas which was pretty decent.  i went for an early dinner at 5pm.  good thing 'cuz there was a line of customers when i exited.

I personally don't like eating at Chili's, but my kids love it here. After watching my nieces soccer game the whole family decided to eat lunch together and twelve of us headed to Kahala Mall.  ME: Where shall we eat? BROTHER: Chili's ME: Gross. No. Where shall we eat? KIDS: McDonald's! ME: Gross again. No. Where shall we eat? OTHER BROTHER: CPK ME: One hour wait with five kids? That's mall suicide. OTHER BROTHER: Chili's? ME: How about the Counter? KIDS: Noooo! Too fancy! ME: Ugh. Damn you kids! BROTHER: Chili's? HUSBAND: They have beer! Let's do it! ME: Gah!!! Alright dammit. I had originally wanted to go to Whole Foods and eat outside in the common area but the mall was swamped with people. Chili's was not busy at all so we were able to get a large table with only a two minute wait. My husband and brothers ordered beers. The family ordered up and the children clapped with delight over quesadillas, cheeseburgers and french fries. My hubby and I shared the world's saddest salad. My family had so much fun laughing and talking while my children took over the restaurant like midget pirates. Okay Chili's I give in, you win this time...

had a date here with my bf. our waitress was friendly n cool. service was fine. the food was pretty nasty. my cajun pasta was 16 bucks, and it wss cold when i got it. the shrimp was cooked perfectly. i like them pretty soft, almost raw.  my bf got the trio fajitas, all the protein was pretty sad for 23 bucks. hahaha i couldnt help but laugh when he made a sad face and said "i dont remember it being like this at all" . our waitress was friendly saying we could ask for more tortillas. we ate our food because we are both big eaters and hate wasting anything. we decided to get dessert  because last time i came to chilis, in the westside outlet mall, i had a great cookie pan ala mode. so we got the brownie this time and that was awesome. cant beat hot brownie with icecream chocolate and toffee.  2 stars for service and dessert.  probably will never be back lol fun experience though, had a good date overall.
We had the best service today from the hostess, our server Kat, and the manger on duty. Not to mention the free chips, salsa, and queso for checking in on yelp.

Thank you Karen for letting us know about the yelp check in for my favorite chips and salsa!  She noticed that the table we were sitting on was not wiped down, and swiftly cleaned it up for us. Great to know that although she is busy with the football crowd, she is still attentive to each customer.

Wow!!! Unbelievable!!! I lost my drivers license for quit some time. I just received it in the mail. Chili's had mailed it too me. I must have dropped it on the side of the booth. To think I was going to have to take leave being in the military and go back home to get a new one. They saved me alot of hassle.

Poor service and the restaurant wasn't even busy!!!  Asked for small plates from our waitress, Jessica and never got it.  The waitress didn't refill our waters ..Our food took so long, the manager said we could get a free dessert since our order was placed over 20 minutes.  Well, we ordered the free dessert and the waitress left in such a hurry that we couldn't  place more orders for dessert Not coming to this location ever!!

Service started off really well. But, towards the end of our meal our server was no where to be found. BTW, if you want to just pay and go, the tablets on the table allow you to pay, instead of waiting for the waiter. But I'm sure if you had had something discounted, you have to sit and bear the wait.  The food was A-OK. It wasn't to die for, but it was really good and I left stuffed.  I liked the appetizers. All the food seemed to be more american-ized, so if you're looking for AUTHENTIC mexican food, you probably shouldn't come here lol.

Once in awhile we come here for the dinner. Most likely when I don't want to cook dinner as "my kitchen is closed". My husband likes Mexican food but I don't. But I still can order something else there. Food is OK. But the service....it takes so long to serve the drinks all the time. I see some of the waiter dresses impropriate such as hair is too long and messy, and touching hair everytime I see. He should know he's serving a food, man ! We still go there because it's reasonable, variety of the menu choices, casual and don't expect too much.Not too bad but not too good.

*This is from last week's visit* I found my home! I found DolphinNation! I have found my favorite place for NFL Sunday football! Each sports bar has a predominant fanbase of a particular NFL team, Seahawks...ahemm. They are seemingly everywhere, and are quite.....passionate (?), sometimes overly passionate. Though, there was one "fan" who rolled in very late, and the Seahwaks game was already out of hand and switched to a better game. After some complaining, she left lol. Bye-bye! Anyway... what makes this place fun and great is the fact the bar area has exactly nine TVs that show every single game rather than the first come, first serve on the TVs and you get the same 2-3 games on all the TVs. The place was comfortable and cool, and clean. The fellow football fans were mellow and laid-back, which is such a welcome. Located in Kahala Mall, there is plenty of parking in the morning. Chili's offers a breakfast menu, but no bar food during that time. Other than the French Toast and Pancakes, everything else has basically the same ingredients served in different vessels. On this morning, we just ordered the Flatbread Sunrise ($10.99). The flatbread comes with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, and cheese, and salsa and pico de gallo and cilantro. This may sound ridiculously simple, but it was good. It was like a breakfast pizza! The scramble eggs was the key ingredient that made this a successful dish. Anytime I order eggs, I never think it will turn out the way it's supposed to, especially scrambled eggs. I only hope it's not super dry and overcooked. In this case, the eggs were actually cooked well. It was moist, soft, and warm. The service was average. It seemed like they was short-staffed front and back, so the food took a really long time to come out (unless it was totally forgotten), and we were rarely checked on. Overall, I really enjoyed watching Sunday NFL football here. Other than D&Bs, there's really no other place where you can watch every single NFL game sitting at one spot. The place was nice and comfortable, and the food was good. I'll definitely be coming here at least once before the regular season ends.

We've come to this Kahala Chili's location twice in the last month and noticed the service seems friendlier in the restaurant and our servers were extra good. Both times we had two young female servers who were very attentive and kept our drinks full. They also checked in to make sure we had everything. Tonite we had a smokehouse combo of ribs and sausage and the classic bacon burger. Both delicious and our server new already to bring us extra napkins. Food was good but a bit messy. I'm not sure if management has changed, but everything was great. Even when fries came when I ordered onion rings,  the manager asked me if we wanted to keep the fries and quickly came out with the onion rings.  Way to go Chilis!
We came to Chili's Kahala tonight and had the best service! Rachel was so friendly and accommodating. The food was great, the drinks were wonderful and Rachel is the best!!
Good service and friendly staff. Their club sandwich is awesome. Lots of meat filling. Although the fries were cold.

I'm changing my review because they failed terribly at providing good customer service today. Today would have been my 4th time eating there in the past two weeks. I wasn't in the mood to eat a lot and I had planned on using my Yelp check in offer, having something to drink and a salad. The server informed me that I can only use the Yelp offer if I purchase an entree, which it does NOT say on the offer. She even checked with the manager and said that they can NOT provide the offer unless I purchase an entree because the register will not let them do that. REALLY??  To the server... You made me feel really bad about asking for the offer. You made me feel very uncomfortable, so I left.  I just wanted a salad and a drink and I can get that at several locations in Kahala Mall.  I walked over to CPK and they happily provided great customer service and exceptional food. Good bye Chili's! One more thing.. I didn't appreciate you taking my phone out of my hands and walking away with it to show your manager the yelp offer on my phone. Next time ask for permission before you walk away with someone's brand new iPhone.
Karen was our waitress she was great! I like this location always so friendly and service is always great. Food delicious.

I eat here about once every other month or so. Love the quick lunches and tasty faire. Today I ordered the new Smokehouse Combo (ribs and crispy chicken) and it was phenominal. It was Chili's-level phenominal. I know it is not a 5-star restaurant, but it had heat, sweet and pickels. The corn on the cob and Texas toast filled it out very well. No chips needed. Our waitress Victoria rocked our order and remembered me and my coworker from over a month ago. She repeated my drink order and kept it full the whole meal. She made the meal very enjoyable. Mahalo Victoria and Kahala Mall Chili's staff.

Came in Sunday night for dinner. I have to give it to the staff and the manager. They were all awesome... it was a pretty busy night and I guess their computers went down but our server was great and kept us in the loop and the manager even came by to apologize for the wait and let us know that everything would be coming out soon (which I thought was a nice touch being that she was so busy herself) .I thought they handled it well and we loved our food and drinks . We'll be back!!

Had the best dining experience I've had in a while. Service was awesome and Kate the manager on duty made our anniversary extra special. Chain restaurants now days have been slacking which is why we hardly go but I love the margaritas and the chips here so we decided to give it another chance! Soooo glad we did because everything was  Mahalo Chilis Kahala for stepping up your game

Kahala Chilis -worst customer service I've had in a long time. After ordering and getting our food, we didn'tsee our waitress for 30 minutes had to ask someone else for our drink refills. Can't say it was a busy night because I saw her colleagues check on their tables 7 times before I asked one of them to get me a refill. Yup I counted! And bottomless chips- yeah right. More like staring at the bottom of the basket while I wait 1/3 an hour for my waitress to come back. Then when she finally graces us with her presence I ask for my chips that were never refilled to go and a take out container for my leftovers....I get a dirty look, to go container 10 minutes later and had to get up to grab MY OWN plastic bag from the take out area. Wow, guess who got no tip tonight
The flavor is good but the presentation depends on opinion. The staff seem friendly. The wait for the food was moderate. I wouldn't come here but I just don't care for Chile's.

Awefull food and service!  Waited so long to get our drinks.  Then waited almost an hour for our 2 entrees to come.  other people who came in after us were almost done eating.  Waitress didn't care if I got my lunch. Kept making excuses and not making sense.  Only one star bc the beer that finally came was nice and cold.  Never ever going back!!!!!!!

Chili's is my favorite go to happy place. We had an hour before going to see a movie and they were so great getting us in and out with fast food service so we could still enjoy our meal and be on time! Love the food too!! Thanks chili's Kahala!!

Great bar and mostly caring waitresses but the prices are just not worth the mediocre food. Also, the prices went up and the food quality and serving size went down. The fajitas were skimpy and tortillas don't stay hot in a piece of foil.  The steak was very tough so for $22.99, totally a rip off unless came with a basket of guacamole and fresh chips (which was $7.99.  Just below average nowadays. Time for a change.

TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE  Let me start out by saying that I have been going to this place for years. Every time I go I end up having a worse experience than the time before. This time was the last time that I will give it another chance.  As me and my girlfriend walked in we were not greeted, just stared at until I said something. I then asked the host if it was happy hour, because that would decide if I wanted to sit at the bar or in the dining area, he checked his phone and then said, "I dont know." He didn't ask if he should go find out but just stared at me with confusion. I then said we will just sit at a booth. He walked us passed several open booths near the window to then seat us in the very back corner right by the kitchen entrance. Trying to be positive I thought to myself maybe it was this servers turn to get a table and figured we would get our food faster sitting by the kitchen. We then asked one of the servers of it was happy hour and they didn't know either. You would think they would know, but I guess no one cares about making sales.  Our server comes up and is very polite asks us if we knew what we wanted to drink. We order a water and a Bloody Mary. When the Bloody Mary finally comes it looks as if the top 1/3 was just water. Mixed it and it still looked and tasted terrible. We then ordered food. I ordered the crispy crispers with double fries instead of fries and corn on the cob and she orders a margarita flatbread salad with the dressing on the side. The server brings out her salad and says, "I'm so sorry but the kitchen didn't put the dressing on the side. If you want I can take it back and they can just pull of the salad and replace it." My girlfriend didn't want to be rude or waste any food so she opted to keep it. And of course there was too much dressing and it wasn't they way she wanted it. My food didn't come for another 6-7 minutes. When it did the server puts it down and says, "oh looks like they put the corn there as well but there are definitely two sides of fries there" That was definitely not two sides of fries. I look at the plate and it's the wrong kind of chicken. I ask the server if this is what I ordered, knowing it was not. She replied, "Oh yah I think they changed the batter and that's how it's made now but I will double check" She comes back about 5 mins later saying sorry and that I can keep that but they will bring out my original order in just a few minutes. 6-7 more minutes pass and they finally bring the chicken that I ordered still with only one side fries and another corn on the cob. By this time we both have lost our appetite by having such a bad experience we box up our food and leave. And of course on our way out the host just stares at us and doesn't say anything as we leave. Definitely will not be going back again.
Another day watching football and Keli attending to our refreshment needs with a great attitude and a smile
Need a charge up? Chili's has phone outlets and delicious margaritas to enjoy while watching a game at the bar
Great service. Karen our server is fun, fast, and friendly. We had an enjoyable time. Mahalo!

This review is for the excellent customer service we received at this location from both our server and the manager on the midday-shift last Saturday. So, my husband and I ordered drinks from the bar while waiting for our redeemed offer from Yelp, the check in deal of a free order of chips and queso. He got a beer and me, a strawberry patron margarita. Well, upon his first sip, my husband noticed a rough edge that almost cut his lip open. Upon further inspection of the glass, we noticed that the cup was chipped. We immediately waved down a server to transfer the remaining beer into another glass. She apologized and went off to do the exchange. We weren't trying to make it a big deal or anything, so when the manager came out to serve the newly filled chilled glass and personally apologize for the incident himself, it was a nice surprise. He even filled it all the way to the top with freshly drafted beer instead of just transferring the original fill to another cup. After that, we were waited on by both server and manager as if we were some VIP guests for the duration of our meal. They both really made this visit a pleasant one considering it could have been a negative experience had they not handled the incident well. Then, this review would have turned out completely different! But, instead it's left on a positive note thanks to the well-trained staff at this location. Good job on keeping your customers happy :)

Great service and attention from waitress. Drinks never allowed to get more than half empty before they were refilled. Free chips and salsa from Yelp check in were super fresh and came out piping hot and crispy. Really good and free refills throughout your meal. Egg rolls were delicious as usual and fresh. Everyone's meal was delicious with great plating and service. Although a chain we all know they are always run differently but this one gets high marks.  Bathrooms super clean as well which always  tells a lot about a restaurant.
This place is awesome and the server karen is great! I love being able to get free queso dip by checking in online with yelp! The margaritas are da bomb! I love the el nino or platinum presidente. :)

Ok, service has gotten even worse!  Today, the waiter seemed flustered even though the restaurant wasn't full!  Took a long time to acknowledge us, forgot several items in our order, and did not refill our waters.  Come on, up your service training game!

This place is awesome! Always friendly service and it has become a place to go watch the games on Sunday.
