We have had Karen as our server at the Pearl City location and we're presently surprised to have her again! She's always on top of it, letting us know the status on our order with a friendly attitude. Attentive without being obnoxious, the is for another awesome Sunday!
Portion is very small.... and French fries were junk- cold and old. For the friendly staff I give additional one star. Chicken was tough and dry. Tortilla is junk.

Located in the shopping complex of Kahala Mall, we decided to stop here tonight for dinner, since we were in the area. As expected, the ambience is very American Bar Casual.  It's also very loud, and we had to shout in order to communicate with the hostess.  We had to wait for a bit, as this was during the dinner rush, and it was quite busy.   We started off with the guacamole, which they prepare near your table.  The guacamole was well, guacamole.  Nothing special, but definitely not bad.  It's a great appetizer to munch on, while chit-chatting with the rest of the folks in your party.   For my main entree, I ordered the chicken enchiladas.  The chicken enchiladas confused me, especially since the plate itself was HOT.  You could've melted plastic on it!  The waitress even handed it to me using a pot holder.  However, when I cut into it, the enchiladas were cold.  Not ice-cold, but they were definitely not hot or warm.  I notified the waitress of this, in which she apologized and offered to take it back for me.  When the food came back, this time the rest of the enchiladas were hot, and so was the rice.  I guess their microwave decided to work again.   All in all, don't waste your time here, unless there's nothing else in the area to eat.  The food tastes as if it's from frozen, and it appears that all they do is heat a plate and throw the frozen food on there.  I mean, the plate's hot enough to defrost the food anyway.

My mom, grandma, and I often come to this location on Saturdays for lunch.  It's near where my grandma lives and we often have a discount that I'm urging to use.  The service varies...sometimes quick and sometimes obnoxiously slow.   B. Kaulana is THE server to have whenever you visit here.  She is absolutely amazing!  We don't come here every week, nor do we have her every visit...yet somehow she manages to memorize our exact order everytime we come!  She is always on top of it and very hospitable whenever we visit.  There is no other server there like her.   Discounts: 1.  Are you signed up to receive Chili's emails?  If you're not, you're missing out!  The first email they send you will give you a coupon for a free chips and salsa/guacamole/queso.  Emails that are sent to you after that are often for free appetizers, desserts, or kid's meals.  The junk part is that most of the time the discounts are only good from Monday - Thursday.  Every once in a while you'll get a weekend discount.  This past weekend, I actually got a text from Chili's and received a free appetizer coupon through the text.  Didn't get it through email.   2.  Do you have an iDcard?  I like to use this discount card whenever I'm craving Chili's, but they didn't send out a coupon in an email.  The iDcard gives you $5 off a purchase of $25.  Don't know what the iDcard is?  What planet are you from?!?!?  Check out   for more details.  You're missing out on some great deals! Whenever we come here, I always order the regular guacamole and chips.  Yum, yum, yum!  It also comes with salsa.  My mom and I also order the California Turkey Club.  We split it and they are always nice to put our order on two separate plates so we don't have to split it ourselves.  We usually get a side order of sweet potato fries, which are usually delicious...but on this visit, we were told that they discontinued the sweet potato fries.  WHAT?!?!?!??!  That's the reason for a drop in stars.  Boo to you Chili's!  Our server even said that it's a popular item, but they still discontinued it.  Bring it back!  I don't even mind paying the extra $0.50 for it!   If you pay with a credit card, the servers are instructed to tell you to pay with the Ziosk machines that are left on your table.  These machines are a fancy distraction for those who patron the establishment.  You can pay to play games or use other various apps on the machine.  It's like a tablet.  I think these things are a waste of table space, but I can see the convenience.  Just swipe and your receipt is printed out.  There's also a tool that allows you to calculate the tip for you.  The junk thing about these receipts though is that they don't register on my Shoparoo app that gives me points for places that I spend money.  For some reason, whenever I take a picture of my receipts from these Ziosk machines, Shoparoo says it's an invalid receipt.  I never had this issue with the regular checks I used to get.
I was never really a fan of Chilis. I am now. The food is good. The service is better than it was a year ago. And they make the best pickles!
Always have a great time at Chilis. Karen, our server, was so welcoming and sweet! Would definitely recommend this spot for tasty eats. Don't forget to check-in and get free chips and queso!

The last time I wrote a review I have really bad service from the server who no longer works at Chili's now things have been so much better since the other bartender Jerry saw me out at another restaurant in town and insisted that I come back I've been back for several months now and it's the Chili's that I remember. So grateful for Jerry talking to me and bringing me back because Chili's is one of my favorite spots I'm from Texas and all so it feels like home I want to thank the the manager Alicia and Jerry

My family and I had lunch at the Kahala Chili's after the funeral service for my grandfather. I ordered the Cajun pasta with grilled chicken, and the crispy asparagus as an appetizer. The crispy asparagus was particularly good and I highly recommend it. I was also able to redeem a free chips and queso through the Yelp app, which was nice. Our waitress Karen was very friendly and attended to all our needs. Kahala Chili's is a great choice for lunch if you're in the area.

It started from when we opened the doors, we were happily greeted by the hostess in which I believe her name is Delaney. She was so kind and had such good energy. She quoted us 15-20 min. And every five minutes would let customers (including us) know where we stood and how much longer we would wait. I seen so many customers come in and out and all had no problems with the wait due to the excellent customer service. Next, our server was the sweetest and funniest too. Our food took a bit long, due to the large amount of people, and our server kept our glasses full and kept us up to date with our meals. I believe his name was Timmy. It was probably one of the best experiences I've had at a restaurant in a long time.

I haven't been to chilis in a while and was delighted to know from a friend that you can get free queso with a yelp check in. Score! This compliments the chips and salsa very well! My friend ordered the table side guacamole and I must say that was the best guacamole ever! I must say service could have been quicker but as a large group walking in a half hour before closing, they did an awesome job in accommodating us. The watermelon cooler was nice, strong enough but not too strong for a "light weight" like myself (not real weight, lol!).  The chicken enchillda with sour cream was also really yummy as was the taco. The tostada wasn't anything special and probably wouldn't chose that one again for the pick 2 or 3 mexican dish. It's a good place for a large group and they even allowed us to get separate checks for all 15 of us. Thank you Chilis Kahala!

Child's is a restaurant that the people of Hawaii wanted to come to the islands. Ever since, I have gone dozens of times. The ambiance is very bright and loud. Some seats are fitted with hanging overhead lamps that are just too bright to enjoy the food.  The food is so consistent with great taste, but the service is not. Lately visiting the Kahala Restaurant, the kitchen seems to be backed up allowing the food to come out slow. The waiters seem frustrated and over worked. We dined on a Sunday night around 8pm and it was horrible.  I hope this is not a trend, and hope that the service is going to improve some day.  As for the food

A last minute work meeting brought me to Chili's. It was dinner time and the place was packed. We found an open table in the bar area and as soon as we sat down Senichi, our sever, came over to say hi and to wiped the table down. Senichi has waited on us before and remembered us and was so friendly and attentive even though the restaurant was swamped. He took our drink orders and brought us water right away. We ordered table side guacamole and it is excellent! We said we liked spicy food and he brought us fresh jalapeños and extra chilis. Dinner was delicious and the service was quick with a smile. I normally don't order dessert but I was craving something sweet and went for the cookie skillet. YUM! They were out of spoons so we ate with forks which was fine, they did the job. When we were done Senichi brought the check and noted that since we are good regular customers that they comped our dessert! How sweet! In a nutshell, great experience, friendly staff and good comfort food!

Rough Monday Night? Had to head down to Chilis for a round of beer and some good eats! My fiancé and I were instantly greeted at the door and seated within a minute. We sat at the back near the kitchen and bathroom which was fine for us. Our server, Kevin was so great. He attended to us, he gave us extra napkins, refills on water timely and got us exactly what we ordered. Yes some of this may sound like that's what he is suppose to do but he did it on point. We have been getting pretty bad customer service at some locations, so to get amazing customer service here after a really rough day at work was good for us. We ordered drinks, southwestern egg rolls, a burger and pasta. Everything was delicious! Chilis has always been a favorite but coming back again and getting the outstanding experience we got reminded us why we love them so much. Kevin was so great to even call over a manager right away to help us establish if we paid our bill since the machine on the table didn't print out a copy of our receipt. Everything went through and we had our resolution in minutes and we were on our way to enjoy the mall and each other's company. Thanks Kevin! Hope we get to have you as our server again soon! :)
Wow hot day ice cold beer good food  and Kelly and Faye  are great   Sony open on new big tv fantaslic

Our waitress was very helpful, friendly and accommodating (5 stars for service). The three star rating is for the food, as it was not up to our standards. The plates were messy with other types of food on it (i.e we found some pieces of pasta on our burger plate). Also, the chips, and fried chicken tenders were just drenched in oil. The kitchen needs to step up their game. Other than the food, great customer service from the floor staff.
The food is good, just don't get burgers. The last time I went I did and regret it. Also expect to wait for your food. the service is slow.

We had great service from our waiter Kevin on June 10, 2016. They need more workers like him.  The hostess needs training, the first person we met is you. No smile nothing, I even tried to start small talk how the restaurant looked great now still nothing. I'm sorry if you're having a bad day but try not to bring it to work or show it. Too bad I didn't get her name.
We always get Karen as our waitress!  She is so nice and helpful!   Prime rib tacos are the best!   But if she recommends anything,  jus get it.

My kids and I love chilis.   They have a nice selection for the kids and healthy items for adults too.   Our latest experience was exceptional.   Our food took awhile to get to us.  The manager approaches me and said because the order is taking too long she comped us a dessert.  Then my sons kids meal took longer than expected so she comped that meal  too. Didn't expect these thing to be done.  A simple apology was enough for us.   Thanks chilis for great customer service.

i had a terrible experience with chilis in aiea but i gave it another chance but the one in Kahala instead because i was hungry and with some friends we decided to go and try it again. and i have to say I'm glad i did because it was a totally different experience and i really enjoyed the atmosphere at this location

I'm irritated. I go to the pearl ridge chilis often and am treated so well there. Today I came to this location for lunch with my girlfriend. Got the check in offer. After waiting 20 mins for it I approached the bar where the manager was using the computer. He looked at me and walked off. I asked the host to check on the queso or ask our server. The manager then came over and said oh chicken crispers? Uh no we didn't get out ap. We have shit to do today. It's been over 30 mins and still no queso. He offered to take care of it but it's already free sooooooo...? I'll stick to the pearl ridge location

For the most part the food is good and tastes great! The last time I went they messed up two of my three items but did graciously replace them. The service is notoriously slow even when it is only slightly busy. But the worst part about this location is two fold. They don't use the Rewards Program to gain points on your meals AND they don't take online orders either on the website or the app. If you like Chili's food and you aren't in a hurry, hit this place up!

Kind of irritating when I use my "Yelp check in" offer for free queso and chips and they charge me for it . . . even more irritating when I use the Ziosk to pay and don't catch it until my emailed receipt comes a day later.  I know I should look closer at my bill before paying, so that's on me.   As seems to be par for the course for all Chilis these days, service is lackluster and slow.  Kind of a bummer because I like Chilis.  So, I rarely go there anymore.   But the food is decent and portions always consistent.  The Ziosk helps expedite the usual wait for the check to come, so that helps.  Just need to step up the drink refills and you can earn an extra star, Chilis!

We were pleasantly surprised with the taste and quality of the food. Service by Rachel at the Kahala store was above and beyond- friendly, helpful, cheerful and efficient. GM Alicia was equally friendly and helpful. Will definitely be coming back often.
Excellent place to come for lunch dates. The atmosphere is perfect for family and friends to talk story, enjoy some good food, and enjoy each others company. Our server Karen was the best!
We had Karen as our server and she was quick and attentive! Our guac got there in like 45 seconds. Thanks Karen!
Our server Karen, was awesome! If I could give our experience 6 stars I would. Great service, great food, we will be back!

We recently went here on Monday afternoon, the place wasn't crowded. Our waiter was very patient with us, (we were a party of 8) and for most of us this was our first time in a Chili's restaurant. There were so many choices to choose from, it took us awhile to decide what we wanted to order. In the meantime our waiter takes our orders for drinks, he brings four of us ours, then we ask where the rest of the drinks are, and he says the bartender is making them, um......the missing drink was a coke, how hard is it to make that? My niece ordered a budlite-rita (a margarita with a little bud light bottle stuck in the drink)...as the waitress is bringing it to the table she spills the drink not on one but two of us...by then half the drink is gone, and she plops it on the table and walks away....I told my niece to be sure to tell the waitress that she will only pay for half the drink since  that's all that was left in the cup! Anyway, back to the food, I had the chicken quesadilla which was really delicious, my son had the bacon burger sliders, my brother had the ribs, which he said was ok, but for the price should've been a lot better. My sisters had the salad one said it was really delicious, the other said it was ok! The chips and salsa were really good.We also ordered the spinach artichoke dip, which seemed a bit pricey and we didn't get any chips or bread to eat with it, so I am not quite sure why they call it a dip if there is nothing to dip with...Overall the service was ok..food was ok.

Came here for dinner last week and the service/food has changed since our last trip. They have new machines - which I thought were just for video games - but turns out you can order and pay your tab. The server who was watching our table was fast and helpful despite having so many other tables to watch over.  We ordered tacos and the appetizer trio - both were really good. We also ordered a side of fries that were really salty and very small portion wise. Nothing really bad but they also gave me a shrimp taco when I ordered chicken and I believe the pork. The food was good so no real complaints here.  Glad things have changed and we'll be back again.

Chili's is an awesome quick and easy eatery and safe! They have almost any type of American food you can think of! I had the quesadilla salad explosion which was amazing if you are a salad eater. There was chicken, cheese, tomatoes, corn, and four pieces of cheese quesadilla. I tried their new Arnold Palmer drink with strawberry which is unlimited and refreshing.  At the Kahala location there is a touch screen pad where you can look at a short menu, play games ( if you pay), and even pay your bill!  I love coming to Chili's because it never fails me!

I was very, very impressed by their service. Our server and all the servers are proactive and focused on the customer's needs. I ordered a prime rib/rib eye, which was overcooked (I wanted rare). I told the server, who took it right away and said they would redo it. The manager stopped at our table to apologize as well. A few minutes later, the manager came out and made sure we were happy with the meat. He also made a fresh bowl of mashed potatoes as a freebie. Very good food and fantastic service!!! Games at the table are fun, too!

Called in a phone order they said will take 30 minutes to prepare by the time I got there 30 minutes later it still took them another 30 minutes to get me my order so overall it takes them an hour to do anything manager there is totally incompetent just standing around in the back the whole time I asked about my food
Wanted to come and have a good and fulfilling meal and Chili's was the spot that we chose. Jerry was our server. He was very friendly and prompt! Food was excellent as well.

This chilis is one of our favorite go to places, especially for takeout. Unfortunately they took off their sweet and smokey burger, which is my boyfriends favorite but when I mentioned it to the manager she offered to make us some of their signature mango bbq sauce to keep at home while they still had the ingredients! The customer service is great here and their takeout procedures have improved a lot since I first started coming here.

Had to go somewhere new for NFL Sunday so we decided to try Chilis in Kahala. Had all the games going, not crowded, and the prices beat our regular spot by half. Our waitress Karen was also fabulous and helpful. Will definitely be coming back next Sunday!

I don't know what it is about Chili's but I keep wanting to go back....three visits in almost six months! I took my mom there on her birthday at the end of December.  I had a newborn and my two year old and it was a very busy saturday night.  The host/hostess gave us a perfect table in the corner where there was plenty of space to put the baby carrier.  The service was really excellent and we left happy. I went for drinks about two weeks ago.  It was not busy at all.  Our server just really sucked.  She would disappear for long periods of time.  My friend had to ask several times for things.  And really...if someone orders coffee, isn't cream and sugar on the side kind of obvious??  My friend waited so long her coffee got cold and she asked for another cup and omg the server did not like that, what attitude!!   Sadly, I will go back again to this one but just hope I don't get the same server!!
Hubby's birthday! Jessica goes above and beyond!  Amazing reason always checking in customers!  Love a Kahala Chilis for that reason!  Blessed!
Server is friendly. To be continued after I have a taste of my food. Ordered quesadilla explosion salad. Waiter was pleasant and helpful. Will definitely go back to this chillies.
excellent food and svc (server was Karen)!  I had the old timer burger...grass fed patty...SUPER FLAVORFUL!!

Wrote this review especially because our server Felicia was awesome! She answered any questions that we had with ease, clear knowledge, and even recommendations. She was super friendly and attentive. For example, after she dropped off the food, I was about to ask for napkins, but she was back in two seconds with some. I was impressed. Plus, the food was tasty! We had chicken wings that were yummy. The free chips from checking in were great as well. Definitely would return! Thank you!

This Chilis never disappoints!  As expected the food and drink are great and on top of that, the service is top notch.  This is a great place for dinner with the family or hanging out with friends.  The atmosphere in the lounge reminds of a sports bar, except that Chilis is cleaner and has better food.  It seems like there is always new menu items to try, which, is great as we go there often and never get tired of the food.  On all of our visits, the servers were very welcoming and professional.  Thanks to the host staff, servers, chefs, bartenders, and managers, we have yet to have a bad experience.  If you have a party of ten or more, you can call ahead and make a reservation.  Also, if you are looking for a part time job you can check out their job info online.  A very big Mahalo to everyone at chilis Kahala!  5-stars all around!

Servers name is Jessica very rude... refused to do simple tasks and spoke with an attitude. Poor trainee looked confused as even thiugh she was new she knew Jessica's actions were not professional. BOH staff did great food was awesome! Too bad service is crappy won't bevgohu back to that place ....

Love dining at Kahala Chili's.  We frequent here often and have always received great service and GOOD food!   Tonight in particular we were helped by Felicia (I think she may be a supervisor).  Outstanding customer service!  She was very genuine and had a great attitude start to finish.  Hard working too.  She definitely is a rock star! The food was delish as usual.  We shared a triple dipper and got the spinach artichoke dip too.  Yum, yum, yum!  We had room for dessert and shared the chocolate chip cookie skillet.  My tummy was a happy  camper. Chili's is my go to 'happy place' for comfort food, drinks and a good time!
Always great service, great food, and great vibes! Karen was our waitress and was awesome!! Love the chili's Hawaii crew!!!

I had originally given this restaurant 2 stars bc they refused my $10 off email, but then the manager came and apologized and gave us a free appetizer AND dessert, worth more than the $10. So that was nice. 5 stars for good service and a really friendly manager

We are regulars at this place. I tell you what. Every payday we treat ourselves out to Chili's because the customer service is SO amazing! They are so great, and you can't beat the prices. But thats not all.. First- The food and drink. I am a vegetarian, like super hardcore strict vegetarian. I absolutely cannot have any meat or meat broth in my food or I get super nauseous. So, because of that I often times find it hard to eat out. I can say this establishment is very vegetarian-friendly. I either order a meatless flatbread, black bean burger, meatless cajun pasta, or a burrito without meat. They accommodate my needs so well. With the burrito, they will put it extra vegetables (including avocados) to replace the meat. The beers are great, I recommend having a beer -or 4- during happy hour, just don't drink and drive, please! I love to go there and watch the games during football season. By the way, the Molten Lava Cake is bomb. Seriously, get it, you won't be sorry. Customer Service! They are awesome. There has been 3 times where my family has gone and my husband's hamburgers was undercooked or my flatbread was burnt. They are so quick to correct that. Just recently my husband's burger was underdone, we let our waiter know, and he came back with his manager not even 5 minutes later and they gave us 50% off his entree, we were genuinely surprised. We gave the 50% they took off the entree back in a tip, pay it forward a little bit. There has been times where I was in tears at the booth (bad news that day) and they helped turn that around. I could go on and on about their customer service, but I won't. Atmosphere. They recently renovated, and the ambiance is great. The booths are chairs are beautiful. You can come in and immediately feel relaxed. I also enjoy sitting outside -when the weather permits-. They have live music (on Fridays?) and it's a really great feel aside from being on a road of a busy mall, and that's totally okay. Great place, I recommend it to anyone who's looking for a good time and a place that is willing to accommodate YOU.

Kind of disappointed with the service her. I ordered a chicken taco.  I received a salmon taco. When I told my server she leaned over my plate and told me "yeah that's chicken".  The texture wasn't like chicken and very fishy. Didn't want to make a big deal so I didn't argue.  Our waitress was focused more on her friends that were at the table next to us. The food was good, just wasn't thrilled that she told me its chicken not knowing what I tasted.

A few of my friends and I have visited this Chili's on several occasions and we've had decent food/service.  But it's never a great experience, just OK.  This visit they forgot someone's soup until after her dinner had already arrived and some of our food was already cold.  I ordered the fajitas and the plate wasn't sizzling at all (did they change that for safety reasons?).  We also tried the flatbread pizzas and weren't impressed.  You'll definitely get better pizza elsewhere. One positive - the server was great at keeping our drinks refilled.

Practical Tex-Mex entrees and appetizers that neither represent traditional Mexican cuisine nor disrespect the style it apes. This place is slight on service. Not bad, not good. Typically busy on weekdays and week nights due to the active and somewhat rowdy bar area. Most of the food is greasy and heavy, filled with the same ingredients in just about every 40-odd items on the menu. No matter what you get I promise it will be what the next guy ordered across the room, just in a different casing or style, fried or grilled, smothered or rubbed.

I love the triple play...the chicken wings are the best i've tasted in a long time! Our server Kaulana is the best..very professional. She always make our experience enjoyable and pleasant!! Thank you!

Love that Chili's is a consistent spot for grabbing a bite and drink with friends. Also good for groups of people too - especially when at the Kahala location where there are few options for dining.   On this particular night, we rolled in with a group of 6 and were able to get seats right away. Our server was friendly though a little scattered, but I noticed she was covering a lot of tables.  We were there for drinks and pupus - for the most part it was great.  I especially like the chips and salsa here, yumm! I think they make the chips in house, they are light and fresh, while the salsa isn't too spicy so its good for everyone. Anyway, the bummer this night was that a friend ordered a drink, when it arrived she thought it didn't have any alcohol in it.  A couple of us tasted it too and confirmed that it didn't taste like it had any alcohol (you know, us being experts on the matter).   When we told the waitress her response was, "Oh....." then she walked away!! Hmm, could have been handled better than that!! Lame.
Great experience last night with our takeout order! The Santa Fe Salad and Ultimate Bacon Burger were delicious! Will be back very soon.

I come here  the time and just wanted to say that Alex provides awesome customer service!! He was very friendly and funny and was very on top of taking care of us- He brought refills and food orders quickly and really made our dining experience a great one!!!
Thank you Shaye for the amazing, friendly, and caring service!!

Came in after. A hike around 1pm for lunch...generally a place like this is the same experience you had the last yime, but this was not the case. We were seated at a dirty table, despite the fact that the restaurant was almost empty, and our server took forever to greet us or take our drink order. There were 3 of us and we all got very simple lunch orders, but she forgot about my soup and salad! So by the time my food arrived my friends were nearly done with theirs. I've been to this location before and the service was great and so was the food, I honestly believe we just got a crummy server this time.

I only come to Chili's when I feel like drinking their Mango Patron Margarita.. Yumz! Thank you bffc for introducing me to that drink. It's so cute that they serve it in a Patron bottle.. too bad you can't take it home though.. I've only come for their drinks and their molten lava cake.. if you had a long day at work or just want to unwind and not care about calories for that moment.. that is my place to go!

The bar is a great place to seat yourself, grab some drinks for happy hour, and get a bite to eat! Fridays are pretty busy so come early if you have a big party. Service is great like any other franchise, but the atmosphere is chill. Sports tvs are set up throughout the whole restaurant. After finishing off your meal, you've got to try the molten chocolate cake or the peanut butter cookie skillet.  Another thing you've got to try is the Table-side guacamole. The freshness of the veggies just hits the spot.

Such good service and such amazing food, it was absolutely perfect for the cold weather. Jessica was our server and she wasn't too nosey but knew exactly when to come and ask if we were okay and to clear our table.

The service here was terrible. Host was ok. So we got guacamole and salsa and it was very good but then we go through our drinks very quickly and no one came to fill them until we asked like a while later. Our server only saw us twice and felt like she was in a rush. Our long for waited food was unimpressive. I ordered ribs and mash and it just looked plopped on a metal tray. Like where are the plates?!? The trays looked something from a cafeteria so they could save money and not like I was eating at a great restaurant. My sister got a salad that looked like it just came out of the bag and did not taste good. The picture in the menu had different lettuce on it and avocados so my sis was like where are the avocados?? We later got avocados on a plate and it looked sad. Very slim small slices also turning brown. Also the bathrooms looked nice but were not well maintained like there was no toilet paper or paper towels so my mom didn't know what to do. Overall, bad experience. We used to come here a lot when we were younger but service to food has just gone down.

For some reason my friends and I were craving Chili's the other day. After being seated at another restaurant, we up and left because one of us mentioned going to Chili's. Ten minutes later, we were in Kahala walking through the double doors. This is one of those places where you get exactly what you think you're going to get--nothing more, nothing less. I actually take that back, this time one of the waiters totally dropped a huge tray of food on the floor.

Great lunch! Gerry was the bartender, happy & easy going. Only had an hour for lunch, he made sure food came out quickly and checked to make sure everything was great. Ordered triple dipper and loaded boneless wings. It's was delicious. Will be back for sure.

Sitting at the airport on the way home and thinking back to all the great times in Hawaii. One of the best was visiting Chili's in Kahala. We had such an amazing time there thanks to the fantastic food and the staff, who were so much fun. When they found out it was our first visit to a Chili's they made sure our visit was so special. The Guac burger is the best burger I have had, ever. The guacamole was just so fresh and spicy. Mmmm - I'd love one right now, along with a killer Presidente Margarita. Please say a big thanks to the staff who made it such a special occasion. I can't remember all their names, but if it helps we visited on Monday 31st July. Karen was our server, and she made sure everything was perfect. Even the managers (Rachel and ???Katie - blonde with glasses) came out to make sure we had everything we wanted and to thank us for visiting Chili's. Thank you everybody - Chili's is now my go-to destination restaurant for every trip I take.
You pretty much get what you expect from Chili's.  Although we tend not to go there for food...we go for the drinks. Presidente margarita all the way!
We love coming here once in awhile for their chips and salsa - endless amount and the salsa is addictive! The kids enjoy coming here and the portions are plenty for us to share meals.

If you've watched the 2 for $20 commercial with an appetizer and two entrees, YOU AINT FINDING IT HERE.  Got here around 545p.  It wasnt busy when we walked in but it quickly filled up, with many people from the just finished Sony open coming in. We ordered our entrees at about 550p.  We noticed some people were sat right behind us and the ordered shortly after.  600p people behind us got their food and started eating. 610p waitress says it'll be just a minute more. 620p chips and salsa brought to us on the house...still no food.  630p people behind us finish eating and leave....still waiting.  635p Manager drops off our food and apologizes for the long wait and comps our entire meal.......HOLLA!  By then we were upset and full from eating the chips and salsa. Our waitress did come by to apologize for the wait also.  They get two star for comping our meal and doing the correct protocol for this.  BTW the food was just average.

I've been a loyal long time customer of this Chili's but I don't want to go back now because of one bartender in particular. I would say  her name but she never even introduced herself to us so all I can do is describe her. She has short hair, tattoos on her arm and is Asian.  She asked us for our drink order and  I got my usual the presidente margarita and it was the worst one I've ever had. After drinking half of our drinks already my husband and I had to track down the bar back to get someone to order for us and it wasn't even that busy! She totally forgot about us. Then after we were done with our meal I put a gift card down to pay. When she came over to pick up the tab she saw the gift card and she grunted as if it was a big hassle for her. (Hey not my fault I was given a gift card) So again she disappears until we finally get her attention to cash us out.  She had an attitude from when we arrived to when we left. We don't know why she had such a bad attitude  when my husband and I were nothing but pleasant with her. All we wanted was a quick and simple dinner.  She acted like we were a burden and was so displeasant and rude to us I almost didn't even want to tip and I'm usually a VERY generous tipper.  Sorry if you actually have to do your job!  This is very unfortunate because Kelly the bartender I usually get is very very nice and I always give 25% and more to her and other bartenders I've had. I hope they just rid of this one bad apple and I'll come back.

The food at Chilis is always really good. But the service by Amber was superb. She was so on it and provided such outstanding customer service! She is main reason that my experience was so good! I would come back again and ask to be served by Amber. Her personality and attention to detail blew me away! Thank you for the excellent service Amber!

We wanted to celebrate the first day of 2014 with some Margaritas! So we decided to go to chili's for Happy Hour.  Once entering we were seated on the right side of the dinning area. A waitress came and took our drink and appetizer orders.  When we were almost done with our drinks and food, we wanted to order more drinks but was not sure how long happy hour was. So when we asked the waitress and she informed us that Happy Hour prices for drinks and appetizers are only good for the LEFT side of the dinning area.  - THAT'S STUPID -  I was really irritated that no one informed us about the fact that Happy Hour is only good on one half of the room. I was mad that the hostess who sat us didn't ask if we were interested in Happy Hour and I was mad at the waitress for not mentioning if we were only ordering drinks and appetizers that we should sit on the other side of the room to get better prices.  I feel that is bad customer service and makes me not want to come back here.  The Grub. [[ MAC & CHEESE $3.99 ]]   We decided to get the Southwestern mac n' cheese for an appetizer cause we just LOVE mac n' cheese!! :D The one served at Chili's is made with three cheeses, poblanco peppers and toasted bread crumbs! Super tastey! [[ NACHOS $7.99 ]]   Topped with 3-cheese blend, black beans, jalapenos. Also served with house-made pico de gallo & sour cream. We also added fresh guacamole for $1.49. I was actually surprised when this dish came out, because I was expecting, well you know a pile of chips covered in toppings. But the way this one is served was actually surprisingly good too.  [[ BOTTOMLESS TOSTADA CHIPS $4.99 ]] Extra thin corn tostada chips made fresh! These chips are surprisingly addicting. I definitely recommend getting these if you want something to share with friends.  Margarita Partyyyyyy.    [[ TROPICAL SUNRISE MARGARITA ]]   This drink is made with tequila, melon schnapps, pineapple juice and a splash of grenadine.Out of the three margaritas, this one is definitely my favorite.   [[ PLATINUM PRESIDENTE MARGARITA ]] Hand shaken tequila, orange liqeur, brandy and fresh sour. [[ PRESIDENTE MARGARITA ]]    Hand shaken tequila, orange liqueur, brandy, in a strawberry flavor (also comes in raspberry or mango).

I'm MAD! M-A-D, MAD! WITH MANY CAPITOL LETTERS "MAD"!  First Wahoo's closed, then Salt and if you think I'm going to Top of the Hill you have another thing coming... so where do I get a beer after work in Kaimuki!?!?  YOU HAVE TO BE KIDDING ME? CHILIS???  Deep fried, cheese on everything, chemically preserved food Chilis? THIS IS WHERE I'M GOING?!?!??!?!?!?!?!?!?!  So I hang my dignity hat on the hook and walk into a Chilis.  Hi kids. Hi mom and dad... oh I see Grandma is here... I'm super excited about having a beer after a hard day at work with a family argument happening a table away.  Oh good... the kids don't know where the volume knob is on their game is...  GREAT! This bar has TV'S EVERYWHERE! Even little personal ones at every table! TV'S EVERYWHERE! So relaxing! Exactly why I go out... I needed more TV in my life! Can you put mindless sports on those TV's instead of Antiques Roadshow? GREAT... THANK YOU!  Shoot me.  Seriously... shoot me.  I just want to... er... that's a really big beer you're handing me waitress!  *gulp* ...one more please...  Great... Chilis has turned me into an alcoholic. Guess I'm walking home.  *hic*

It's been a while since I've done a review. I've been going to chilis for years and even more so recently since I've turned 21. I love the new Tex Mex feel that they've added within the last couple of years, first off let me say I love their Yelp check in offer and their smothered chicken burritos.  But this review is more about their service. We were quoted a 30 minute quote but ended up waiting an hour which would have been okay if we were not skipped over for larger parties that came after us.  By the time we were seated I was ready for a margarita since it was Cinco De Mayo after all. Unfortunately my drink did not come blended even after I asked and also no joke it came in a whisky glass... I ordered the strawberry patron margarita. It was okay, no buzz and I'm the biggest lightweight on the planet. Overall I love Chilis food but this location wouldn't be my first choice. Try mililani!

Not good. I really don't know what to say.....horrible food, but the service was worse.  Details won't help me tell you how bad the meal was here.  If we didn't come here with friends I would have had a very long chat with the manager.   Food tasted bad, the order was wrong and the food wasn't hot.  The waitress never brought table settings for us to eat the food, she never refilled drinks, and she was not very efficient. The best part.....the food took forever to make it to the table. Won't be back.....ever....

Worst service!!!!!!Worst service!!!!!!Worst service!!!!!! Ruined our dinner night who 'waitress Megan-Kahala Mall'  worst ,Careless,very rude waitress we've ever   wonder these guys closed other branch in Waikiki.  1) She won't even place the water glasses on the table. She don't even care about placing coasters on the table.  2) she expects that we give order as soon as we sit down. She keeps an arrogant face when we said give us 5 mins to order. 3) she will bring all your food at once including appetizers and main course and if food plates don't fit on the table she just give it to you and you need to carry in your hands she don't even bother about to bring it back after some time.   And you you need to ask other table waitress to make it to Togo.  4)Once she delivers your food to the table thats it she won't come back again to your table until you are ready to pay , no refills n nothing. We spent $110 and all that went in to drainage still paid %15 tips I don't want be rude like her so just wrote on the check very bad service. So at least she realizes that we r not at all happy.  I have read other reviews before giving bad review most of them complain about the waiters only I think it's time  for management to realize and remove theses guys from work if they are not happily  serving people. Worst service!!!!!!Worst service!!!!!!Worst service!!!!!!

The last time we went to Chili's, the waiter spilled margarita on Cam and took forever to get us our bill. Prior to that, we waited almost 25 mins to settle our bill and get our to go food. It was a pretty bad. We had a quick family dinner here earlier last week and it was a complete change. They updated their ordering process and now have digital screens where you can order and pay your bill. It is so efficient and amazing. Our server came back and checked with us so many times that it didn't really matter that he made a mistake with our actual order. The customer service was so good that we forgot about that part lol. I usually get the appetizer trio and everything we tried was really good. I'm glad that this experience was way better than the last few times.

If you're looking for something quiet, keep in mind there is a bar side and it's not sound proof.  You can sit on the complete opposite side, but when it gets busy (evenings) it tends to get loud especially (pau hana or weekends)  When we first got there we waited about 10 minutes to have someone get waters and he wasn't even our server and in another section but once we told him we were ready to order, he became our server which was awesome!  Super grateful for that especially having 2 boys younger than 7 and hungry.   I love their buffalo chicken, the spice is awesome! The attetiveness of our server was awesome, even for water refills (rates pretty high on my importance)  and delivered when i asked for fresh unsalted chips for our chips and salsa we got that!  Molten lava cake topped it off for sure!

About what you would expect from a corporate chain restaurant. Nothing is really very good, just average at best. The so called "Mexican" food is especially lame. The burgers are also just kind of there. In regards to burgers, Chill's new advertising campaign "hamburger hippies" is the biggest load of crock I have ever seen any business try and pull off. Talk about fake authenticity, and invented history. Plus I really don't want a dirty hippie making my food anyway. Hey Chili's try this "brand" on for size. "Corporate BS since 75", at least it's accurate.

Absolute terrible service my family arrived at the restaurant at 5:30 and they said the wait was 10 minutes but almost 40 minutes later we still weren't seated and we ended up going to the much better Counter burgers across the street then my dad went back into the restaurant to say we were leaving and one of the waiters lied and said they called our family several times but we were right outside their door and we never heard them say our name I'm not returning

Been here several times with friends. It's in a convenient location, pretty good variety of Tex-Mex foods for different kinds of people (meat-lovers, veggie-lovers, pizza/burger-lovers, people on a diet or the opposite) at a reasonable price. I definitely recommend the Margarita Grilled Chicken here-- grilled chicken, topped with lime and tomatoes, over a bed of rice and beans. Also really like the triple dipper (3 appetizers and 3 dips) and the lighter choice part of the menu.  Service-wise, not bad. I haven't had any really negative experiences... so I'm a fan :)
Food is always great never had a bad service. Every time I go there I see happy faces. The host mostly always friendly.

It's a chain Tex-Mex restaurant.  There isn't anything too special about it, and as long as you know what you're getting yourself into there shouldn't be anything too disappointing here.   I do, however, like their chips and salsa that gets dropped off at your table to start things off.  They've also got a couple of the unhealthiest dishes according to some food surveys.  The Texas Cheese Fries, and  one of their big burgers, so watch out what you order here!   I usually stick to one of the salads, or the lunch special bottomless soup and salad combo whenever I come here.  The thing I like about Chili's in general are the happy hour specials that you can get in the bar area, oh, and the fact that they have a bar. I've definitely had better Mexican, and Tex-Mex at other non-chain restaurants, but it's convenient, and the service is usually pretty good, so it's A-OK in my book.

Okay, it's Chili's. You either like it or you don't... This review is for the fact that the server gave us back someone else's debit card, and thereby also gave our debit card to someone else.  Not sure if it was her first day working, even if it was, I wouldn't excuse it.  Luckily we noticed it within a couple hours of it happening, and blocked the card but the other person had tried several times to withdraw money from our account.   I called to see if maybe the card had been turned in or they had it (for some miraculous reason, I'm an optimist, what can I say!), and was on hold for about 30 minutes while the guy checked before I converted to realism and hung up the damn phone.  . The service was good, up until the point that our personal information and financials were compromised.  There's no turning back from that. Also, now begins the 7-10 business day wait until the new debit card comes in the mail.  Thanks a bunch Chili's! Can't wait to come back! *sarcasm* *sarcasm* *sarcasm*

Hands down again this location beats the west side locations!  In service, quality, cleanliness, and basically just a better overall dining experience!  I wish and hope that the PC, Waikele, and the other central and West side locations will take into consideration the same standards of higher customer service as The Kahala location.

I've always found the food to be fine. Got seated in bar-side tonight with the noisiest bunch ever. It was bad enough that they took up the whole front of the bar area, but they grouped up in different bunches to discuss things and were giving all of us a headache. There was a lot of F-bomb dropping and all kinds of sh*t being said. We like Chili's, but probably won't be back for a while. We couldn't wait to get out of there. My son almost had a drunk girl trip next to him a couple of times because she had a hard time standing. Also almost got hit with a backpack a couple of times not to mention another girl trying to join the group spilling some of her full beer mug. No idea why they allowed them to spread across halfway to the other corner that we were in. Saw some other customers leave pretty fast. Maybe we should have done the same. My 2 stars ate the average of the food(4) and the atmosphere(0). Glad we cleared out before the other party hit the road.
One of the great things about going to Chili's was the cold draft beer served in chilled mugs; however, the last two visits neither the beer or the mugs were cold.  Dissappointing
The food was amazing. The servers were very energetic and helpful especially Shay. I loved the mango iced tea and the atmosphere.

Went at 330 pm...needless to say it wasn't busy!  Food took 45 minutes to come out.  I order the chili and rice and I get a bowl of chili and rice pilaf looking crap. I finally get it a real bowl of chili and it has old dry hard rice. I don't know about you but i cannot stand eating old hard rice that gets stuck in your teeth. Server was never around to notice anything. Didn't refill water, didn't replace the endless chips and dip that was finished while waiting for our food.  He didn't notice that I didn't eat much of my food.  Leaving very disappointed!

We are always on the lookout for dinner places open late.  Tuesday night is rehearsal 'til 9pm, so anything that is open after 9 in the Kaimuki/Honolulu area is frequented by us. Chili's is open 'til 10, but they always welcome us at 9:30.  This last visit we had an awesome server who was very friendly and helpful with all our dining needs!  She even magically got us our last round of drinks when the other server said, "Bar's closed."  Liar!  The 4 stars are for our server. The food is never bad.  I love the tableside guacamole and chips & salsa.  We have had experiences where they didn't have certain items, but that's because we were there at the end of the night.  My favorite dish is the quesadilla explosion salad and the grilled salmon.

Dear Chilis, Your teeny tiny tables make it possible to not only brush against the thigh of the unsuspecting but fortunate person seated across from me, but also reach everyone's entrees with my fork.  Like. Your waitress was friendly, smart, and had cool hair.  Like. You have black bean burgers for those of us who do not eat meat.  Like. Your guacamole has large chunks of avocado.  By large chunks I mean a complete quarter avocado quietly lying in wait for the next chip victim.   Wafer thin chips + 3 inch avocado chunks = FUTILITY and DESPAIR.   I suggest you purchase thicker chips and also smash your guacamole with a fork.  Dislike.  (Dislike the despair part, not my super awesome suggestion.) The wait for our entrees took many, many valuable minutes from my life.  Time is money, so taking into consideration my extremely high hourly value that I place upon myself, forty minutes of wasted time is equivalent to at least 75 cents, possibly a whole dollar.  You owe me a dollar.  Dislike. My BBQ black bean burger was okay.  The fries were edible.  The molten chocolate cake was freakishly amazing.  Chocolatey and gooey and roll-your-eyes-back-better-than-sex deliciousness.  The best commercially produced cake that a person could ever have the pleasure of gluttonizing.  LIKE.   SIncerely, Angela

Chili's is ok.... and just ok.  Their commercials use to be about their ribs but Ruby Tuesday's Ribs are way better. Also, every time I come I feel like I spent too much money for plain tasting food.  I can spend $35 or more and I just drank water.  Food is not healthy, nothing is amazing, it's a place to come when you are bored with all the other restaurants.  On the positive side of things, the last time I went the waitress was nice and happy and she offered our table free chips and salsa. -Photo:  The salsa is actually pretty good. There was a tons of chips and it wasn't too salty but crispy and light.  Might actually be one of the better things that they serve! For appetizers my friends and I ordered the triple dipper: buffalo wings chicken crisper potato skins. -Photo:  Good combination of things. Again, nothing here stands out, and after your done you just thinking, "yah that wasn't too bad".

I vowed to never go to Chili's ever again!  Oh man but then I went back on my word and karma nipped me in the butt... it was awful. Chili's had a coupon for $20 for two draft beers, unlimited fries, and two burgers.  We checked the coupon and it did NOT say anything about "not valid in Hawaii."  We went in on a Friday night and specifically asked if it was possible to use.  The host said sure no problem because nothing about Hawaii.  So we waited our time (30 minute wait) and when we got to our table, they tried to sit us down at a booth... but we have a baby so we needed a high chair.  They told us oh well, there's no room for a high chair but it's obvious we needed one so why sit us at another table?  Hello we stated this from the beginning.  FAIL!  Okay we got seated at the table and then asked the server to check on our coupon but he was like oh it's fine doesn't say not valid in Hawaii.  So after we order our beers, then the manager decides to tell us not valid in Hawaii.  Mind you it doesn't say such a thing.  ISNGIO:SNGOINS:GOINIO:n  That was my rargle fargle by the way.  Anyway, she comps us an appetizer and a dessert.  The sampler appetizer was decent.  However my entree was a different story.  I got some kind of wrap.  But HALF of the wrap fell out when they brought it to my table.  I told the waiter and he was like oh sorry.  SERIOUSLY?  UGH.  Why did I come here?  I didn't eat because it was horrible... I gave my husband a bite and he spat it out.  Dessert was okay but it doesn't change the fact that I am NEVER coming here AGAIN.  I promise!  It was SO bad... I can't believe they didn't take the coupon and the food was terrible.  The manager was really rude on top of which even if she comped our appetizer and dessert.  I would have just given the customer the coupon discount... because it doesn't say not valid in Hawaii. Okay I learned my lesson... fool me once, shame on you... fool me twice, shame on me.  See ya Chili's!
Mega waiter! Senichi was very good and attentive. Only negative is that they ran out of guac.

Came here on a Sunday night and it was crowded. Surprisingly. The service was actually prompt and attentive. In the past service was slow. The food was good. The one negative was their new electronic device where you can order food and play games right on the device. The machine will charge you as soon as you click on a game. There is no warning that clicking a game will result in a charge. The waiter said that happens and he would make sure we weren't charged for that.
food was terrible. service sucked too. molten cake was the only good thing there. don't waste your time. go to whole foods or the counter if you're in the area.
Good, but the food was better on my previous visits.  The service was great, waitress was very friendly and very on point.

I frequent this place roughly once or twice a month, probably cause it's a chain restaurant and I know what I'm getting. Good: The food isn't too bad, of course I usually get the same thing so I'm a little limited on other items input.. The desserts are usually good. Bad: Parking is at Kahala Mall, but during busy times, it can be a pain to find a spot. Reason for this review: I sat at the bar today for lunch, the games were on tv so that was good (and expected). The service was average, nothing spectacular, but not horrible. The bad thing is where I sat (on the window side, aka town side of the bar). From here, you can notice how filthy nasty (see picture) the bar area is, enough to not want any beverages. This place definitely needs a good scrubbing. I will eat there again, but now I know where NOT to sit..

Nothing fresh or local about this place. I only came here a couple times cause this chick I know lives close by and like to drink here. Drinks are mediocre, food is terrible. I can see going here if you hate your mouth, or if your mouth was injured in the war, or if you have a personal vendetta against flavor.  Other than that, you best stay away. I Crush Your Head!

Really wanted to give 0 stars. Probably THE WORST dining experience ever!  Service was horrible, the server who knew we were there because he was looking straight at us, decided to continue talking to his table that he was serving for a good 10 mins before he decided to even greet us. It was so bad that I honestly thought that maybe he had clocked out already and was just chatting with some regulars. When we asked the hostess who was our server I wanted to leave when she pointed to him..we were one of three tables in the whole restaurant!!management was very complacent when we had to finally talk to him about our food. the food....words cannot describe..the steak was like beef jerky (we asked for med rare) and this platter looked like the anorexic version of the one pictured in the menu. Our yelp check-in chip and salsa thingy took 20 mins to come out and we barely got a glass of water. Never going there again. Chilis should just close up shop already....

Service is very slow. I ordered the Triple Dipper appetizer and it took over 30 minutes for nothing to arrive. I finished two glasses of iced tea before my appetizer arrived. My Triple Dipper arrived and it was lukewarm. Five minutes later, it was cold. Then my southwest quesadilla was served hot. Why couldn't my appetizer come out freshly made like this? Is the kitchen slow? Or, is my waitress slow? Time to leave this place. I recommend going to the Chili's at the Pearl Ridge Mall. This one is not worth the bad service and quality of food.

The two managers go out of their way to make sure I'm being taken care of.  Maybe because they know I'm an actor.  LOL.  I pretty much order the same thing every time.  Texas Cheese Fries for starters and Triple Dipper for my entrée.  For dessert it's the Skillet Chocolate Chip Cookie with scoop of vanilla ice cream.  I always ask for Lisa as my server, she's the best.

This place is full of crap please excuse my language but I don't have any other way to describe this restaurant. We went in and weren't even really greated then me and my family was sat at a dirty table I had to ask for the table to be wiped off. The host wipe my table while I wipe the food of the booth sit then we sat down. I just spent $65.68 on a meal that didn't tase good at all. First we ordered chips with spinach artichoke dip it was brought to our table it was ok it would of been better if the dip was a little hotter meaning temperature. It was more on the cooler side when it should be on the warm side. I also ordered a salad it was a joke the salad fell flat the vegetables were not crisp it was like eating a bunch of vegetables that were old or left out to lose it's freshness. Then I ordered a full rack of original ribs with corn on the cob, mashed potatoes with gravy and a side of fully loaded mashed potatoes for my daughter me and my daughter shared the ribs which even that was a joke. The ribs were over cooked to the point it taste like I was eating jerky the flavor was horrible I couldn't even eat it so I put it to the side. I was able to eat the mashed potatoes with gravy and the corn on the cob. My husband kind of enjoyed what he ordered which was some kind of chicken tenders he said it was ok but he would have gotten the sauce on the side instead of having it put on. I literally spent $65.68 just to eat ok mashed potatoes and a corn on the cob because the rest of the meal was literally a joke. I should have stayed home and cooked dinner but I figured I eat out since it was my birthday but boy was this restaurant a disappointment. I definitely will not be eating here again and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. It's a waste of money. :-(

Today, I brought in a large group of students -- something that many restaurants make difficult because they require deposits or have to settle on a "fixed" menu.  Not Chili's at Kahala Mall!  They were fine about my team of students ordering off the menu.  They also allowed us to make the reservation far in advance for our group of 25 so that we would not have to wait when we arrived.  Other restaurants would not allow that on a busy Saturday during lunch. Food variety was excellent and satisfied the many picky teens amongst our group. We coaches ordered and split some soft tacos, crazy quesadilla salad, and fajitas (steak and pork) -- served on a hot platter -- those sizzling green peppers and onions were divine! I brought in a celebratory cake and they were so courteous to put it immediately in their large refrigerator. Food was hot, prompt and the manager, Ricardo Muniz, kept checking on us, along with their staff. Thank you all.  They made our team gathering stress free.  We will be back after tourney next time!

Lunch today was fantastic. Our server, James, was excellent. He exhibited the CAN DO attitude that made our lunch experience a good one. This is the second time we had James as our server and in both occasions the service was 5-Stars. Every restaurant should have a James type employee. It makes eating out a joy.  Thank you, James, for another great lunch experience.  Larry Yamamoto

Had a really good meal good ambience the restaurant was crowded! My fiancé had the steak burrito it was really tasty and I had a Mex chicken chipotle salad bowl hold the rice!The restaurant was packed we were seated promptly and her food came out in a very timely manner the coffee made fresh tasted good! Brooke was our waitress she was knowledgeable of the menu and bubbly like a flying bubbling brook!!!

Excellent service and the food was excellent. The only thing I was a little annoyed was the slow service by the hostess on seating us. The hostess needed to know better what tables are ready for service. She started to clean one table for us, but failed to look in the back and there was a few booths already cleaned. When she finally realized the other gleaned booths, she then took us to one of them instead.

Ehhhhhhhhhhhh. Idk if it's just this chilis because the chilis I've tried out in pearlridge and Mililani were better than this one. I came here on a Friday night with my bf and there was a 20 minute wait. Understandable as it was a busy Friday night. The hostess was REALLY friendly, i don't think i've ever seen such a happy hostess lol.  I ordered their bottomless mango tea, VERY GOOD! I really like their tea! Probably the only good thing.  I ordered the lean sirloin with broccoli and side mac & cheese. Wow. The portions were so tiny. For $16 it wasn't that much at all. My mac & cheese was also COLD! :( I told the server and she got me another one pretty quickly. After eating everything I wasn't full at all. At $25 I should definitely be full.  The service however was good. My waiter was helpful and she was nice. She looked flustered though probably because her section was slammed.  EHHH. I don't think I'm gonna come back to this particular chilis location....maybe the other ones but not this one.

I tried to give Chili's Kahala Mall a chance after numerous times of messing up our takeout orders, and well I'm regretting it now. Never order the sweet and Smoky Burger if you're not into bacon like I am not. I ordered the sweet Smoky Burger without bacon and low and behold when I open up my order it was full of bacon. I spent the beginning of my meal I was hungry for doing a bacon excavation project then finally I found my burger. I said no bacon and it was almost like a joke with the way they went off on the bacon. Other than that the burger was bland and dry, I was very disappointed. I was thinking where is the sweet and spicy part? If I wanted a regular bacon burger I would have ordered that, and that's not what I ordered. If Chili's could put the energy they have on their baconating the heck out of a Burger on their sauces, we'd be great. Then my friends order of the Chipotle Chicken Crispers were wrong too. She instead got plain chicken crispers, the chicken Crispers weren't even crisp at all, very disappointing, and the fries that came with her order we're stail, as if they were leftover fries that were being passed on from plate to plate all day just so they can save time and money from fresh fries. The only thing in the order and our whole Chili's experience that seem to work out right were the Panko Onion Rings and the friendly staff. I know that people will say why didn't you stop and check your order before you left? Well you pick up your order at the side of a bar that is busy with Margarita fixings and I did not feel like putting my food on a bar floor and sifting through it to see if it was right, so I had to take my chance and see if it was right at home. I was very disappointed even more worse than other times. After spending $31 on two meals for one dinner I was very disappointed especially when it came to what we were expecting. I should have stuck to Burger King and Taco Bell, at least they get the orders right are way cheaper, fresher and their apps work to order online. I'll probably take my chance with Chili's in Pearl City next time, even if it means I have to drive to another town. If that Chili's don't work out like the Kahala one I should just stick with CPK. CPK is at least worth the pricey tab, their fast, get their orders right and their app works to order online.

The southwestern egg-rolls are delicious, we get them every time. I like the wood look throughout the place and slightly dim lights all make it more special. Nice location. Music could be a bit softer.

Whoa. This place hasn't been averaging very good ratings. Yikes.  Hope this review uplifts it a bit! Anyways, considering this isn't my first time here, this place has yet to disappoint me (knock on wood); although, I hope it doesn't plan on doing so in the near future. Some of my go to favorites have been the Sliders (complete with this ranch jalapeno sauce which goes good with the fries), and most recently, their Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers, which I will elaborate in just a moment.   For $14-$15 it is worth the money. There's no small helpings here. My plate came with 5 or 6 chicken pieces with ranch sauce you can dip the chicken in, seasoned corn on the cob (the trick is to use the knife to cut off the kernels so you spare your teeth some stuck corn), and french fries. Definitely is my new favorite. The fries compliment the Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers perfectly since it can have a spicy kick to it, but tanginess and sweetness that the sauce provides. The chicken crispers is still pretty crispy considering being under siege of the honey chipotle sauce, which in itself is pretty amazing! Everything on the plate seemed to work well, and all the flavors went well.  My mom's favorite is the sampler, she got three different things, which were the Southwestern Eggroll, Spinach Artichoke Dip (reminds me of CPK, but richer), and the Sliders (those good ol' sliders!)  One more thing to note was that I was able to score a free flatbread pizza, something that is new on their menu. I had signed up on Chili's to receive emails and alerts, and got an email for a free flatbread. Fast forward to today, I was able to use it, and it wasn't some lame portion like the small portions at CPK that you can get for free, it was the FULL portion. We ended up choosing the California Grilled Chicken Flat Bread Pizza, complete with all the bells and whistles: tomatoes, chicken, cilantro, bacon, and ranch dressing drizzled over, can't forget the avocado wedges! All atop a thin crunchy crust. SO GOOD. Really gives competition to CPK and for a cheaper price ($10.99 for this sucker).  Didn't had room for dessert today, shame on me. However I have always had the Molten Chocolate Lava Cake Ala Mode every time we grab dessert here. So good! I also heard the Chocolate Chip Cookie Ala Mode was something to try as well. Next time I'll be saving up room for dessert to give that a try!

Chili's Grill and Bar is a middle of a road eatery.  The one thing that it has for it comes in the service.  The food and drinks are always prompt.  If one orders the iced tea drinks, there is always a person on hand to refill it, as so long as he/she notices it.  The menu has constantly changed from mostly burgers to fried things to (now) health based meals.  These health based meals are Mexican/pizza or variants on having a vegetable based dish on the side.   The deserts are fair.  Chili's does have a habit of eliminating the dishes that are popular in lieu of cocktails.  It does have an extended alcoholic list.  It is almost never fully crowded and one does get a seat on the restaurant side quickly.  I would recommend this place because of that and the swiftness of service.  The place also serves well as a backup due to a busy timeframe at another eatery. Parking is rather challenging because it's in Kahala Mall and you'll be lucky to get on right near the place.

I ordered three combo; buffalo wings, pickle fries, cheese bites. It was old frozen food, warmed in the oven for a while. It was dry, old, disgusting. I just ate the pickles without fried skin and three pieces of salary. I would never come again, I swear. I feel like throwing up now.

When we arrived we were told there would be 10 minute wait for a party of 5. We waited close to 25 minutes. Once we were seated, it was another 10 minutes for them to take our order, and at least 30 minutes before our food was brought out.  When we finally did get our food it was average. Two of us had ordered the same thing but our sandwiches looked different (one of them had been cooked more than the other).   Will not be going back anytime soon.

This place is exactly as Yelp describes the two star experience, "Meh. I've experienced better." Chili's just oozes with overly greasy and not-fresh foods. The chips and salsa is a good deal, but does not taste good...at all. Take your money and your calorie count elsewhere. This place is not worth it.

Chicken tenders undercooked and sent back.  Helpful but far from friendly seevice.  Recevied free chips and queso deal with Yelp but Queso looked like "dog p..p."   i would not come back to this location.

I frequently go to chili's and sit at the bar to have lunch, either by myself or with a friend. The food is decent and some things better than others, like the pizzas. The reason for my 5 star review is Brie the bartender. She is the best bartender in the city in my opinion!! Absolutely entertaining, knowledgeable, honest about the menu and makes a killer margarita!! She is a huge asset to the team there and I want to give her a huge shout out, because she is a true professional at her trade. One more thing... I wish that you guys had later hours!!!! With dennys gone and other buisnesses closing in the area, WE NEED MORE OPTIONS FOR LATE NIGHT GRINDS!!!! I for one would eat there a lot more if you catered to those who work nights and want to eat dinner late. Just wishful thinking :):):)

This place had AWFUL service!! We spent about 2 hours at the restaurant, one of which was waiting for food. The restaurant was maybe 3/4 filled, and for some reason the staff seemed to disappear. Ive honestly never gone to a restaurant where there are no waiters, servers, etc on the floor for 5 - 10 minutes at a time.  Our waitress, a blonde woman... michelle I think, would give us half arsed apologies about the wait, yet never seemed to give a damn about us otherwise. I timed her leaving the floor on one occassion, 12 min to get a fruit punch and one plate of ribs. Are you kidding me!! We constantly ran low on water and I actually had to get up and walk to the host to ask for our check and takeout containers as our waitress disappeared once again. The food itself was pretty good. My burger was pretty good, and the rest of my family didnt have any real complaints for food quality aside from the ridiculous wait. I dont think I'll ever come back and encourage people to stay away from this nightmarish service. Sorry chilis' but you ruined your chance for my family and I. Avoid like the plague unless you enjoy long wait times and junk service. PS. As we left, the waitress immediately swooped onto the table and snagged the tip. The fastest response we got all night. Such a shame.

Been to this place many times and usually have a decent meal. I'm not sure what happened but the quality has taken a nose dive.  I had the worst ribeye steak ever; at least that's what I ordered. The cooks have no idea how to prepare and cook a steak. I asked for my steak to be cooked rare and  it came to my table a white raw piece of rubber that didn't resemble a ribeye. I sent it back to be cooked a little more and my waiter brought back what appeared to be an over microwaved unappealing piece of meat. The skillet mashed potatoes were just as bad. I'll go to Outback next time!

went for veterans day where veterans are served a free entree from a selected list of entrees. this was not a big list.  ordered an ice tea drink which did not arrive until we got the check. the server checked on us occasionally but it was a busy night, so it's reasonable.  a little pricy for the quality of food and portion size. it was okay. it wasn't horrible, but it wasn't a great experience either

Ok customer service,  if there's a game on that the bartender wants to watch you might have to wait a few to get a drink. Also, every menu we touched at the bar was sooo disgusting.  All were worn and dirty to the point of dried food stuck to them. I had to wash my hands after looking and placing my order. WHIPE DOWN THE MENUS! It's not like i only looked at 1 menu, all 3 that were there were gross! Oh and lastly, as a women the purse hooks under the bar are simple to install. Us women want those kind of conveniences.

Steak Fajitas!!! OMG, there's something addicting and delicious about these steak fajitas! Upon our arrival in the pouring rain we were nicely greeted by the hostess that got us quickly seated at out table. That my friend's was the only quick service at this visit.   We waited about 10 minutes for our server to visit us and get our drinks ordered, we then waited about another 10 minutes for our drinks to show up... And then another 10 minutes to order... and then a good 20 minutes to get the food.  At least my fajita fillings were still sizzling on the pan. The food was delicious, not too sure if it was because by this time we were already starving and anything and everything, even our neighbor's artichoke dip was making our mouths water.  We then waited another 20 minutes for our check..  If the service was better this would have been an easy 5 stars but nope the only thing amazing was the ribs and steak fajitas... Yes I will be back for the fajitas with a hopeful mind to which our service will be on the opposite side of the spectrum. :)

I LOVE IT HERE!!! THE STAFF, KEELAN, & JAMES... so surperb with their customer service and they made great food suggestions.  The food and new menu items are great!!!  I will recommend KAHALA Chili's to my friends and family.

Can this chain restaurant SUCK any harder?  If a "NO STAR" review was possible, this would be it. This has got to be the restaurant with the WORST SERVICE EVER!!! I seriously suggest that they review their customer service policy. The waitress brought us water and took our order promptly, but after that it was all downhill.  We waited for about 40 minutes for our food and when it did arrive, it was cold.  The plate was hot from sitting on the warmer, but the hamburger buns were cold and as hard as rocks.  French fries tasted like calamari from the oil being overused and old.  Oh hell, I don't even think calamari is on their menu. What really amazed me was that another waitress from another section had to ask us if we were waiting for our food.  Yes, our waitress walked past our table 3 or 4 times completely ignoring us.  The MANAGER even walked past our table 3 times WITHOUT even noticing us waiting.   We did bring it to the manager's attention, and although she was very apologetic and did give us some $5 coupons, I will never go there again...Anyone want some $5 coupons so you can go eat cold crappy food and have terrible service?

I love several things from chili's, but everytime I order take out for my favorite salad, boneless buffalo wing chicken salad, it gets smaller and smaller.  Cant justify the price for such a small salad.  I mean its lettuce, give me a break.
Of course it was a pleasure to see lovely Lou  front and center to greet you as you walk in...our server was sweet and took care of us as well as the joy of getting to see Maile once again

1. It's a chain restaurant 2. You kind of know the food you're getting 3. The service was good and water was frequently refilled One of my besties and I got together to celebrate her birthday (that was in June : /) and the birthday girl gets to choose the place.  She decided on something simple and familiar CPK Kahala.  We decided to meet there at 7pm.  After parking and walking to the restaurant I noticed it was REALLY DARK.  I thought maybe they recently got the windows tinted so you can't see inside but as I got closer I knew something was wrong.. NO POWER!!!  I texted the bestie and we decided on Chilis.  Thankfully Chilis had power.. This is probably the busiest I've ever seen them but for two I only waited 5 minutes.  After getting seated the server came by quickly for drinks.   The food:  She decided on Chicken cajun pasta.. I decided on the tripple dipper..  boneless buffalo wings, big bites (burger sliders) and spinach artichoke dip that comes with chips.   Everything was good.  The pasta is just as I remember it.  We even had lots to take home.   4 stars because it was a life saver.  It was only $30 for two of us which was a lot less that lunch the other day. ^_^v 31 yelps - 4/31

This was a most interesting evening. Here we are - sitting in the outside dinning area at 8:30 pm.  It's dark as a witch's heart. People are using lighters and cell phones to read the menus and see what they're eating.  From the time we sat down at the table until the food arrived was 55 minutes. Way too long. We don't blame the wait help, the stuff was just real slow coming out of the kitchen. One would think the manager would at least stop by and apologize for the dungeon atmosphere and slow dinner. Nope. We usually go to the Chiles in Waikele. Give them an 8. The one at Kahala Mall gets a 2. It's really gone downhill the last couple of years.
By far my favorite chili's to go to! We always have excellent service here and great tasting food!

I'm totally surprised this place has such low ratings. Perhaps they have changed for the better? Came here for dinner on a weekend night and was instantly seated. Waitress was nice and friendly, got us our drinks and orders. I ordered their new Mango Chile Chicken which is a grilled chicken breast topped with a mango/tomato/avocado salsa that was a bit tangy, zesty, and slightly spicy.
