It came with steamed broccoli and rice. This dish was amazing and I wanted seconds! The only bad thing was the portion size. The chicken breast was a tad small compared to the rest of the plate. My friend ordered the Margarita Chicken which was very flavorful and came with marinated chicken breast on top of rice and beans. Honestly, his dish of food (and the chicken itself) was bigger than mine and his dish was a little over a $1 LESS than mine! For dessert, we just had to get the molten chocolate cake after seeing another table getting it. This is simply the most amazing dessert you'll ever have. It's basically chocolate cake (without the frosting) topped with a scoop of vanilla ice cream topped up with drizzles of hot chocolate syrup that dries and becames a chocolate crust around the ice cream. My grammar is all messed up just thinking abouts it! I honestly wanted to give 5 stars to this place for the food and service that we got but I'm going to dock one star for the portion size. I did NOT have enough of that mango chicken...

A nacho platter should not come with just enough chips to cover the plate. Nor should it have exactly one pepper per chip. Or a sprinkle of olives. A nacho platter should not know what limp lettuce is. Fortunately I was rather buzzed from my Mango Presidente Margarita... In my nacho lovin world, I order nachos because I am need of a cheap pupu, not to be reminded that I am actually ordering a cheap pupu. I want disorder and globs of sour cream and cheese. Not uniformity and precise measurements. Maybe it was a bad day in the kitchen...I just wish it wasn't on my nacho craving day.

Go to Chili's sporadically and last night was one of those nights... I enjoy the food at Chili's, those micro slider burger things are pretty awesome and a long time ago in a relationship far, far away, had different drinks and the country fried steak, which were A-OK. The thing that is remarkable about Chili's and that always stands out to me is how slow it is.  It took over five minutes for anyone to acknowledge our table and serve water.  Once that happened it was on, service was off the chain.  Everyone stopped by, they must have known I was Yelp Elite or something, Idk... Jokes aside, good food, service is ok when it happens, and price is what it is.  I reckon a 3 star should suffice!

Our server was super friendly and courteous making sure everything was to our liking!  And of course this is chilis everything is always so very tasty!  I checked in and received the queso bean dip for free!  Totally score!  We ordered bacon ranch quesadillas, turkey sandwich and burger with fries!
Service was excellent. Food was nothing special, but we always come her for the bottomless chips and salsa. I love those chips...so thin and crispy!
who ever the cooks here are kooks!!! what they doing back there?  all i hear is horse playing, and obnoxious profanity... Bad trip, burp burp...

Would have given three stars but--what's up with the host/greeter?   This location seems to be doing better. Saw the same manager here--which has been unusual for this location in recent years--and waiter and kitchen service seemed smoother than before.   Could have used a better greeting from the host.  He was missing from his post at 5:00p, and we waited a bit until he decided to slowly sashay his way over, pick up two menus and plop them down on a table.  No eye contact, no welcome, no verbal communication.  He seemed to be watching TV or trying to figure out something more interesting than greeting and seating us.  Same thing on the way out--no goodbye, no thank you, no come back soon.  Needs help before he's in the front of the house.   Everyone else:  great job.

Went with a group of 15 waited 40 min.  When we finally got called and brought to our table it was only set for 12 they started to add chairs to the ends of table which would make it cramped asked to speak with manager. Found and alternate space to accommodate our group.  Manager apologetic made up with comp chips and comp desserts.  Waitress service excellent made up for hostess stupidity on setting 15 guest on a table of 12

Great service. Nice staff. Little slow for a chain restaurant. Maili is an excellent server. Go to your happy place. Fresh is happy . delicious  and comfortable. Fajita trio is too died for. Artichoke dip is great.

Horrible service.  Went there today and the waitress was rude the moment I sat down.  Was gonna order food, decided not to. On my way out, the hostess gave a crazy snobby look at me.  I was in shock.  From beginning to end, horrible customer service.  I was in 1 drink, and that was more than I could bear.  I've been there a few times.  It's never been that bad.  I'll never go back there again, and I'll probably tell others not to as well.

Chili's food is as good here as anywhere else.  The service is non-existent.  Most employees either congregate in the back or at the host stand.  I count 4 people standing at the host stand right now.  Ever wait 20 minutes for plates to be removed and your order taken.....while sitting at the bar in Chili's?  Welcome to Chili's Kahala.
Went here with my son after work one day to just catch up.  The food was only mediocre, but our waiter was nothing short of amzing!

I love this place! Although it may be a chain restaurant, its still pretty darn good. I always come here whenever CPK is too filled. Its a great backup plan whenever you're feeling pretty hungry and want some quick grub.  I always order the Country Fried Steak because of the 1) HUGE MOUND OF MASHED 'TATERS 2) HUGE PIECE OF STEAK 3) CRAZY GOOD SAUCE! Other than that, my partner ALWAYS gets the Shiner BBQ Ribs. Hey, the service is good, the food is decent, and theres hardly ever a wait. Why not stop by this place?  Why only 4 stars? It's because I wish they still served complimentary chips and salsa though ): I used to go through plates of those back when they did.. but I guess the good things don't always last )':

I love getting greeted by hostile host, do you? Just joking. But seriously, the host had a frown, when I asked questions about making a reservation of 9 they acted as if I was wasting their time.  Whatever, I understood that they were busy, as it was a Friday night and I decided to move on. The atmosphere was chaotic. Children screaming, tvs blaring. But it's a sports bar, so pretty much the norm.  When we were at the table we were greeted by the waitress, after inquiring multiple time about the status of the rest of our party, in a 10 minute window, she took our drink order and the rest of our party arrived. I had the strawberry lemonade, while bottomless ran about 4 dollars... then the waitress inquired about 5 time if we were ready to order even though she knew the rest of our party just sat. I understand we took about 15 minutes to get settled but as a bigger party, it is inevitable. I ordered the ribeye steak and mash no butter, my boyfriend the salmon and chicken margarita combo. Food took 45 minutes to arrive, lucky we ordered an appetizer to hold us over. My food arrived with butter, I was to ravenous to bother to correct it. My grandmother's chili was cold. We asked for a warm up, came back luke warm. By this time we just ate and left.  Food was ehh, service was bllaah, ambiance meeh. All in all 2 stars.

There were empty tables & seats in both the bar area and regular seating. I'm talking about atleast 4-5 tables in bar side and about 8-10 tables on regular side with people waiting outside to get in. We sat on the bar side that is normally seat yourself. The manager comes up and tells us sorry you cant sit there. There's a waiting list...really? All these empty seats and you have people waiting outside what's going on here? He said you can sign up on the wait list. Why sign up for the wait list and wait with the other poor people waiting to get in. Apparently they didnt want to make money or our business tonight. We gladly left and went to CPK. We walked right in sat at the bar, got beer and food within 15min. They took care of us and we spent well over $100. Sorry Chili's that was the 3rd strike, we are not going there ever again.

Jesus!!!! Every single time I come here they either get my order wrong or they drop my food. Common now.. I also work in the food industry and to come to a different food establishment, only have my order wrong or yet alone is such a disappointment. The only good thing that come with a wrong order is my meal being comp. so if you want free food come here!

Yay! I'm a fan... of the PRESIDENTE MARGARITA!!!  Love the flavor, love that it comes in it's own shaker...  I love the fajita... served on a SIZZLING hot plate... I always feel short one tortilla though - - and I walk out stuffed without finishing the whole thing.   The sad thing is that other than these two items... nothing else seems is memorable for me.   So... I guess the 4 star rating is really for the Presidente Margarita... LOL

Went to Chili's with some friends around peak dinner time and we were seated immediately.  This is saying something, considering the wait at the nearby CPK was around 45 min to an hour, and basically sums up Chili's reputation as being the "second" choice for eating in and around Kahala Mall when Kuru Kuru Sushi and CPK are both full. The main problem with the restaurant is that the service staff is completely disorganized.  I feel like this is why the waitress will often say there are two of them taking care of your table, simply because you won't see one of them for the rest of the night as another one shifts over to take care of requests.  At one point my friend got two more ranch dips than she requested because they both fulfilled the request.  It's not a bad thing, but this problem can definitely impact you in a negative way. I'm a fan of their BBQ chicken and it did not disappoint me when it came in the triple dippers fashion.  I've never had an issue with the food at Chili's save for some of their burgers being overdone, but it is just the service that concerns me. At the end of our meal, it took the waitress a good 15 minutes to come by again despite the fact she said there would be two of them taking care of us.  We didn't even see her in our side of the restaurant for a majority of the time.

I've ate here twice and both times I had food poisoning and extremely slow service. I did like the nachos but feeling ill for a day straight is not acceptable. I shared the nachos yet the other person wasn't sick which is indeed interesting to say the least. I do know I have a weaker tolerance so anyone else who does should be aware of their food. Also, there was a kitten who was clearly stuck in a drain pipe on their property that they refused to set free. I'm guessing they did nothing later on and let it die since they had acted so inept and lazy about it. They also refused to call the security at the mall so we had to about the poor kitten. At least they took an interest instead of Chili's drowning out the kitten's cries with their ugly music.

I finally ate at a Chili's. Yes, that is right, it has been open on the island for years and I even lived on the mainland and I never ate at a Chili's until now. I understand the reason why I didn't. Chili's claims that it offers a tex-mex menu, yet I failed to find anything on it that was truly tex-mex! Don't get me wrong, the menu definitely doesn't fail to disapoint and it is sure to please a wide palate, but there was nothing on it that makes me want to go back. To those of you who say its a national chain and blah blah blah...don't give me that cause you know you still go to Tony Roma's for ribs and to McDonalds for the Big Mac.  The drinks certainly weren't the best. The mojito I ordered was very sweet even after I mixed it a bunch, while my friend's margarita was extremely salty. Oh, the margarita was $11....seriously!?  The service was good and the service was definitely attentive. Our waiter knew the menu well and was very helpful. The wait for our food wasn't long at all and it came out in a perfectly calibrated orchestration.  The location is convenient and the decor comfortable. Parking can be a pain, but its located in Kahala Mall so what do you expect? It is certainly an average place for a meal, but personally id opt for other options nearby!

I think I'm reviewing a different Kahala Chili's than most folks experience. Most folks experience the indoor Chili's.  There, people freeze in super air-conditioned discomfort.  But I guess people must like it.  Beats me why you wouldn't want to sit outside, in front, where the tropical breezes come sweeping across a well-solicited parking lot.  It's nice out there.  It's cold inside. As for the fare ... Well, I'm a big fan of the Presidente Margarita.  It's a bit weird ... no prices on the drinks menu.  Got to be worried about that, right?  Relax ... at $8.99, you get a generous shaker (2+ pours) of the Presidente Margarita.  It's a keeper.  Add to that the standard, good Chili's fare (burgers, salads, sandwiches all good, not to mention the Mexican stuff, which is maybe not why I would go to Chili's [but maybe that's just me]) and -- did I mention the outdoor eating area? -- you have good value for money.  This is without taking into account your proximity to the Jack Lord bust, just outside of Macy's.  I don't find the service at Chili's slow, but say it was... Wouldn't that be a great time to get your picture taken next to Jack Lord? Book 'em, Dano.

Worst service ever!  I will never go back there again!  First of all,  from the time we placed our order it took 45 minutes to get a portion of one of our order. Mind you,  by this time my kids are starving.  And what kind of restaurant serves the chips of a platter by itself without the dip then serve it 10 minutes later?  Then I decide to buy a gift card. Worst mistake ever,  because I had to wait another 15 minutes for the manager to bring them.  And the reason it took so long is because she was in the  kitchen laughing and joking with her kitchen staff while I stood there watching all of this happen. Finally 30 minutes after we finished eating,  I had to walk to the waiter and ask for my check.  I would NEVER go back there again!
Cold inside so I suggest eating outside. I love the under 600 calorie part of the menu. Service was average speed.

Chili's is never my first choice but since it was my husband's choice, I agreed to go since we don't go often anyway. With 2 young kids in tow, we got there just after 6 and were seated not long after that (maybe 6:15).  Got drinks in a reasonable amount of time but the server lady didn't show up again to take orders for at least 20 more minutes. Many more minutes passed before our chips and salsa arrived.  We ordered the extra ranch-salsa and that didn't even arrive until the first round of chips was eaten.  I tasted it and it just tastes like ranch dressing and salsa mixed together so I have no idea what took so long.  Plus, the chips itself took so long to arrive that there should be no reason the side order of ranch-salsa comes 10 minutes later. It was at least 10 more minutes by the time I received my cup of soup!  Meals FINALLY arrived... my salad (parts of it) was barely chopped up.  It just looked like someone took a hammer to some iceberg lettuce, gave it one thunk and threw the pieces on the plate (yes, one portion looked like an entire quarter of the head).  And at $12 for a sledgehammered salad... I think not! After getting us some boxes.... we just sat and WAITED for who knows how long to get the bill.  Not wanting to wait any longer, once we received it, I physically took the bill and credit card to the server so she couldn't escape us AGAIN for another 15+ minutes.   I'm pretty sure we waited far longer than we actually ate there.  Also, I would've ordered some dessert but no one offered and it got too late at that point anyway.  Which would've meant more tip for her if we ordered more. This experience truly sucked.  For anyone out there with young kids or maybe servers who are serving families with young kids... I would say that most families are trying to get out of there faster (than not) so quicker service is usually appreciated! 1 star for food be "ok" - negative 5 stars for the terrible service
I like chili's it's good food the service improved they have sportscenter on tv and their food is pretty cheap I would regularly eat here

Stopped by for a late dinner recently, and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and the service.  The hostess greeted and seated us promptly, and our server Christopher was excellent.  The food came out quickly and was delicious.  We'll be back!

We live not far from the Kahala Chilli's but we hardly ever go there (maybe once every 2-3 years).  The food just hasn't been that impressive when we've gone, the lines are pretty long and it is on the edge of Kahala mall so parking is always an issue (although it is free).  I'm afraid the other reviews are right - this Chili's really isn't unique at all, the views are of a shopping mall and busy street and the food is so-so.

My standards for Chili's aren't high so I don't expect anything special, unlike some previous reviewers. It's a decent place for a casual restaurant night-out. My family and friends usually go to CPK Ala Moana or Kahala, but we decided to try something different. Plus, we had gift cards. Our default go-to restaurant would still be CPK over Chili's. I'm about to be nit-picky though ... I do not like the digital menu-ordering devices. I'd much rather tell my waiter the order. We were experiencing glitches, and had to wait a long while to figure out what was actually ordered and correct the bill. I understand though that technical difficulties aren't common. If I have to use the eMenu, it should at least include everything on the menu. To be blunt, the eMenu seems like a slight easy way out for the waiters. My opinions about Chili's eMenu don't affect my star rating. The service was meh. The food was decent, but if you are on a diet, I don't recommend Chili's. I tried the "lighter choice grilled salmon," and it wasn't worth $20. It didn't help that the salmon was dry.

Went for take out dinner.I got the Memphis dry rub full rack of ribs,can't beat it. The take out container are bigger than previous and fit the meals better,compared to the plate lunch size.Service was great,food was ready prior to time estimated so pick up was fast and friendly.

This is tonight's back up place since the municipal lot in Kaimuki was packed. There were a lot of open tables when we got there, but we got placed at a two seat table.  Which means no fajitas for me. Sizzling plate+ plate with cheese, guacamole and sour cream+ rice and beans plate+ tortilla plate+ extra plate they give so you can build your fajita= craziness on the small table.  Not to mention 1/3 of the table was already covered with table condiments, menus and advertisements.  I placed some of these things on the divider rail.  Which actually was a plus because it blocked one of the blinding over head lamps from shining into my eyes.  They really need to dim the lights a little. Okay I understand when it is busy food takes a while to come out. It wasn't busy when we got there and it took more than 30 minutes from ordering before we got our food.  Our drinks were refilled quickly but just made us colder being that the place was empty so the room was on the colder side.  A basket for the rib bones was supposed to come but never showed up, oh well. I tried something different, Sweet & spicy chicken, it was on the low calories menu.  Honestly if I'm eating at Chili's I'm not there to eat healthy.  Sad thing is I used to like how they had butter on the broccoli.  I could do without the over saltiness of their food.  Tonight the salt level was okay.  Low calories just means a small portion, which they charge +$15 for... boggles my mind.   My chicken was burnt.  I basically ate my rice and broccoli.  I also took a piece of rib from K.K.'s plate. A manager paused at our table and asked if everything was okay.  I really dislike saying anything because it becomes a big deal even if I insisted that I am fine.  You asked so I answer 'my chicken is burnt but it's okay.'  Solution would be maybe you might tell your chefs not to burn the chicken anymore.  BUT instead of hearing that I am fine with the burnt chicken and K.K. will eat it,  and I'm just going to eat some of his food so I don't starve.  I get the oh want me to get you something else.  At which point I say we already waited 30 minutes for our food and we are on a time constraint.   They then tried to get me to take a complimentary dessert.  I cannot recall Chili's ever having a dessert worth trying.  Oh and I guess they don't recall I said we were running low on time since our food took 30 minutes. The check took a long time to process.  A tray came back to us with another tab and someone else's credit card which by the way was the wrong color, red instead of green.  It also had a female ID photo instead of a male photo.  I think we waited more than five minutes for the bill to be processed.  For a while there we thought they had lost the credit card and it was off in someone else's wallet. This place seems to disappoint me more every time I get dragged here.

Ok, we sat outside on the patio (Kahala) in the evening; the night was perfect.  It was cool with a slight breeze.  The waiter was nice.  The issue is with the food.  It was not that great.  I guess when you go to a chain it's hit or miss.  It was miss.  I ordered the appetizer trio and one of the choices picked was a chicken tender covered in a sauce.  We couldn't figure out the taste cuz the chicken was so over fried, you couldn't bite into it.  I did tell the waiter, who said it is over cooked.  Don't they have quality control, Chef Ramsey would have sent it back...  Having said that if they don't have quality control at the cooking station then the waiter should not have brought it out; look at what you serve, that would be the ideal.

Chili's has always been our Plan-B when we can't get a table at CPK Kahala.  Sorry Chili's, your wait time has been pretty short whenever we go, and I'm always starving by the time I stop whining about CPK having a long line (hahaha) that I settle.  Hrm. It's always been hit or miss when we come here.  Sometimes the service is excellent, and sometimes it feels like an "omg another one, 3 more hours til I can go home" kinda server.  Which makes me just want to order, eat, pay, and get out.  Thank you. The food is good, though I always get almost the same things-or in rotating fashion; the honey chipotle crispers, the lunch combo, or the triple dippers.  Sometimes a drink or two (which back in the day made me HAAAAAPPPYY).  It's a laid-back kinda place. Overall, food is food when I'm hungry!  But the honey chipotle crispers are AWESOME (I've had preggo-like cravings for this a few years ago; and I've never even been preggos before so I don't know what it's really like).  It's nothing special to Hawaii, so what can I say? P.S. Get yo drinks during happy hour, friends.
no birthday surprise here.:(  food ok. menu ok. but pricey jus for it Doesn't support troops  discount.

I am absolutely not a fan of Chili's food in general, but I have to say their bartendress, Faye was amazing. She never hovered over us. Instead she was appropriately attentive. She kept the bar clean, prepped for the next shift (something I can appreciate as a former waitress & bartender), & she showed zero signs of judgment as we commiserated & enjoyed the afternoon. I'm not sure how Chili's commends superior service but I hope their attention is fixed on her amazing customer service. BRAVO Faye & mahalo plenty.

I have to second many of the low reviews given by other customers about the service at this restaurant . . . it was almost non-existent for us tonight.  Other than taking our orders, bringing our waters/drinks and one refill, and one "check in", our waiter ignored us for the better part of our meal.  He didn't even bring us our food . . . another waitress did.  Our waiter seemed to pay more attention to the couple in the booth behind us who were ordering drink after drink.  But, he was awfully quick with the check and charging my credit card. Granted, the food was okay.  Not the WOW-factor kind, but it did suffice in making us full.  They don't honor the 2 for $20, which was a bummer, since it has been advertised. Not sure if we will come to this Chili's again . . . maybe we will check out the one in Waikiki.

Was instantly seated outside, was a little weirded out a server was outside but she left soon after we were seated. The server was very attentive always made sure we had filled drinks and lots of chips and salsa even gave us a bag for free. Was weirded out again when a server and manager came outside and obviously were in a heated argument not sure why you do that right in front of customers but whatever. Overall great experience will go again hopefully no arguments next time around.

We came in on a Wednesday at like 5pm/pau hana time and it was surprisingly not super crowded. The service was quick and they got our drinks and food out really fast. The servers here are awesome and the pau hana specials (1/2 off appetizers and beer/margaritas) are legit.

Carnivores who are not counting calories will likely enjoy several of Chili's menu items. (The "guilt-free" meals are just meh.) I enjoy sitting on their lanai on nice evenings, which is much more comfortable than their refrigerated deep-freeze dining room. There's rarely a wait to be seated outside, another big plus. I've eaten here many times and usually get good food and service. Some of my faves are their fajitas, Monterey chicken, and Shiner Bock burger. They are not low-fat but they are juicy and pack plenty of flavor. On the down side, their prices are a bit high for what you get, but then I feel that way about most restaurants in Hawaii. Parking near the restaurant is usually hard to get, since the restaurant shares its lot with Kahala Mall and other popular eateries. I don't really mind, since I need the exercise after eating here anyway. And a tip for the ladies: their toilets leak, so be careful in there for yourself or your keiki. Yelp 365 Challenge #03/365

The food here is very tasty, flavorful and come in a wide variety. But what I appreciate the most about this place is the staff. Severs are friendly, food gets served quickly and if there is mistakes in your order they quickly resolve the situation. Over all a great place to get a bite to eat.

First time at this place and was I impressed! From the great service to the delicious food and clean restaurant.  We started with the homemade chips and salsa. These were some of the best chips I've had from any restaurant, including authentic Mexican places. The salsa wasn't bad either. The burger was delicious and my family enjoyed their dishes as well. The servers, ours and the others on shift, were very attentive and worked as a team. That's what I'm talking about! Wish we had a chili's on Maui, but with the same employees as this location! I will definitely be back! Very pleasant experience.

They have good service, good food and their restrooms are clean. Hard part is finding parking because Kahala Mall is always busy.  I like how they have so much variety. Soup, salad, Triple Dipper, so many entrees to select from. But I usually always get the tacos or triple dipper. Yum! Gotta try their oreo cookie dessert (it has half white cake, half chocolate cake with oreo cookie bits and vanilla ice cream). My husband doesn't care for chocolate and I prefer chocolate over vanilla. Perfect dessert for people like us. And the cake is super moist! Mmmm!

We occasionally come here craving boneless wings, nachos and other pupus. Yesterday was the last time. We should have trusted our gut feeling to walk out after service was bad from the moment we stepped in. Against better judgment, we waited about 8-10 minutes to get a seat in a mostly empty restaurant. After that, we were blessed with a very rude waitress. Menu's were extremely dirty, sauces oils and smears on every page. Food was slow and the worst quality we've had at this location by a large margin. Poor experience all around...
Great food and most times good service! There black bean burger and the Southwestern Eggrolls are great.

Our experience was a typical Chili's experience. If you've ever eaten at this chain you can expect the same as any other location. If you haven't eaten there.... The food was solid. Burgers, steaks, chicken dishes, soups, salads, apps, that type of thing. I always get the queso dip because it's delicious and it didn't let me down. I usually get a burger but went for the sliders this time. Bit size burgers sounded appealing. They were mediocre though. A bit bland. They didn't have any sauce on them I don't think. So I threw a little ketchup on them and they were ok, but they could use some bbq or something to spice them up a bit. They're speciality drinks are their margaritas and they didn't let us down. They were tasty. We tried a few different ones and they were all good. They do have a full bar and few beers on tap too if that's more your thing. Service was a little slow, not unreasonably slow though. We sat at the bar and they were slammed. It might have seemed like a longer wait had I been sitting at a table waiting around for a server, but watching the two bartenders running around like crazy people helped to realize how busy they were this night. They really could have used one extra bartender just to take care of servers tickets but service was still friendly and as quick as possible. The ambiance is typical chain restaurant type. Couple TV's in the bar with ESPN on with lots of tables and booths and families around. The layout was identical to a few of the ones I'd eaten at in California so you pretty much know what you're getting into if you've ever been to a Chili's anywhere. Good, solid, consistent dining experience just not anything special.

Tip: Any eatery in Kahala Mall at around 6pm is going to have a long line or a long wait.   Knowing this me and my wife went to Kahla Mall with our 1 yr-old in tow.  The original intention was to eat at CPK, when we asked the hostess how long the wait was she informed us that it would be 30-45 minutes.  Yup, NEXT!   We walked over to Chili's and were seated pretty quickly, our server came by and we ordered.  She told us that she would bring the kids food first.  Well, awesome!  30 minutes later, no food.  No food for the 1 yr-old or the two adults.  Not awesome!  We got up and were about to leave, we stopped to let the front desk monkeys know that we were leaving and let them know where we were seated.  They apologized and said they'd get the manager.  The manager comes out and apologizes then has the nerve to ask us to wait (WE ALREADY WAITED 30 MINUTES!!!!) while she went to get coupons.  Walked out.  This whole experience was absurd.  Why would I wait for coupons after already waiting 30 minutes?   Final advice?  DON'T DO IT.  There's a reason people are willing to wait 30 minutes for CPK, or The Counter, or Starbucks, or Panda Express or the other plethora of food places at Kahala Mall.

So with heavy heart I'm giving them one star. I frequent this location often and it's usually a pleasant expreince. Today tho total opposite. We sat for 15 mins before the waiter acknowledged that we were sitting in his section, then he mentions that he has a partner who both of them were passing us frequently.  Got our drink order in 10 mins after that. I had something on the bottom of both beers that they served me and the waiter tried to tell me that it came from my mouth when I hadn't even drank from it yet and it was a pain trying to get another drink they made me order from the kiosk on the table that took 25 mins! Our food finally came my son didn't have his sides when I asked for them they told me oh did he want it, when he clearly ordered it. The fries and corn arrived after he was done eating his food. Besides that our  food was ok. Service totally was horrible this time and I understand that they were fairly busy but if that's the case put more people on the schedule.  At the end of the meal he wouldn't even give me a bill once again just telling me pay on the kiosk. I'm bummed cause this kahala is close to home but I'll probably hold off and going back.

Our server Chad was one of the worst servers we have ever had.  We ordered queso as an appetizer and he didn't bring it out until we reminded him that we didn't get it after he brought out our main courses.  He brought out 4 mugs of water for 2 of us leaving our table over cluttered.  He never came back to check on us throughout our meal to see if we needed anything more to drink or even dessert. We had to ask the hostess to track him down to bring us our bill and to go boxes, and even then we had to wait longer than reasonable for him to come to our table.  We had to ask him for to go boxes twice before he remembered to bring it out to us.  He never apologized to us for any of his mistakes, didn't even bother to comp us our queso.  To top it all off the quality of the food was not up to par.  After this experience we have absolutely no inclination to return.  We even tried to send a message to customer service on their website but their website isn't working!
"To Go" burger and fries, straight to the garbage, the ingredients were unknown, beware!!

Wish I would have read the reviews before I set out across town to come here. First I called to ask about the birthday email club. It wouldn't let me print out the coupon for the free desert so I called in advance to make sure they would do the birthday thing and not mess it up. So I get to the restaurant and get seated. The server came over and did not seem to be in a good mood, just what I love when I go out to enjoy a meal.  I tried to joke with him about getting two appetizers since I had two coupons; he was in no mood for that so that set the bar for our evening. I also told him that it was my fiancées birthday and let him know about the call I made earlier to the manager about it. We ordered and waited for our appetizers. The server came over and apologized that it was taking so long to bring out the apps and that it would be out soon.  After about 20 min or so they finally came out and he apologized again for it taking so long.  They actually tasted pretty good, they were some type of chips and but having the server as dry as he was and it feeling like we were bothering him being there made the experience less than pleasant, especially since I drove from Liliha to go there for my fiancées birthday. Then after another 15 min or so the main entrees came out. This is where it started really sucking. I ordered the ribs and fries and started to eat. The fries were dry and semi-warm, not hot and fresh but dry and semi-warm. The ribs were a little tough and also semi-warm. It was apparent that they held the meal because the appetizer took too long and they didn't want them both out together.  My fiancée had the chipotle chicken strips and she had the same experience with it not being hot, same with the fries warm and dry. As we were still eating I asked the server for a to-go box. The box came out and so did the bill and they started cleaning up right away to get us out of there. I was waiting for the birthday song and nothing. How nice of them to forget why we drove all the way there, FOR HER BIRTHDAY! So I mention to another server what happened and still nothing for another 7-8 minutes so I had to ask, again, my server for the birthday perk. After another 10 minutes I finally hear them coming. After they did their stint they dispersed quickly and without even giving us a spoon for the desert. Had to wait and find the server again. All in all it was a very unpleasant experience, the only good part was that I was with the one that I loved on her birthday and because of that I was not going to be in a foul mood! Save yourselves the hassle and frustration and avoid this location at all costs, I know we and our friends will not be coming back here anytime soon! Thanks! GM

As usual, we had a great time at Chili's Kahala.  When we first arrived, we were told that a wait for an inside table would be about 45 mins and that a table outside would require no wait. We decided to sit outside. They took our drink & appetizer orders and then it started to rain.  Without us asking, the employees were able to move us into the restaurant really quickly. Skillet queso came out of a huge basket of chips & salsa. As usual, the chips were great but while the queso was good it just tasted like bean dip to me. I loved my entrée, the Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers. Delicious. I was also told the steak & ribs that my co-customers had were good as well. The service was great. Very quick to deliver, friendly, accurate, and quick to bring stuff like refills & napkins. As I said, as usual, we had a great time at Chili's.

I was impressed. I had 3 hungry hard working men that were thirsty and needed some help badly. They were very helpful. I gave them a really hard time cuz the first Queso i got was a little runny. The manager Nannette apologized to us and replaced it with a much better version. Chad our server, handled our concerns with class.  Great job overall. I will definitely return. The strawberry margaritas were great. And the special sauce we invented an Awesome Sauce that was the spiciest thing they'd ever had here. buffallo sauce, Roasted jalapenos, and salsa, with lime. mmmmmmm
What happened Chili's?  First you take the chicken fried steak and black pepper gravy off the menu.  Today I find out the Caesar salad is gone too! Very disappointed...

We are big Chili's fans.  I LOVE the Mililani Chili's, we go fairly often and they have a pretty awesome happy hour deal.  Their servers are also really cool. HOWEVER, deciding to go the Chili's at Kahala Mall was a bad, bad idea.  Actually soured my taste for Chili's, even the Mililani one, which sucks for them. We went in for lunch with our 1-yr-old baby in tow.  So the girl at the front (and to make matters worse, I'm pretty sure she was the manager because she was wearing regular business-type attire, and she wasn't that young looking, either) told the hostess to seat us in the bar area.  Umm... hello?  She did see the baby, too, because she said hi to him. So we go along thinking, okay, well maybe they'll just sit us at a short table and we can have a high chair there.  Nope, they sit us at the high tables.  The waitress is a young girl, and comes and asks what we want to drink.  She sees our baby.  She does not ask if we want a high chair or anything (I was waiting to see if she would).  So our waitress comes back and I ask her if we can have a high chair.  She says no, because the table is too high and the high chair would be in the way.  I'm about to ask if we can move, when she suggests getting us a booster seat.  Our baby is not large by any means, and sure as heck doesn't look like he should be sitting in a booster seat yet.  He could also slide right out of a booster seat, which doesn't have any way to keep them seated in it. I'm just really disappointed because who sees a family with a baby in tow and doesn't automatically get them a high chair, or at least ask if they would like one?  My husband and I still can't believe that they sat us in the bar area, with no high chair, and only offered a booster seat when we asked for a high chair.  Am I supposed to eat my food while holding a baby on my lap? When we ate at the Chili's in Mililani, they sat us in the restaurant area and automatically got a high chair for us, so it's not that Chili's isn't a family-friendly restaurant. I am really, really disappointed with the Chili's Kahala Mall staff and DEFINITELY won't be eating there again.  Shame on you guys!!

Hit or miss...sums up chilis. I stick to either the honey chipolte chicken crispers or shiner bock bbq baby back ribs. They no longer have the shiner sauce so now I'm probably not going to go as much. Last time I went the server was kind of rude and inattentive but its okay...they were slammed.

Let's be real.  You can't expect to get an amazing meal at a middle-of-the-road chain restaurant.  So for the purpose of this review, let's set expectations, as such.   Chili's has some really great dishes for an everyday meal.   I was pleasantly surprised by their Original Baby Back Ribs.  Very flavorful.  Pretty nice seasoned rub and cooked well.  The Mini-Burgers were also really good.  Potato skins are pretty standard.   The service was quite good for a chain restaurant. Not a bad place to go if you're looking for a decent no-thinking meal.

Okay this review is for the food. Because when we visited here last night our server James was excellent. Totally not his fault that the kitchen at this location SUCKS. Anyone who knows me knows I'm a foodie, so Chilis is really just an option if nothing else is open. But Boyfriend loves their chicken crispers so we went to the Kahala location last night. First we were seated in the bar next to this very loud table of 5 extremely drunk people. They were super obnoxious so we asked to be moved. This is strike one for me because I feel especially at a family chain, they should know when to cut people off. Our server later told us that they had been there for two hours and had 14 shots each! Um overkill much? Anyways our server was this adorable young guy named James, and if it weren't for him we would honestly have walked out and not even paid. Now foodwise I should have known better than to order steak at Chilis but they had this deal for $12 and it came with a salad, 6oz steak, garlic bread, and sweet potato fries. Sold. Boyfriend got a salad and his chicken crispers. I specifically asked for no onions on my salad . Onions were present. Sigh. Also my salad were topped with cucumbers that had mold on them. Um...ew. My medium steak came out and it was almost blue rare. I could tell without even cutting it that it was raw inside. I asked for it to be medium and my server took it away with many apologies. Nice kid. It comes back...same piece of steak (I could tell from where I cut it) only now it is officially dead. I don't think I have ever had steak that was soooo well done. I choked on swallowing a piece. Now to be fair the manager did take it off the menu but I was pretty disgusted with the food at that point. And poor James looked like he knew he wasn't going to get tipped. But still acted like a champ! So friendly still and joked around with us. We ended up giving him a 30% tip cause we felt so bad, although his service really was excellent.  Overall worst food I have had in a long time. But go see James V! Great server!

I used to work for a Chili's in California as a server and a trainer, and was appalled the first time I visited this Chili's.  Service was slow, order took a long time (without apology), food did not meet corporate standards, and the waitress -- who's shirt said "trainer" -- seemed oblivious to all of it. I've been back a few times since because I miss my old Chili's, and this one always disappoints.  The food never tastes right or is plated incorrectly.  The price is way too steep for what it is.  And one time, I had a ROACH crawl out of my CHIPS.  Yes it's a restaurant, and yes this is Hawaii, but there is NO EXCUSE for that. If you've had a good experience at a Chili's on the mainland, steer clear of Chili's Kahala, lest it permanently tarnish you view of the entire chain.  The whole point of going to a chain is that you expect it to be consistent from restaurant to restaurant.  Not the case here.

I went to Chilis to celebrate my birthday with my friends. My girlfriend called in advanced to ask about a reservation, they don't take any so we just said we would arriving at around 7pm. We arrived 10 minutes late due to the bus and traffic. Upon our arrival  we were greeted by who seemed to be the manager on duty, we told her we called in advanced that we needed a table for 8 and she rudely comments, "We gave your table away, we didn't think you were coming."  So far not so good, so we wait 10 minutes to be seated.      We arrive to our table and our waiter comes over takes our drink order. Since it was in celebration of my 21st birthday I was curious about the drink menu, I asked what the price of each drink was and he would just give me the run around and avoid answering my question. He kept playing with his long hair and seemed unfocused.       I finally decided on what drink I wanted and we all ordered our food. We waited about 10 more minutes for appetizers to come out. We ordered the loaded potato skins, regular nachos, and sweet potato fries. The food was bland, the skins had a rubbery consistency and it lacked flavor. The nachos were terrible, they are individually prepared, they had: chili, cheese, and olives. We got a total of 8 individual chips. All you can taste is cheese and grease. This was definitely not worth the price. The Sweet potato fries were descent can't really complain about fires.      We all ordered a steak entree, It was pretty bad.  The steak was dry, not charred at all, and looked like plastic. Truly.  It looked like something that would come out of a Fisher-Price plastic kitchen set.  It was low on flavor, which may not be a surprise for places such as Chilis, but the standard was so low that even taco-bell steak looks and tastes better. It was very disappointing for $17.       The server and manager did redeem themselves a little bit, all of our entrees were supposed to come with broccoli. They both came and apologized that the last batch of broccoli was bad so they didn't serve it to us. All the orders but one made it out to our table. We were missing one whole steak combo plate. We told the waiter to cancel the order since it was never sent out to us.       Since this was in celebration for my birthday, the waiter came out with a bowl of ice cream for me. I had a lit candle; It was a nice gesture but the ice cream was already half melted, so it was more of an Ice cream soup.       Overall it was a terrible first time experience, I will not be going back to Chilis. They lost a customer for good.                                              How to get here from UH Manoa      If you're feeling lazy take the 13 bus that picks up in front of Frear Hall and get off on the corner near The Fat Greek. Then take the 1 or 1L bus heading to Kahala mall.

I used to frequent the Kahala Chili's practically every week, then stopped for a while, and recently started going there again.  One thing about Chili's is that the food is pretty consistent, which it should be since it's part of a chain.  I like the variety of food they have to offer, particularly if I'm with a group of friends who may all feel like eating different things - salad, ribs, burgers, they have something for just about everyone. I'm not a big fan of the Mexican sides (rice and beans), and my experience with their drinks has been pretty lackluster, especially for the price.  I am a big fan of the chicken enchilada soup and garlic bread (which I'm pretty sure is Pepperidge Farm Texas Toast).  It's not on the menu, but you can order a basket of 5 pieces of garlic bread as a side order. When I feel like eating healthy, I order the cobb salad.  When I'm feeling not-so-healthy, I go for a burger or a triple dipper which allows you to choose 3 appetizers.  Last time I went for the potato skins, southwestern egg rolls, and spinach & artichoke dip.  Once in a while I splurge on ribs or a steak - I really enjoy the ribeye. As for service, it's usually okay - not bad, but not exceptional either, although there have been one or two outstanding servers during my many visits there.  It's proven to be a good option when lines at the other Kahala Mall restaurants are long.

Ate here for dinner tonight and it wasn't very busy but the food seemed to have taken a long time to come out. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger, my husband ordered the triple dipper and our kids shared the little chicken crispers with rice. My cheeseburger was okay. I prefer a lettuce leaf versus shredded iceberg lettuce. My husband had two sliders, three potato skins and half a dozen chicken buffalo bites. The old menu seemed to have fresher and/or a better taste rather than "an out of the box from the freezer." Even the French fries used to taste better before.
Got food poisoning from this place. Had a salad only. Never been back since. This place is a dirty hell hole.
Great service on a day I felt I would get horrible service. Valentines day! We had a very short 45 minute wait as walk ins. And we were given a table even earlier. Amazing service

why oh why don't I ever learn, going out to dinner on a Friday evening without pre-arranged reservations is as enjoyable has having your teeth yanked with a pair of rusty pliers by a Hobbit on roller skates blindfolded. 1830- Our Friday evening turned out to be a disaster as our first 2 preferences were heavily booked with long waiting times. 1900- Someone (soon to be an ex-friend) recommended Chili's which is located in Kahala Mall.  Anyone who has been to Kahala Mall on a Friday evening should well enough know that parking is as scarce as a blind man entered in a Finding Waldo contest.  After circling around the various parking areas within the Kahala Mall parking lot, we gave ourselves another 10 mins or we would just put ourselves out of our misery and just order take out from Pearl's Korean food. 1930- Our bad Karma must have been in overdrive as a parking spot miraculously opened and we were on our way to another unforeseen disaster. Just our luck, Chili's was jam packed, a 30 minute wait, take it or leave it, our hunger was clouding our judgement so we meekly succeeded go the hostesses evil plan. After being seated, we hurriedly placed our orders while the gods smiled upon us, little did we know, he was punking us. Artichoke cheese dip & chips came out quickly in addition to the potato soup.  We looked at each other and wondered if our luck may have change. Alas, we were doomed, we waiting 15mins, 20mins, 30mins, 40 minutes, finally our entrees came, we ate quickly as we were expecting the ceiling to come crashing down on our heads. Service/food average, 3 stars because portions are large

I've been to Chili's in Michigan, but last week was the first time I have been to one in Hawaii. Prices are average, ranging from about 10-15 dollars a plate. If you come here, you HAVE to get the Texas Cheese Fries. They are the best things ever. They are fries topped with melted cheese, bacon, and jalapenos. I tried their Jalapeno Smokehouse Bacon Burger. It was okay. Nothing Special about it. I also had their Southwestern  Chicken Pizza. It was pretty good. I would order it again. The service was excellent. The waiter and waitress came by checking if we needed anything and refilling our waters.

Enjoyed the food however our server was terrible.  He was nice ,however, our food took forever to come.  At one point I looked in the kitchen and it looked as though he was wiping food from his mouth.  We ordered nachos with guacamole and beef enchilada. When the food arrived (about 30 mins later), there was no guacamole.  I had to get our server's attention and tell him we didn't get the guacamole, at which point he didn't seem to remember that I ordered it.  While waiting, I saw him servicing another table, still waiting for my guacamole.  When he finally brought it, I was ready to leave.  The manager came to our table to ask if we got the guacamole and I informed him of the bad service.  He did not seem bothered by the fact that we were not satisfied.  I guess we were just two of the many more guests that come and keep coming, therefore, our satisfaction does not matter.

The service was kind of shoddy here and the wait felt a little too long for it being so empty before the dinner rush hour. They apparently didn't hear my appetizer order so that never happened but at least there were burger bite-things with bacon and onions. Those are usually pretty tasty.  The food was meh and the service likewise...I'm not in this part of town often so I'm not tripping out too much bout it.

Wow it's been years since eating here and I now wish we hadn't. It was only a bit past 2:00pm on a beautiful Monday. Hmmm where do we start. We were promtly seated and our order was taken then the wait began.. yes it actually took 37 minutes to get our main order. The salad we did order came within 20 minutes though. The place was pretty much empty and we were just ready to get up and pay for our salad and leave when the nice waitress brings our food. (we should have kept going) WOW?? The look of dismay when viewing the food we ordered and what they brought to the table.. were like 2 different worlds. First of all my wife had a combo meal of chicken and shrimp. (choice of 2 sides and she ordered steamed rice and broccolli) The portion looked like it was for kiddies/keiki menu.. or closer to.. infant (small infant that is) size. Oh dear, no we are not slobs or need buckets of food to quench our appetite but.. "WHAT is this??" $25.00!! for a kiddie portion??? OH my. Then I had to look at my order.. (with side of Rice and fries) of 1/2 rack of BBQ ribs. Please tell me.. what happened to the ribs. Was the porky fella ano'rexic or just starved before slaughter?? Really.. I mean no harm... the ribs did taste good it's just there weren't much to consume. 5 skinny ribs with very little meat. Did I order the vegetarian rib special or what? Now come on.. I could buy a much larger portion of rack of ribs at Times and BBQ them myself then suffer this torture. I know the menu shows a nice juicy rack of ribs.... but what I see on my plate and what is on the menu are 2 totally different things. Really.. not exagerating here. We came here with an open mind and healthy appetite. we left.. feeling cheated and hungry. Come on... where do you spend $50.00+ for lunch and leave hungry? I am tempted to stop by Times and pick up a rack of ribs and smoke and BBQ them myself and take it back to Chilli's and educate them to what a 1/2 rack of ribs actually looks like. So a lesson learned. We will not go to Chili's again. Not sure of the other Chili's but the Kahala one is for sure not the place to go when you are HUNGRY and want to leave full. For those whom speak highly of this place... Hmm that leaves a lot to ponder. Or is it just on slow Mondays they serve mini portions?  A lesson learned. We will avoid Chili's altogether.

The food takes way to long to come out!!! We ordered a beer and a appetizers of chips and salsa, that came out pretty fast, then we ordered our meal that took 30 minutes for steak fajitas and a taco dish yikes!!!! By the time we were our meal came we were full from all the chips ugh.

We used to come here often but after our baby started walking and not wanting to sit in a highchair we couldn't go out and eat as much as we'd like... We decided to treat ourselves today and I wish we hadn't!! What a waste of money. Ugh.  We ordered 2 margaritas and bottomless chips and salsa to start. Then for our entrees we just decided to share the triple dipper. Our triple dipper took 30 minutes to come out! 30 MINUTES! Let me just say, the people around us were getting food and we were just waiting. The resturant was only about half full, if that. Oh aaand that's an appetizer, I couldn't imagine how long we would have been there if we ordered regular entrees. By the time we got our food I ate one of the mini burgers and my husband ate one chicken but we weren't even hungry anymore so we got it to go. I went up to the manager to let her know and it seemed as if she could careless or it happens all the time and she's used to it. We should have just paid for the margaritas and left the food there. They get 2 stars for the drinks, and our server was nice. The only reason I will be back is because I have gift certificates after that I will never return.

Went in on a Saturday evening about 5pm hoping to avoid the crowd. It didn't help, because the service was so slow that it took 50 minutes to get our food that we left about 1-1/2 hours later. The server hardly came to our table to refill our drinks and I was hoping the manager would have stopped by our table but since he didn't, I'll be contacting Chili's Guest Relations.

Mediocre food and service. Very few patrons eating in the bar and it still took a while to pay my bill. Maybe she has another job here or had to run back for another jamba juice? Who let's their employees eat/drink/advertise another restaurant during their shift?

Went here the other night for dinner with the wife. We ate at the one in Waikiki and it was not as good as the one in Kahala. The Khala one is better. The food was better and the servise although slow was better.  The food was OK not good, but OK. I rarely eat Mexican food unless you consider Taco Bell LOL Mexican. But the food was good for the price you pay. Chili's is what you would call a quick serve restaurant/bar much like Ruby Tuesdays. And for a quick serve restaurant Chili's does a good job. The service was OK although it took a while for our food and it wasn't even busy. But the server made up for it by explaining it was the cooks fault for trying to over cook our steaks. She told us she tried to tell him to not over cook the steaks. She even waited for us to cut our steaks to make sure it was medium rare. She went far beyond what I expected.  Being a cook I get up set when my steaks are not cooked the way I like it LOL. But she did a good job to try and make us Happy. She even gave us a bag of chips and salsa to go when all I asked for was a box for the left over chips I didn't eat. I would have been Happy with the left over chips and salsa.  If you like margaritas they have a wide selection and at reasonable prices. The food is OK and the service is pretty good. This is a good place to hang with your friends and just relax and have a beer after work or just hang out period.

OK, I normally don't leave negative reviews, but I was really bothered by the service we received.  So Chili's was celebrating their 21st Birthday with $5 margaritas and 21 cents chips and salsa last night.  I knew about this deal because I got an email and went there especially for the $5 margaritas.  I was extremely disappointed that an email blast and facebook post was sent about this deal, yet our server did not mention it at all, especially since we frequently go there and their "supposedly celebrating".  My husband arrived before me and had to ask about the deak.  When I arrived, I ordered the Platinum Presidente, which I got at regular price.  When I saw it, I asked her about the deal and she said I ordered the "Platinum" Presidente and not the Presidente.  Ok, I thought they were in the same category.  She did not even ask me if I wanted the Presidente instead or offer to take it back.  I would have at least expected her to MENTION the deal and let me decide if I wanted to get the Presidente instead when I placed my order.  Obviously we knew about it since my husband had ordered the margarita and the chips!  Our food was  burnt and the beef on the nachos tasteless.  We didn't even eat half of it.  The bartender was heavy-handed with the liquor too, so the drink was not enjoyable.  I didn't want to get drunk, I just wanted to relax after a hard day's work.  I ended up only drinking the one and my husband switched to beer.  To top it off, we were ready to leave and were going to pay our bill via the Ziosk so we could just leave.  Not the case.  When I pulled up our bill, I noticed an additional beer we did not order.  After waiting awhile for her to come by our table, I mentioned it and she says, oh yeah, I know, I have to take that off.  WTH?!  If you knew you had to take it off, why didn't you take it off when you added it by mistake?  If I didn't review my bill I would have just paid for it and been charged extra?  I always give at least 20% or more tip, but last night, she's lucky she got 16%.  It's all about customer service, and if I was getting tips, I certainly would be much more pleasant and helpful.  Service has gone down and no one smiles or seems happy to work there.  We REALLY miss Rachel!!!  Don't know if I'd go back if there wasn't a deal to be had.  Extremely Disappointed...

I wasn't uber excited to be attending a Birthday Party at Chili's - after work on a MONDAY! I wasn't really in the mood for it but, I must say I was pleasantly surprised.  The party had already started but, the waitress was very much aware of my arrival. he asked me if I would like something to drink and even pointed out the perfect margarita for me to drown my Monday blues. It's Chili's fairly new margarita named "The World's Freshest Margarita". Now, I am a bit of a cocktailnista (meaning, I like a good well balanced - mixed drink and know when I taste one). Milagro® Silver Tequila (100% Blue Agave), Milagro Agave nectar and fresh-squeezed lime juice on the rocks - they can't possibly mess this one up...and they didn't. It was uber delicious. They could have shaved a few ice cubes off the top but, it was really yummy and punched the perfect kick.  For dinner I ordered the Chicken Fajitas. It's always exciting to have one of those sizzling platters delivered to you. Served on an obnoxious mound of grilled onions and a few slivers of green bell pepper, the chicken remained moist and delicious. Though the tortillas are rather small I still managed to get a good amount of filling packed in there. The manager must have known that they're a little challenged cause she stopped by and asked me if I needed more of them. I didn't want to share with her that the only way I would need more was if I was a fan of onion stuffed fajitas (cause that was all that was left after crafting an ingesting my three).  All in all my Monday Chilis experience was pleasantly pleasant and nice :)

I want to like this place, but there is very little to recommend it. Wouldn't it be nice if they actually had good chili here? I guess I will end up there when there is no motivation to leave the neighborhood and it's late. The service is spotty. Sometimes I've had motivated servers, other times not. Example: asked for boxes--the check arrives-- ask again for boxes--- boxes arrive-- we are supposed to put our food in the boxes (ok)-- after we do this the waiter comes by to collect the check-- no attempt to clear any of our plates (Ok, I get it, it's late, we'll leave). Their molten lava cakes are pretty good-- and they have a full bar.

I only come here for the Presidente Margarita! I like the presentation where they bring you a salted martini glass, and a full shaker, and you can poor as little or as much of the drink as you want. Plus, they have happy hour in the bar starting at 2 p.m. Overall, the food is 'ok-ish'. I like the nachos, because each chip is individually topped with the right amount of cheese and goodies. Burgers are good. Can't go wrong with an Old Fashion with cheese. Service is a hit or miss; best to sit at the bar counter since the bartender is stationary. I heard Chili's on the mainland has better quality food.
Excellent service twice this week!!! (Both dinner times) By two different male servers!!! Excellent food!!! Thank you!
Food was okay, our server was terrible. When she dropped off our food, she also dropped off our check at the same time. As if we didn't want dessert, or maybe some other add ons?

I've gon to Chilis a hand full of times and never really been super happy about it.  HOWEVER.... this past time we went to the Kahala Mall Chilis and it was awesome! 1.  The chicken tortilla soup is always awesome, yummy! 2.  They must have changed their spinach artichoke recipe, cause it was way better and comes in a skillet (the chips would have been better if they were thicker, but my bf thought they were great) 3.  Our server was excellent (and that doesn't happen too often in Chilis)       You should ask for KELI......... love her! This is making me hungry!

190/365 Overall a 2.5 because their dessert is bomb.  Came here for dinner after 830pm and it was filled, yet not too crowded that we had to wait.  We were seated immediately by the kitchen so we got to see all the yummy food pass by :-P.  I ordered their grilled chicken sandwich and my bf got their chicken crispers.  Our food took forever and our waiter barely checked on us but acknowledged a couple of the other table around us.  When our food FINALLY came my sandwich was so plain as it didnt even come with the sauce that it was supposed to come with, which was the honey mustard sauce.  It wasn't a biggie though as I just asked for my favorite Tobasco ;).  After eating we had to wait even longer and had to just "eye" and call over our waiter to order some dessert and get boxes for my leftovers.  As for dessert, we shared their limited time oreo molten lava cake and boy was it DELICIOUS! it comes with half white and half chocolate cake with a molten cream center with chopped oreos inside, OMG it was soooo good...my mouth is watering just thinking about it now mmm.  Overall, my sandwich was alright, the dessert was bomb but the service sucked! and it took, again..FOREVER to get our check.  I wouldnt mind just going to chilis for dessert next time though =9.

Faye the bartender ... was very pleasant and customer service oriented with a smile .... helped me with every need and questions about the menu, drinks and so fourth...awesome job faye ... will be coming back

For some reason, I find myself coming back to Chili's when we're running out of ideas on where to eat.  I often get friendly and attentive servers who know what to recommend and follow up on you after your food has been served, which is always a good thing.  As for the food, some of my staples include the Big Mouth Bites, Cedar Plank Tipalia, Eat-All-You-Can Soup (although they can be a bit too creamy/rich) and Chicken Crispers. Oh and the Ribs are also OK. Sometimes their fries can be a bit overdone and too salty but overall, I would say that it is an acceptable place for dinner, lunch or drinks.

Food was fine, but a little slow.  Service was friendly but VERY slow and inattentive, particularly considering it wasn't very busy and they seemed to have plenty of wait staff.  My waitress disappeared for long periods. When the food finally came the chicken crispers,fries and corn were up to the usual standards.  Tasty, unpretentious, hot.  More or less what I expect for $14 at a Chili's.
Worst food ever! Everythings salty or comes out cold. Ick! Never again!

Went there for lunch, coworker and I had burgers, hard to mess up burgers. Fast and courteous service. Price little on the high side. One reason selected here for lunch was didn't have to think in how to put together a burger like place across the way, sometimes you just want to eat and then go back to work.  ps - watch out as you enter the first set of doors, there's a post in the middle.

Went to eat dinner with my family last night and had the worst service I've ever received there. Food came out, mom ordered soup and salad combo and salad came out without soup. Call me knit picky but I didn't think it was that hard to spoon some soup into a bowl in order to bring it out with the salad but whatever. That wasn't the worst. My sister ordered a half rack of ribs that came out cold. Gross. Told the hostess who flagged down our server. Received no apology from either of them. Server said he would "make a new one" he then brought out the same plate with the same food, just heated it up! The tear in the ribs where my sister took her first piece was still there. Unacceptable. Usually we are a good tipping family, first time we didn't hold true to that. Never coming back...

My friend and I were seated, but not served. Drink menu had no prices. Didn't give us water, despite waving like a maniac. Servers walked on by. Over priced. Did not honor specials. In the end, my friend and I left. Worst service ever. I am never coming back.
The nachos are my favorite. Each chip is dressed individually and displayed in a circular pattern. It comes with sour cream and salsa. The booths are sticky and I promise it wasn't me.

Food was excellent.  Went in the afternoon and there was only one server and apparently she was the host also.  I saw a manager but she didn't help out.  Our server did the best she could with a lot on her plate.

This Chili's is only a short walk from our hotel. My husband and I wanted to have dinner here to save a little money as well.  We brought our Speedy Rewards Redemption Coupon from home to pay down some of the bill (every little bit helps, right?) or so we thought.   They wouldn't accept our coupon because this particular Chili's is independent. Ok, that was our fault and we'll take the hit on that one.  But what was not ok was the food. My dinner was barely luke warm. My husband's chicken had so much breading that he had to pick it off.  Our waitress, I think her name was Nicole, was very nice and attentive.  We left there very disappointed however and cannot recommend this Chili's to anyone.

It really is 0 stars. My husband and I were going shopping in Kahala Mall, so out of convenience, we went to Chili's.  Oh, what a mistake!  First of all, it took longer than it should have for the waitress to take our beverage order.  I ordered a Terlingua Chili and my husband ordered a burger.  It took 30 minutes before my husband's burger was finally served.  THEN, MY HUSBAND ALREADY ATE THREE-FOURTHS OF HIS BURGER WHEN MY CHILI SHOWED UP!!!  The supervisor apologized saying the kitchen was cooking the chili.  My husband tasted it and said it was COLD!  Huh?  They claim to have been cooking the chili just before it came to the table and it comes to the table icy cold???  Somebody was lying!!!  The waitress took it back to the kitchen and brought it back after nuking it in the kitchen.  it still wasn't really hot.  I'm sure they could feel my disgust at the terrible service.  They comped our meal, but now can they pay us for all the time we wasted waiting, waiting, and waiting only to be served cold chili???  All I can say is, dine at your own risk and be prepared to wait for your server to initially greet you, and then wait even longer to finally be served.  Judging from the other comments, the service seems to be consistently slow.

yelp 365 challenge #28/365 1ooth review :D cherry-lime press drink thingy... frickin' amazing!!! food...so-so fries...eat them in the first 10 seconds or else they taste like cardboard... ribs...good, when you find meat on them... loaded mash potatoes...yummy, till they get cold...then they also taste like cardboard with cheese and bacon... potato skins...good...but you can't really mess that up... service...good at the bar :) i will be back for that drink though....yuMMmm!

We went in just for desert and I was craving there chocolate cake! Which is sooo good if it comes out hot. Weve gone a few times for it and once I could tell it sat on the line forever because it came out room temperate which was really disappointing.  We sat down and five minutes after we ordered our waiter dropped our check! I was so shocked, we didn't even get our food yet and she just dropped the check and walked away and we never saw her again, our waters were empty and I think she left the restaurant for the night. She should of transferred the table instead of trying to close us out like that.

Great for dogs! Chilli's is Chilli's...you're gonna get decent chain restaurant food. BUT they allow dogs on the outside patio, and THAT makes this place a winner. It's a good change if you wanna eat something a little bad compared to Whole Foods outside when you're at Kahala.

Not coming back. The food was greasy, fried and fattening. The prices were inflated. Chili's, I'm sorry but we should have something better in the real estate you're taking up.  The only thing somewhat fantastic about our Chili's dining experience was 1) the wait for our table (there was none--meanwhile CPK had a 2-1/2 hour wait, which is why we resorted to Chili's) and 2) our SERVER! She was really really good. I give her 5 stars...but only for her.  I would come back if it was just to see her. Not to eat.

AMBER IS THE BEST SERVER. HANDS DOWN.  She just anticipates all your needs. Every time my friends and I go to chilis, we always wish we would have her as our server!!  She makes chilis our to go place, besides the deal.  Chilis is da bomb.

We ordered via phone for take out during lunch. I like that they have a 10 minute parking in front now, so we don't have to try and fight for parking. I got the Big Mouth Bites lunch combo. YUMMY!! and for a good price too.
Karen gave us amazing service showed a lot of aloha! She also returned to our table to check on us wich we appreciate.  I will be definitely returning soon.
Karen was great she made sure everything went good . Our food was hot and drinks keep coming !  service was great great great

I went here the other night, it was nothing more then I expected.  You know what you're getting when you walk into a Chili's and I'm okay with that.   I wouldl like to review the Ziosk system though.  Chili's has these new computers at every table that allow you to re-order your drinks and possibly food.  I take issue with a couple of things regarding these devices.   First, Ziosk uses what appears to be a propietary android OS.  Its a little buggy, and glitchy from time to time, its not smooth like other operating systems.  It displays the specials, which is pretty neat and could potentially take a lot of work away from the server.  I'd like to think of myself as a decent tipper (20% at least), but in the future, if a computer is giving me more service then a server, then I suppose I would question my 20% tip.  I may give less, I'm not sure on that.   Now I assume that the big idea behind the Ziosk, is that big-picture-wise, servers will get more tables in their section, get tipped less, but more than likely it will even out.  If Chilis hires less servers, then more money from their labor costs goes towards the stores bottom line.  -again I'm fine with this... its Chili's not Vintage Cave. That being said, there were a few things that bothered me.  The Ziosk along with the table caddies take up WAY too much table real estate.  If your going keep the Ziosks, get rid of those table caddies.  No need for me to read out dated material on a table flyer when I could look at the Ziosk.   If a food est. is going to go tech, then go tech... don't half ass it.  It should be up to consumer on whether or not I want to use the tech... or even see it for that matter.  It was distracting me from my company.  I would rather Chilis just make an app similar to CPK's take out app.  They could have QR codes or something else for a phone to scan to get the point of sale system the info in needs from your phone.  Lastly, I would like to say the our food was what I expected it to be.  Our server, a nice filipino girl with glasses... she did her job, we got our food in a timely manner, and our drinks were never empty.   Overall it was it was an "a-ok" experience.  I'll probably be back but, I'll remove the Ziosk from the table.

This my first time to visit this location.  I have to admit that it was a fabulousness place to go and just have a great time with friends and family.   I have been to the other location back in 09, but I have seen the recent technology that they used.  One example would be the ziosks. Instead of having the waitress put the bill in front of you, you can actually use it to pay your bill and get refills on certain things like drinks and food too, which I have never seen before.   Also the good news is that they now participate in the iD card (Isle Discount).  I need to find out how it works so that way I do know what I can use it for and make sure that I get to save $$$ as well as try their food too.  I was glad that my friend ordered the chocolate moten cake, which was very decadent and very chocolaty and deliciousness. ..I thank my friend for sharing this dessert with us so that I get to see how it tastes and let me tell you,  it was very good and tasty as well.   Thanks for the hostess for making sure that we were well taken care of and enjoyed this night for me and my buddies too.

My boyfriend and I are here weekly. Usually to have dinner, have a couple drinks & to enjoy each others company. We always sit at the bar... & most of the time get the same bartender with the beard. He always remembers us, caters to us, remembers what we always order every time, with fast & great customer service. They have never let us down.

Went to the bar on a Saturday afternoon..no "happy hour"...and was impressed with all of the available televised Sports on their TV monitors...capable of showing several games (counted 6)!   Bartendress was efficient and busy. Best unlimited taco chips and salsa deal! Taco Salad was tasty. The Avocado Turkey patty was only okay...could have been better if if "real turkey slices" were used instead of the "chopped stuff".

Read my review, or read this first sentence and analogy: Chili's is the culinary equivalent of going to a refrozen sale at Safeway, and serving the twice refrozen goods at restaurant by heating them with a microwave or deep frier, however by marking up the food to prices higher than any reasonable competitors!   This may seem like a strong review but let me just cover some fundamental problems with this restaurant.       Firstly, although the waiters are quick to get your order in, they seem sloppy and immature without real training. I want to be treated by adults as an adult, I am not friends with the waitstaff. They need a serious manager.             Secondly, All of Chili's food is overpriced: everything is $13. For $13 I can go to Cafe Laufer and support a local business with excellent service and great clean food!  The cake is cheaper at Laufer, and ten times better than the boxed defrosted dessert at Chili's.    Thirdly, Chili's food is made on the mainland, and reheated here! There is no chef at this godforsaken place. Why don't people seem to know that?  When you order soup at Chili's it comes out of a big can!      Fourthly. the food is inauthentic. The Mexican dishes are tasteless and made by people who don't care about plate presentation or quality.  Everything was shocking: a tiny barely identifiable slice of avocado on my chicken sandwich, microwaved vegetables!!!!!  Finally, it hurt me to see a kind local family eating at Chili's spending their hard earned money at this dump when for the same price they could have gone to the Chinese across the street, CPK, or even kuru kuru.  IF you like Chili's slime burgers, phony chicken fried steak ( comes our of a freezer), you need to really stop eating campbell's soup, ramen from a package, and spam. Honolulu has great local restaurants and the last thing we need is another overpriced MCD's substitute! Why do we let such an UN-wholesome restaurant exist in beautiful Hawaii?

I used to come here quite regularly, even before I got into Yelp. Now, its been months since I have stepped inside this or any other Chilis on the island before today.  After looking at the menu and getting reacquainted, I knew why.
