The food is petty good.  The service is as average as you can get, but with a smile on your face.  The thing about Chili's is that it's kind of overpriced for what you do get.   I waited for 20 minutes for my entree to come and my drinks took 10 minutes after ordering.  It was Saturday afternoon, but come on!! The place was more or less a ghost town and I was sitting at the bar.  Apparently, someone was on break and someone else had to cover for them. The sides were pretty good, although not stellar as it once was.  I'm a fan of the loaded mash potatoes though.  Today, I had the baby back rib combination platter. It was good and tender.  The only gripe I had was the chocolate molten cake.  In years past, it was ginormous and costed $5.25, which fed 2-3 people.  Now its $6.99 and smaller. What a crock!! I guess its how they need to make money and cut down on waste. Maybe. it's still pretty good and tastey though Not coming back any time soon though. A great place for happy hour, but not a fan of everything else, when the prices are kind of high anyway.

I would give this place zero stars. Both my brother and I have been sick for a few days because of this place. I think it was from the brownie ice cream or their chips and salsa. If you go here be ready to have flu like symptoms and almost die.

Ohemgee I just have to write a review for Chili's Kahala before I forget about the experience I last had there. I met my dear mommy for dinner before a movie around 8PM. We were seated right away in the bar area (not ideal for non-drunken convos, but eh) and the waitress promptly came up to ask us for our drink order. I checked in on Foursquare (uh oh, are they going to kick me off of Yelp for the ultimate betrayal?!) and noticed that there was an offer for free bottomless chips and salsa. The waitress was super accommodating and didn't need to "ask the manager" about the offer or anything (ahem, Outback, I'm looking at you!). We ordered the rest of the food and it came decently quickly (love the low-calorie section). We never once had to ask for drink refills, and everything was prompt and orderly.  Normally, I'm just MEH about chain restaurants, but Chili's was an exceptional experience, thanks to the wonderful waitress. She seemed genuinely friendly and caring when it came to checking in, unlike other service people who only do it for the tip. When I look up her name, I'll update this review. Thanks whoever she was!

I'm not a huge fan of Chilis....The food is just okay and the prices are a little high for the quality/amount of food you get. When I am craving chicken wings (the honey chipotle chicken strips are pretty darn good), I'll come here, but other than that, it is just A-OK. I like that they let you choose sides with any entree, however, the list of sides to choose from doesnt appeal to me at all. They have nice outdoor seating (right next to a parking lot. lol), but parking can be a pain..... Several yelpers have complained about the service. I haven't had any BAD experiences, but there are always a plethora of hostesses at the door, just kinda standing around. I thought that was weird.....
Burgers and drinks were great.  Super crowded but service was fast and attentive.  Fun atmosphere at a decent price point.

Jerry was our server last night. Gave great recommendations!  He was very patient with our party, we were probably a little difficult with a party of 6 and two kids.  Everything we ordered came out just as we ordered with great timing.  Our drinks were refilled without us having to ask, and our table was cleared promptly after we finished.  Best service I've had in a long time.  Thanks Jerry, we will be back.
Service is so slow...... Getting seated is terrible.   Roach crawled out on the dinner table.
Foods okay. Service is courteous but incredibly SLOW. Not ok if you only have an hour

Meh, Chili's is okay.  Service at this location is usually very good, but that can vary with the server (overall though, friendly and quick service).  For whatever reason, my husband and kids love eating here.  Personally, I think it's expensive for the average type of food.  The kids order off the kid's menu, either the cheese pizza (not very good but the kids don't know any better) or the chicken strips (those are pretty tasty).  I order cheese broccoli soup, which is pretty good as long as it's not too thick.  I've tried many other items from the menu, but usually end up feeling guilty because the food isn't worth the price I'm paying.  A huge plus that I LOVE about Chili's is they usually bring out the order for the kids first.  Anyone with kids can appreciate that.  A child with a mouth full of food stops whining, and that makes everyone happy  Overall, it's an okay place, would be even better if the prices weren't so high.

The waitress was a happy person, but the ahi plate I ordered was a mixed bag. Most importantly, the grilled ahi was dry and tough and even smelled fishy, indicating it wasn't caught very recently. Otherwise it shouldn't be too hard for any self-respecting cook to put a juicy ahi steak on a plate. This was the second time I went to Chili's and the first time wasn't any better.

I went into chili's to get seats, I have no clue if there were more than one host at that time but no host was seen! (REALLY)? Until one host came along but it looked like she just came back from doing a side job or something? Whatever it was she dropped what she was doing and sat us at a comfortable spot she welcomed us with a beautiful smile, believe her name was Kama I told her how upsetting it was just waiting and waiting but she apologized in a perfect way, carried on a convo with us with laughs, Very loving young woman. Besides the waiting we ate happy!

One evening a bunch of us went to Chilis kahala for drinks, food, and just to have a good time!!! We started with about 7 people and knew there would be at least 4-5 more people coming. Oh did I mention, we sat at the low tables near the bar. ANYWAY, our girl server did NOT take our food order when we told her we were ready. Instead she just wrote down our two drink orders and flipped her hair away. We informed her that a few others will be coming and if we can have chairs. Our server came back and asked if it's a SURE thing. She said we can sit here and grab more chairs or sit on the other side to better accommodate us.  ....... AnYwAY, she was just rude and sassy and unfriendly. She kept brining a chilled crown when we asked for it straight. She looked like she just wanted to go home.  Three stars for the rudeness. The food is always good though. What a rotten apple.

To be honest I don't like to eat at chilis but my boyfriend wanted to eat ribs and he doesn't really know good places to eat here since he's from Maui so after eating here once he wanted to come back again. When we put our names down for the 2 of us they said it was a 25 min wait so we waited and we waited and we waited. There was a couple who came maybe 15 mins into our wait time and they got seated BEFORE us. So I went to ask the hostess about my name and she said my name already got called but that was impossible since we were sitting there the whole time. I informed them we were waiting for a while and the lady who I assume was the manager gave me attitude about it. When we finally got seated I had the hardest time trying to find something that would appeal to me so I decided on the Cajun pasta. Except I didn't want the Cajun or the chicken. I was able to not get the Cajun but I had to get either chicken or shrimp. When I got my food it was cold, there was barely anything on my plate, and I'm pretty sure I could cook better chicken than what they had on my plate mostly because I don't think it was cooked. Our waitress barely paid any attention to us and when my boyfriend was done eating we paid through the tablet and left. I didn't even bother eating my meal which i paid $17 for... After dinner we went to CPK and I bought me pasta to eat at home.
This place is great!  The food comes out hot and fresh and Felicia was outstanding!   This is a great stop on the way back to Waikiki, I love it!

We were seated after about a minute of standing around looking for an employee to help us. Seems we showed up during shift change as our server had brought us waters and mentioned that Amber would be our server for the day.  We ordered a pepperoni pizza and big mouth bites which showed up in a reasonable amount of time. The big mouth bites were more towards medium well rather than medium rare but I'm not complaining it still tasted just fine, however, our server never once asked if we needed anything else or how the food was. Water wasn't promptly refilled, in fact after about 10 minutes of my water being empty someone took it off the table, not sure if it was Amber or someone else, but they never returned it. I had to ask for a new cup of water later on.  Overall, service wasn't the best as our server was mostly absent but the food was good. As an employee of the Cheesecake Factory, I do see the difference in service standards between restaurants.

Pleasantly suprised with late dinner tonight at Chili's Kahala.  Food and beverages were quick to the table, and at the right temperatures.  Big improvement over my last visit a few months ago.  Our server was really on it, and showed an exemplary sense of anticipatory service.  Credit to Megan S. for redeeming my view of the service there!   One thumbs down item - the toilet paper was out in the stall I used!  Good thing I usually have napkins or tissue on hand!

Aiyah what happened!? I ate lunch with a friend today and we were both really disappointed. The waitress failed...hardcore!! Supposedly wanted to recommend something but did not... BS ALERT!   I was really unhappy with my "trio sampler appetizer" dish. Ordered sliders (meh, they were nothing special. Found it strange that the patties were connected to each other and the elements of it were generic), fried cheese (not cooked enough), and chicken crispers (beer-battered, not a good combo for chicken). Apparently there is another method that they cook the crispers, called "Country style", and the waitress described it as "Basically like KFC-style." NO GOOD ALREADY! For dessert, I ordered the molten chocolate cake. got to the middle and the chocolate was not even completely melted.  Not too bad, but could have been better.  That hot fudge is so good with the vanilla ice cream! Food took longer than average. Also I find it disappointing that there is no happy hour specials, yet they have a full bar and many specialty drinks (especially margaritas). Poo.   Bad service.... with a smile. GOOD POINTS: Their Classic Bacon Burger is really good!  Instead of getting Chicken Crispers, I recommend their wings (bone or boneless, no matta).  The sauce is spicy (7 on a scale of 1-10)!

Check in on foursquare and you get free chips and salsa, which is my favorite food item at Chili's (and a $5 value!). For some reason I feel like all Chili's restaurants are different...this one in Kahala is not impressive -- every time I go the service sucks. Slow servers, rude servers, no server serving you, etc. The Chili's where my parents live is awesome, though, so go figure.  If you haven't had them before, get the chicken and steak fajita plate. Love the way it comes out sizzling, and the topping / salsa /guacamole are yummy. I also really enjoy the buffalo chicken salad. Huge portion and super tasty!

Chili's has been a family fave for quite some time.  It's definitely not the healthiest choice, but it's a tasty, family-friendly one.  Their wide variety of food makes dining with picky eaters (like my little sis) a cinch!  Chili's has a nice-sized specialty drink menu as well as a cute kid's menu--See, great for the whole family.  And the manageable wait times make this a great spot for a last-minute family dinners. The last time I dined at this location was with step-mom and little half-sister.  My sister is pretty darn fickle when it comes to eating.  She only likes certain foods, and they've got to be unhealthy.  Luckily, Chili's has cheese fries with bacon bits... And on the kid's menu there's macaroni and cheese.  Yay.   She had both.  Us "grown ups" ordered a crap-ton of food.   I ordered the cup of chicken enchilada soup, shared the triple dipper appetizer, and ordered the chicken crispers and the half rack of the baby back ribs; and my step-mom ordered the mini-burgers.  Needless to say, our table was incredibly overcrowded.  In order to fit everything on our table, we had to stack and consolidate - it was a complete mess.  And due to the side dishes that came with the entrees, we had a ridiculous amount of starch.  Waaaay more than enough. In other words, portions are generous; starch portions are extremely generous.   The overall experience was okay.   The food was tasty and sinful as always...  Service, on the other hand, was not so good.  They were slightly busy and messed up on an order, then forgot several things we had asked for...  The water refilling was a little slow too.  Hmm... Understaffed??   We were in no rush, but felt slightly forgotten. :( We will be back, but hopefully when they are fully staffed or not as busy. Yelp 365 - #013/365

the food is always good and normally we have great service.. tonight we did not have great service, but I won't rate them poorly based on one time. One thing to note is that most meals are big enough for 2; my boyfriend and I typically split an appetizer and a meal and are full. If you're traveling from the mainland it is also important to know that there are NOT 2 for 1 drinks and there are not free chips and salsa at the bar. That was hard for me to wrap my head around but using social media can get you freebees so take advantage of that. (For example: yelp gave us a free queso coupon... sadly the queso=not so good).  We did try the new table side guacomole, it was fantastic. They bring the components of the guac to ur table and make it in front of you. Definitely give it a try.

Okay seriously... I walk in the door stand there and there are a bunch of employees. I ask to make a take out order and the one employee tells me go to the bar to place a take out order. I go to the bar and he tells me go over to the back I go to the back and stand there and no one is there so I sit down and dial on my cell phone the restaurant and no get serviced fast sheesh I am surprised I still placed my order... ugh lol but right after the person on the phone says okay 15 min lol I say no worries I'm sitting in here lol hahaha geez! At least the person who finally came to the window was really nice!

I always enjoy the food. it is hard for me to enter when I see an employees smoking less then the state law 20 feet from the entrance. if management doesn't care about following state laws what else aren't they following.

Ate here this past weekend. Southwestern Eggrolls are good. We ordered the triple dipper. ($13?) Boneless buffalo wings are better when you scrape off the batter. I love buffalo wings, but their sauce is less than mediocre. It tasted like watered down tabasco sauce.  Half rack of ribs were tender, and good.  The 10 oz sirloin was ordered medium, but came out well done and dry as hell. We let the manager know, and she was nice enough to give us a generous discount without us asking. (the half rack was the combo special $20-25?) Raspberry presidente margarita ($10) - you get a small salt rim glass, but they give you the shaker to refill your drink. Refreshing, and good. Service was good.

This place deserves 0 stars. I just had the worst experience at a restaurant in all my years of dining. It was so bad I felt the need to write this immediately.  It's 8:30 pm on a Friday and we ask for outdoor seating. Hostess says will be 15 mins. We grab a drink at the bar. 10 mins later our buzzer rings and she tells us is a booth ok? They are no longer seating outside.  Fine since we have no choice. She seats us at a booth and the table is still dirty. We ask the waitress to please have it cleaned.  She looks at it, nods and walks away. 10 minutes later we had to ask her again. We placed our order pretty much right when we sat down...mind you I was starving.  Our food took 30 minutes, and everyone else was either getting their food or was already done. We ordered steak (medium rare) & salmon and a pepperoni pizza. the plate was hot...meaning it was under the heat lamp for a while.  The salmon was over cooked and the steak was RAW. When we complained to the manager, she apologizes but didn't even offer us any compensation. However, they were so bad I wouldn't go back even for a free meal because of the crappy service and disgusting food. I know I should have waited a day to write this but the experience was so bad I had to get it off my chest.

Came here for breakfast..overpriced and Zippy's more for your value same FOOD. My portugese sausage was burnt on one side (granted did not taste burnt but when flipped over..black) My brother's sausage also was overdone. I asked for soyu sauce and had to chase another waiter down. For the $30 I paid you should go to Eggs n Things endure the wait but be happier with your breakfast. Never again here...

We had a lovely experience.  Food was good, but what made it a dining experience instead of just eating was their server Jessica.  Attentive, friendly, and knowledge, her service expertise completed our evening.

This is honestly nothing like the outdated pseudo-Mexican joint chilis used to be. The food here is tasty, their bartenders are attentive & crank out great drinks, and the service here is pretty great. If you've written off chilis in the past, you won't be disappointed to give the revamped chilis another go.

Chili's is a fun place to take the family out for dinner. I knew this when I looked down at the floors which look like the kind your kids can splatter food all over and then the staff will just hose em down at night's end. It was noisy enough that no one seemed to notice or care that our two kid were yapping up a storm and this fact made it easier for me to relax and just enjoy our dinner. Our waiter was overly busy (seemed like there was just two waiters for the whole place) but always friendly. We did have to wait quite a while, maybe 15 minutes, for our food. But we got a sampler appetizer platter with spring rolls and potato skins which made us happy and the fresh, crispy chips that came with salsa were really good.We ate the whole basket of chips! The bf ordered these wicked deep fried boneless chicken strips with tons of spicy honey chipotle sauce on it which was GOOD. I got the Southern Smokehouse Bacon Burger which had two really thick slices of maple bacon that were so yummy I ate one slice by itself. Someone else in our party ordered the Classic Bacon Burger which was yummy but not as good as the one I ordered. Only problem was being so full I didn't get to try the Chocolate Chip Paradise Pie or Molten Chocolate Cake so we definitely will be going back soon.

When I go to this restaurant, I just never know what to order. Everything is either too fried, or too meat-y.  But today, I found the cobb salad. I ordered it with no chicken and bacon and extra of the other stuff...and it wasn't bad at all! I mean the egg was a bit suspicious, but it was edible. LoL.  I've experienced better restaurants so this one will have to be a two star-er.  Yelp 365 Challenge #34/365

If I could give 0 stars, I would! I've been here many times, always mediocre service. Always waiting for ever to be seated. The food isn't that good either, I prefer the Pearl a Ridge location any day. But there is one particular occasion that just made me never want to go there again. We went out for dinner for my father in laws birthday on Saturday, we were seated outside by these torches. My 3 year old son had just woken up so he was fussy and was freaking out, the manager knew but didn't offer us a spot inside.. Then we waited 20 minutes for the water to come, then another 20 minutes for him to take our order. We were going to get appetizers but we didn't because he took so long to come check on us so we just ordered our food. Then he messed up our orders, then we were dumb enough to order dessert. We waited a while more for that. Now this part, takes the cake.. Everyone paid their bills in cash except me. The waiter charged my card all three of our family's bills! My bill alone was $115 (with tip) then he charged another $80 & $70! Luckily I seen it on my bank account! I went in the next day and they were brushing it off like it was no big deal. The manager refunded me one bill but not the other. It's Tuesday now & still nothing in my bank. He said wait another day then goes "I'll help you out like I did the other bill" like he's doing ME a favor! I'm beyond disgusted with this location. I never am going back again! I bet that waiter pocketed the money.. He had no remorse the next day when we seen us, all he said was "I must've charged the wrong card" (keep in mind, they all paid in cash so there's no other cards he could've gotten it mixed up with) then he just walked away. No sorry, nothing. Ugh.

Went here for to-go order and it basically ruined my night. I made a yelp account just so I could post this review. Ordered over phone at 6:10 said it would be ready by 6:40. Showed up at 6:40 and waited at the bar. Bartender was really nice by offering a cup of water but that's basically the high light of the night.  By 7:15 finally asked where the food was to which they spend 15 minutes looking for it:  When we paid by then it was cold but paid anyway because I'm not the type of person to make a big deal out of things but by the time I got home I wish I had. Food was cold and I live about 5 minutes away. $50 down the drain. Thank you for nothing chilis I'll be sure not to go back.

I was so excited to go to Chili's.  Been there before, my grandniece had not.  No problems with greeting or sitting down, servers were a-ok.  Problem with the food, soup served lukewarm, mac and cheese for kids, COLD. No silverware given, after we were given our food, server split after we asked for utensils to eat with, after about 8 minutes he was walking around the back so I got up and grabbed silverware myself.  Moreover, soup and mac and cheese were definitely going COLDER by the second, so asked to be warmed up, ah, ah.  After warming okay.  Nothing to get excited about, Chili's isn't the place to be for an awesome dinner and good time!  Save your money and go elsewhere.  Next time we'll go to the Counter!
The foods come out too slow. And it was dried. I think I can cook better than that. I think they used low quality steak. I waited for my foods to come out like 30 minutes after we order it.

I came here on a monday night around 630 PM. It wasn't crowded so we were seated immediately.  For appetizer we had their special tripple decker where we selected 3 from a list. I had the spinach artichoke dip, southwestern eggrolls, and boneless buffalo wings. The spinach artichoke dip was delicious despite the few large chucks of artichoke. It came with chips that were very thin and complimented the dip very well. The dip was not so heavy because it was topped with cheese and tomatoes. The southwestern eggrolls were also very delicious. I'm not a big fan of beans but I loved the beans in the egg rolls. The only appetizer I would do without is the boneless buffalo wings. They were too salty and tasted like something I could buy premade at costco and heat in the oven myself.  For dinner I had the rib eye which was 12 oz. I ordered it medium rare but half came medium rare and the other half came medium well. The sides that I chose were broccoli and cole slaw. Their cole slaw was okay but the broccoli was too soft and watery. I guess I'm used to slightly cooked broccoli that is sauteed rather than boiled.  My parents shared the same dish as I, but instead they got the loaded mashed potatoes and french fries as their sides. The loaded mashed potatoes is similar to a baked potato but without the potato skin. Their french fries were also okay. Not great, but not bad. The worst thing about this experience was the service. I took a while for the server to give us some boxes for our food and our check. I would come back again for the food, but I would be prepared to experience long waits for a table or for service. ** Happy hour is from 4-6 and it's something like $2 off appetizers and $2 off 23 oz draft beer **Order online To Go at

My son constantly picks this place to dine in when we are out at one of his events -  I usually let him & grandma go it alone while my little one & I head home ..... BUT this time we were in their car so we had no choice !! We got there around 2PM and got seated right away in the bar area .... lucky it was a booth so my toddler could feel free but still be trapped !!  We had a really nice & kid friendly server ... she immediately had my little miss set up with crayons,  a coloring book, & a sippy cup filled with water !!  My mom, daughter,  and I had the sampler where you have three choices of various fried type items and my son had a huge bacon burger with fries .... everything was pretty good.... and sadly fattening !! *loved that I could relax and not worry about my daughters not so "library" voice, free refills, reasonable prices, decent food, and great service ! ** did not love the bathrooms ... seemed like the toilets have leaks on the bottoms ... do not like stepping in unidentified liquids or my daughter splashing in it !!

When my (now) boyfriend asked me on our first date, he let me pick the place and I suggested Chili's and he said, "Or we could go somewhere nice." For the life of me, I don't know why more people don't get into Chili's.  They have good food (especially their Local Menu), the prices are reasonable and they have tons of variety with their drink menu.  It's a nice place! The one thing about this particular location is the turn over of waiters.  The service tends me be a bit slow and I don't think I've ever seen the same person working there twice.  I once went here when the manager was trying to stop a group of employees from walking out.  I believe they worked in the kitchen. She then came over to apologize for the wait and explained that they just lost a lot of staff and the food would take a bit longer.  She comped appetizers while we waited.  Whatever problems this location has had in the past must have been managerial - but I've actually never had a customer service or food issue here. Parking is close, they move the tables pretty quickly and they make some of my favorite salads. Not to mention if you sign up for their e-mail newsletter they send you a coupon for free appetizers or desserts (you can choose) at least once a month.  I once got one for a free pizza that was delicious, as well. People can knock Chili's all they want.  I'm not here to change minds. But, it just means more open tables for the rest of us!

I'm typically satisfied with my visit each time.  The new side dishes they offer are pretty good. The jalapeño cornbread was yummy, goes great with my chicken enchilada soup. The triple dipper is a great shareable item.  The service is good as well.  I was somewhat surprised to hear the servers refer to dining guest as love, sweetie & darling.  Glad I stopped in this evening.

We went to Chili's on a Tuesday night so the place wasn't packed. My boyfriend's parents had beaten us to the table and had already ordered. Our server let my boyfriend and I have a few minutes to review the menu and said he'd be back in a couple to take our order. I think he forgot about us. Strike 1. By the time he came back to take our order, my boyfriend's parents were receiving their food. I had checked into yelp (*duh*) and found that there was an offer for free chips and queso! Who doesn't like a  deal?! So of course we took the deal. Our food eventually came though our server totally walked past our table, forgetting who the food was for. At that point, we were like "maybe he has a bunch of tables tonight..." and tried to give him the benefit of the doubt. He also was not attentive to us and only cleared our dishes when we asked him to. Strike 2. The food wasn't terrible, but the reason this review is getting one star is because of what happened when we got the bill. My boyfriend has a mall discount so for Tuesday, it should have been 20% (or 25%?). When we tried to apply the discount, our server said that we couldn't apply two discounts (the yelp deal and the 20% discount) on the same bill. We didn't understand but we asked to pay for the queso and apply the 20% discount to the bill. FIRST our server tried to convince us that the discount for the queso was going to be the better deal than the 20% off. Um, let's do the math... NOPE, it was not the better deal. SECOND, he said that since he keyed in the queso discount, he could not override it to use the 20% discount instead. SAY WHAT? THEN the manager comes out and tells us that he is unable to override the computer and he cannot void the whole transaction so that they could start over. I call BS. Because we didn't want to make a scene in front of his parents, we didn't continue our fight (though the server and the manager were being ridiculous). So, whatever, we just paid the bill (their tip was us paying the part we would have been discounted). Strikes 3, 4, & 5 (yes, I know there are only 3 strikes in baseball, but that's how crap-tastic they were.) If you are looking for crappy service and possibly some BS when it comes to discounts, Chili's Kahala is the place to be. Otherwise, stay away.
authentic mexican food, probably not but they do have my favorite sandwich: the bacon avocado chicken with pretzel bun which gives it a 5 star alone.  Also the sizzling fajitas are good.

This is a review about the service. The food is good, and consistent with other Chili's restaurants. What I'd like to applaud is the excellent service we received the other evening, especially thanking Alicia (the GM) for going above and beyond, as well as Lou, our server, for her friendly, efficient attention to our table. You made our evening super! Mahalo!

Not really a fan...the food is okay. It really varies each time I've been here. The customer service was good one night and terrible the other. The waiters/waitresses have forgotten about my coworkers and I countless times. I only recommend this place if you are starving.

If you go to this location, ask to sit in CASEY'S section.  I believe there is only one, since everytime we come, we always get the same casey. She is amazing, very friendly, super attentive, and she knows what she is doing compared to the other locations I have been to.  I ordered the chicken crispers and my bf ordered the sirloin and the food came out great and hot! Our drinks were always filled, and we always had chips and salsa. Everyone seemed so happy to be at work, everyone had a smile on their face!  We sat near the bar, and surprisingly there was only one bar tender, and I'll admit we went around dinner time and it was some what busy, whoever she is, she was quick! One worker handling all those customers? #Skills lol!  I love coming here for dinner, and whenever casey is working, she always makes my time here amazing! Someone needs to tell her boss to give her a raise or something, I have never seen customer service this excellent before.

Our server today was Victoria. The service and food were wonderful! She made a great lunch a remarkable one! Friendly, helpful, prompt and professional. She is a credit to this restaurant - we will return! Happy customers!

We dine here fairly frequently.  The last couple times we have come in the service has improved greatly.  They must have gotten better management.   The food is comforting.  Basic American and Tex-Mex options.  I was ono for a burger tonight, but noticed there were some fresh new side dish options.  I'm excited to try these anther time. Be sure to check in on yelp when you dine here.  I ended up with a check in offer for free chips & queso. I am not a fan of the new Ziosk tablets on all the tables.  It seems to just be in the way.

Although the restaurant was 1/2 full it still was about a 45 minute wait. The hostess apologized for the wait stating, "the cook needed to catch up" upon seating us. It was 1930 on a Sunday evening when we were seated and there was a large party of about 20 that was wrapping their dinner. As always, we come here for the location and the kids love the kids meals offered. Yelp/chili's has a great chips and queso check in offer that softens the wait time. Plus the kids get a kick out of the game console on the table even though they can play for free on their phones (???)

I am never impressed with servers that do not write the orders down.. I always have the gut feeling that they will forget something or make a mistake on my order..  Of course.. A side a did not want was on my plate and touching my steak and rice pilaf.. Grrrr..  At least my food tasted well .. What was away from the steamed broccoli.. Yuck..  Server was attentive at least and gave me a large portion of the replacement side I wanted..

I was expecting slow to bad service since we had a party of 16 on a Saturday night. But I must say I was really impressed w Chilis! We got there about 20 minutes before our reservation time and checked in and our table was already open for us. Our waiter was David and he was really attentive. Always refilling our drinks, giving us more napkins when he noticed we had kids, etc. The food also came out pretty quick which was a plus.  Foods to try: 6 oz sirloin w grilled avocado (liter menu) Boneless loaded wings appetizer (DEELISH!!! I pretty much ate the whole thing by myself, so addicting!!!) Fajitas! Havent tried anything else but I will for sure be going back. This was such a great experience! Thank you Chilis!

I came in on a Sunday night with a group of 6, was pretty busy. I waited a while, but once we got sat everything got better. Our server, looked very young, but super professional and made our day. Al I think his name was Christian. He was so patient with our children and answered all of our questions not too mention thanks for talking us into that berry thingy. It was so good..  The food came out fast, drinks were always full, and anything we needed he answered with a smile. I'm just surprised by this bc i usually receive poor service bc of my age(being only 21). Yet, our service was amazing not to mention our food came out perfect (surprisingly). Usually there always something wrong when my family goes out. So thank you Chili's for the awesome family night.

Chili's used to just be "okay" for me but in the last few years they've updated their menu and everything tastes great. Ironically, CPK was one of our favorites but they must have changed their chef because a couple times our food was junk and the portions are small now. Anyway, now we go to Chili's all the time! The service is generally good but that depends on your server, and the food is delicious. The portions are a good size and the prices are reasonable. We especially like their 'smokehouse burger' with bacon and onion rings in it, as well as their ribs.
Love the free appetizers. Delicious! And Karen is great fun. She should train new waiters with her enthusiasm.

Chili's  Shaye was our server. Very friendly. Do the "Check In". You get the free order of chips and Queso. Ordered the Smokehouse Combo with the House Baby Back Ribs and Jalapeño Cheese sausage. They made a mistake on the order but corrected it promptly. Friendliness is a key word for our server. Manager on duty Alicia introduced herself and checked on us more than once. Unlimited refills on the ice teas are recommended. There was an error on the bill but is being corrected as we speak.
Just no. Every time I think to try chilis again I regret my decision. Food is tasteless and unhealthy.

My husband and kids came here for the first time ; my second ! Greeted immediately & given the choice of booth half or full , we didn't really mind anything. We were seated and greater by our server who first thing introduced himself (can't remember his name) and immediate got us started with drinks ! His trainer came after and introduced himself (don't remember his name either ) but introduced himself as "support" instead of trainer or overseer ! to me it gave me the feeling that he trusted the 'new guy'   We order cheese pizza w/pineapples & corn dogs & mandarin oranges for the kids. Husband ordered some burger bacon burger and I orders spicy shrimp taco!  Let's just say we demolished everything ... my favorite is my tacos the shrimp was an enjoyable spicy & I loved the avocado and everything in it !  My review is mainly off of service because the service I receive will reflect how I feel about my food, for a new guy serving us & my husband with his picky orders and specifics the kid did great !

Thanks to Kianna for being extra patient with me while she took my picky guy order.  She basically had the cook strip my chicken enchiladas of all the peppers, spicy sauces, beans, and sour cream.  I actually like the taste of the food better without the extra stuff.  Never appeared rushed and always smiling.  Appreciate the great customer service.
Kelly the bartender is wonderful with a pleasant attitude and fey is a awesome as well

The average rating of 3 stars pretty much sums it up for Chili's.   I've eaten at the one in Kapolei a bunch of times since I'm near there but was in town and Mark H wanted his baby backs so we hit up this location.  We both got the Presidential Margaritas which is a good amount but kind of on the weak side and definitely a mix instead of scratch made (wasn't expecting it to be scratch made so not really disappointed in it.)  We passed on apps and just ordered entrees...MH got the original baby backs and I got the pork/chicken fajitas.  Nothing much to say about these dishes except it's pretty much average at best and the reason I only eat at Chili's every couple of years. One thing I will add is that after ordering our food, I checked in on Yelp and saw they offer a free queso and chips appetizer with check in.  The queso wasn't so good but the chips are good, crispy and really thin so they seem extra crunchy.  I think of all things I've had here, the chips are definitely the best.  It's too bad they no longer offer a complimentary basket of them. :( Oh, and also if you check in and get the free queso/chips, remember to double check your bill because they charged us for it and we didn't realize it 'til we had left...and...after I realized it, I remembered the last time I was at Kapolei they did the exact same thing, so DOUBLE CHECK your bill before leaving!

i come here to get food to go. multiple wait staff pass me. no one acknowledges that i'm there. i usually wait a good 5-10 minutes before the actual person who mana the to go area comes. i assume the mangers are the only ones dressed differently. they don't even acknowledge your presence. good thing the food is better than the service. i don't know how much more i can take of being ignored.

This was my first time trying out this Chilis location, and it was the best experience that I've had at a Chilis location so far! Our server was Kevin D, and he was perfectly attentive! He provided great service, I hope we always get a server like him! The food was great, my boyfriend decided to indulge himself haha. He ordered the classic ribeye, a strawberry lemonde, and the salted caramel molten. The ribeye was cooked perfectly, and had great seasoning, and the desert was delicious! I chose the chipotle chicken Tex mex bowl, and I'll definitely be ordering it the next time we come (: Overall, we had such a great experience, that we plan on coming here on most of our weekly date nights c:
The service here is so much faster compared to the other Chilis restaurants on the island. The bottomless soup and salad is amazing and their tableside guacamole is always good
Enjoyable experience.  Service was great.  Had the triple appetizer and tortilla soup. Meal was exelant.

We arrived right before the evening rush, and honestly it was just too darned hot so we decided to grab a bite in the AC at Chili's. Always remember to check in at Chili's, so you can get your free chips and queso. Margaritas are always fun, and they are served in the shaker, so you get more than one drink. I went with a healthy choice, which had sirloin, salad, and cherry tomatoes. I think it's a seasonal dish, but it was really yummy. Hubs had the tacos, and everything was served hot, no long wait, and the water was always topped off.  Overall I'm a fan of Chili's, it's always a great go-to restaurant.
Great service. Karen was awesome.   She knew all the beers, and even gave us some background on the presidente margarita.

First time visiting this Chili's and I have to say the food was out of this world. We have visited 3 in Hawaii  (Mililani, Kapolei, and now this one) and the food was outstanding! Usually when my husband and I order the margarita flat bread it's overcooked and doesn't look appealing, this one not only looked great but it tasted better than it looked. It wasn't overcooked, it was crispy in the right places and flavorful!! I got the spicy chile chicken and WOW WOW WOW. The chicken breast was huge, it was juicy and had so much flavor with every bite. The broccoli was done just right and seasoned well, the wheatberry and quinoa blend was tasty and perfectly cooked, not dry at all like the other 2 locations. I would've taken a picture of my husbands ultimate bacon burger with avocado but he scoffed it down too quick LOL. But the presentation was outstanding! Your staff and cooks need to keep up the fantastic job they're doing! Best Chili's on the island.

I've had their enchiladas before and the tortillas were soft tonight they actually didn't meet up to my expectations.  They could've been old shells. I gonna take home but I'll ask for extra sour cream sauce, which our waiter gave at no extra charge. Wasn't his fault my dish came out crappy.  We only go there cuz usually I order the salad and that is always good and so are the drinks. They need to learn how to make Sangria. They tried one time we went and it was terrible but again the wait staff was good and our alternate drinks were good. Well, my child will eat my leftovers and I gotta start wrapping.

Thanks sooooooo much Victoria!!!!... for making our evening!!!! We are both not huge chili fans but would come back just to have her serve us!!! I can't express how much she really made our evening above and beyond all expectations !!!!!!!!!!!!! We love u and good luck in your travels!!! Xoxo we lava u!!!! Nicole and Astrida

Went here for lunch the other day.  You guys should definitely activate the Yelp deal of free chips and queso. Anyways, the food was absolutely delicious. So why the three stars? The food took so long to come out! Our party was there for two hours.  Besides that however, the food and service was absolutely amazing.

The lunch that we ordered was very good,but what made our lunch was not only the food but our waiter Rocky he gave such excellent service! He's definitely getting a good tip from us . Very attentive and accommodating.

Not sure about the poor reviews on this chilis location but I have no problem here.  Obviously my reviews are usually based on expectations.  Since this is well "chilis", I don't expect very high standards.  Usually seating is very quick, for a party of 4 I have never waited more than an 1/2 hour.  What I like about chilis is you get a lot for what you pay.  Definitely best bang for your buck.  They have awesome sides and appetizers like the cheesy bites and baked mash potatoes.  Love the fact that they serve complimentary refills on soft drinks and usually my server always fills them up.  The dessert is great especially the baked cookie with ice cream :D.  The only knock down is sometimes the server takes to long in regards to clearing our table.  But all in all good place to eat.

I used to go to Chili's a lot back in the day with my military buddies because when I first got to the island when I didn't know much about the local cuisine. After taking a 5 year break from the big name restaurants, I decided to come back and give it a shot. The menu has changed quite a bit, which is expected. Prices seemed reasonable. I ordered a mix plate of chicken tostada, beef enchilada, and chicken tacos. It came with beans and rice. Not too much to say about the food in general. It was satisfying and the portions were big enough for me to take home as leftovers. There are a lot of other menu items that I would like to try next time. I was satisfied with the service. The server checked on us regularly and had no problems splitting the bill. There was also a touch screen device to order and pay the bill but the server showed up frequently enough that we never used it.

I visit the Kapolei location often. Food is good staff is great, but chili's is lacking  when it comes to a selection of beer. Please up your selection to include Red's and Amber's. I a time when micro brews popping up all over the place and a resurgent in home brewing ppl are wanting a better selection of good beers when they go out.

The Kahala Chili's is merely ok overall in my experience of going there several times over the last 6 years.  The food is served barely warm and is way too salty and heavy.  The prices are way too high for what you get.

I usually enjoy me some Chili's when it's feeling right... but, never again at the Kahala location!  Hostess sucked or perhaps she was just having a super crappy day...  Wait service sucked & maybe they were having a crappy day too... It wasn't that crowded at all but, the hostess was making like it was a big issue trying to seat us... and made us wait as she...walked around? She didn't take us to our seats, she pointed at the table... No one came to our table to offer drinks or say Hi or anything for 30 minutes... so, we tried to get someone's attention even though they did see us sitting there but, chose to just keep walking past, making like they're busy... so, finally... we got up and walked out and still, no one said anything...  errr?!?! seriously.......?  Not even ONE star...

This is one of my favorite restaurants and I can tell you the good, the bad and the ugly. This review has 5 stars because I can, and I feel like it.  So many people are bashing this place like it's horrible, but it's really not.  Maybe my standards are lower, or maybe I just understand that this isn't just a restaurant... It's more of a sports bar, with a dining room area. Or maybe it's because every time I go there, I get bomb ass service from mostly the same servers... But I don't go frequently cause I'm not rich enough to buy really good expensive food all the time, but I usually get the same servers.  And every time, I get awesome ones.  I don't know all their names... but there's this really tall guy, he towers over everyone, he is very nice. This nerdy guy is on it with his servicing. This really nice lady Jessica, she always wears pretty makeup and has nice dark brown/black hair. This one server Nicole, has a super nice smile and makes you feel welcome! There's so much more, but I can't remember everyone. Also, the Hostesses are always nice and greet whoever walks in.  And sometimes, if it's slow, they'll even open the door for you when you arrive AND depart! Now for the food. I know what to buy, but I don't know what not to buy... I'll list everything that is AMAZING in no specific order. Big mouth bites Egg rolls Chicken crispers Caujin pasta Flat bread pizza Nachos (only if you have that green thing to dip it in!) Mac n' Cheese (because everyone has a kid food they love!) Steak and cheese sandwich (this fills you up if you eat a lot and it comes with fries) Spinach and artichoke dip with chips (when eating this, use your fork to pick up the dip, and put it on your chip. Chilis chips are thin, but better for you if you're going to have a full meal!) Ribs (They're good by itself, but taste amazing with ranch sauce, trust me.) Everything off the low calorie menu is good for you and that's probably why it doesn't taste as good as everything else, but hey, why go to a sports bar & grill if you're not gonna pig out like a sports fan? Salad is salad.  It tastes the same everywhere. Their desert though. ;D Oh my Oh My!!!!!! The MOLTEN CHOCOLATE LAVA CAKE IS BY FAR the best desert I've ever had at a 2.5 star restaurant.  Seriously guys.  2.5 stars? WTF?  Just for this lava cake I'd give it 5 stars! I honestly think all you low stars should go back to chilis on a slow day, request a server by name and get at least one of the food choices I've said were amazing.  Just look in the good reviews, pick a name, and request that person to serve you.  Any time during the day is slower than normal.  Never go on a Friday night.  Fridays are crazy. And to all of those "first time and last time I'll ever eat here," You're all dumb.  Just cause something was shitty once, you're just gonna say it sucks shit and you'll never go back.  Um excuse me? You ate there once and you judge it by that one time? I ate at this one restaurant in waikiki, the service sucked and the food was just pricey and I was still hungry, but that didn't stop me from going again because all restaurants are pricey, and people work so hard in waikiki, I wouldn't blame them for being cranky or forgetful. I know what it's like to work in the restaurant business.  If you've never worked at one, I understand why you would give it low stars.  You don't know what it's like.
rip off alert!!! regular nachos are 8 individual chips with beans and cheese melted in top for $8.   big time rip off when bottomless chios and salsa is $5.

This place isnt too bad!  After hiking/beaching all day, we were in the area and just wanted some food and beer.  They have blue moon on draft :)  And the server was really nice!   The spinach artichoke dip was pretty damn good.  The chips are kind of thin and break easily, but eh, oh well.  I had a burger that wasn't that bad, though they kind of cheated me out on fries, not enough fries!  Not a bad burger though.  And service was awesome.

I ate at this place since they first opened their stores in Kapolei and Mililani when I was a teenager.... and as I grew older I would come back here from time to time, and besides one mishap with their ribs I've actually never had a bad meal here.  But why write about it now?  Well, besides yelp... I just tried their 10 things for under $7.  Which, for the bad economic times, are great for a restaurant to have.   After reading what they have I notice that everything is in a half portion (which is fine by me b/c I couldn't finish the full portion before).  So they had things like their quesadillas, nachos, hambuger, sliders (chicken or beef), etc.  All came with one choice of a side.  So I got the quesadilla (jalapeno steak flavor with a side of rice and beans.  You have to add $1.99 for that, BUT I got my one side on top of that... which was a loaded mash potatoes) and the bf got 2 chicken tacos and corn on the cob (I gave him my mash potatoes). The flavors are always spot on at Chilis.  I know it's not authentic, so when I say  "flavors are spot on" I don't mean the flavors are reminiscent of that time in Cabo.. lol.  I just mean it tasted good.  I could only eat 3 quesadillas (comes with 4) and I was pushing myself beyond stuffed (but I have my days when I can't eat that much)... and I've had their chicken tacos before and its awesome.  But, this place gets 4 stars for the value for our buck with good flavor, especially for a restaurant during these hard economic times.

A Chili's is a Chili's is a Chili's, in my mind. I am reviewing it for what it is- a chain casual concept restaurant that I always consider myself slightly unlucky to end up in. I try to avoid chains at all costs, but it seems like sometimes when we're in kahala the options for casual sit down are cpk or Chili's, so I have now eaten here 3 times.  The first time was mostly for drinks and appetizers. The drinks were ok, but all from mixes (mojito mix, maybe even margarita mix) which I just hate. After the first mixed drink I just switched to beer, which I think was a good choice. We ordered the nachos, and imagine our surprise when out came a small plate with about 10 chips placed prettily in a circle. When I order nachos (and pay normal to high price for them) I want a big pile of chips, melty cheese, and gooey toppings. this dish just seemed to scream identity crisis. I expect that kind of thing at a fine dining restaurant, but not a Chili's. Plus, there weren't even good toppings or enough cheese. Boo. The other times I've gone I got the Buffalo Chicken salad, without the pico de gallo or bacon, which just seems like overkill to me. I also substitute blue cheese dressing because I have a personal vendetta against ranch. The servers have been accommodating of my strange requests, and the food has always come out the way I asked for it, which is more than I expect when I mess with the menu descriptions so much.  My complaints food-wise are just that it is overpriced for what it is. A fifteen dollar salad at a casual chain pains me a little. It isn't the end of the world, but it defintely keeps me from going more often. If I'm going to spend that much, I'd rather go to a "real" restaurant. 3 stars because it's fine for what it is. The food is ok, the service has always been good overall. just don't expect amazing.

i have to be honest with you - i never really did like Chili's to begin with - so going in to eat at this place, i already had it in my head that i wasnt going to like the food..... our server MUST HAVE been a rookie b/c DAMN.  it was like watching a chicken run around with its head cut off - and he had a memory to match.  we had to remind him of our orders about 3 times before everything actually made it to the table. in addition, my friend who ordered the chicken crispers found a hair in her entree.... not the side dish she wanted. the Chili at Chili's is MEEEEHHHHHHH.  stick with Zippy's if you're going to eat chili, or just make it at home.  i'm sure whatever you can throw together will be mountains better than the chili from chili's... ironic, isnt it? and their "new" nacho appetizer is disappointing.  it would make a Tex-Mexican cry.   the small portion is literally 8 chips - each chip is individually topped with nacho fixins..... the chips are then soggy b/c of this overload, and skimpy b/c they top each individual chip.  WTF.  i'd rather eat sand-meat from Taco Bell at this point..... at least i'd get more nachos for cheaper!  this was bout 9 bucks!!!  thumbs way down.   i find that the longer a chain restaurant is in Hawaii.... the more the quality goes down... why is this??

The last time we came here, they put dirty dishes on our table as "clean dishes." We decided to give it another shot. This time it took 30+ minutes for them to take our order, but when the food came, we had to get our own utensils. No napkins or anything. Our food was good and there weren't any problems. After that, service was a little faster. We payed cash just because we didn't want to wait any longer. The only good thing about this place is that our waitress was very nice.

My favorite thing about this Chili's location is the "Hawaiian Local Plate".  You choose one meat dish and it comes with a side of macaroni salad and two scoops of rice.  It's delicious.  If not for that, I don't think I would be such a fan. Other than that, I don't find it any different from the other Chili's restaurants on the mainland.  They have a very small indoor waiting area, so on most weekends you'll have to wait outside.  They do have a considerable amount of outdoor seating that faces the mall (by the Counter).  Normally we don't have to wait more than 30 minutes to be seated.   Inside there is a bar area to the left and restaurant seating to the right.  The bar has TVs, tables for larger groups and booths.  I find most of their specialty drinks over very fruity and super sweet, which might not be your cup of tea.  One night they were giving out free Sweet Shots (their signature dessert) and every flavor we tried was awful.  I would not recommend it. The service is usually friendly, and we've never had a problem.  It is unusually cold inside, though.  I've heard many people complain, but there doesn't seem to be anything they can do about it.  I normally bring a jacket or sweater if I plan to eat there.  They have carry-out, but I ordered once before and found I only got one scoop of rice with my meal (totally unacceptable by any "local plate" standards).  It's a great place to eat if you like traditional American restaurants, they ca accommodate large groups easily, and I really enjoy that they have a dish that appeals to local clientele.  I'm a regular.

Had dinner here with my family.  Had chips and queso compliments of Yelp!!  Dinner was Crispy chicken tacos, Santa Fe salad, and Chicken Enchiladas!!  Winnas!!   Quantities were generous, prices were reasonable, and taste and service was fabulous!  What a great dining experience!!  Thank you Chilis and Yelp!!

Like a moth to a flame i keep coming back for one mediocre meal after another.  The only reason i come here is because it's the closest bar from the office and after a long day at work nothing is better than getting a few beers rather than sit in traffic on H1 through town.   As a chain, these guy's are notorious for having salty food.  A lot of Chilis menu items rate very high on national nutritional tests for outlandish sodium and high caloric levels.  Case in point is the buffalo chicken sliders which  are so salty they're inedible.  Their cheese fries are like a heart attack on a plate.  Their spin dip isn't bad but CPK is across the street and has a much better version.   Burgers here always come out well done no matter if you ask for rare. I've had five well done burgers here.   I don't know why the hell they even bother asking the customer what temp they want the burger since they're gonna zap the hell out of it anyway.  If you end up having to eat something here, the fajitas are the most palatable item.

We don't usually like chain restaurants for dinner but in some sense it's always the safe way to go. You know what you're going to get every time. And when you're in the Kaimuki/Kahala area there are not many casual choices after 10pm. This review reflects the past two times we've been there. Tonight was the second time in the last three weeks We ordered the ribs, buffalo chicken sandwich, triple dipper with boneless buffalo chicken/chicken crispers/and spinach artichoke dip, house salad, and a cup of chili.  The ribs were nicely cooked with the meat falling off the bone, but I would've liked more sauce with it.  The chicken crispers were surprisingly good. Nice batter on the outside and juicy meat.  Buffalo wings and sandwich were good. Yes, you might say buffalo sauce is buffalo sauce, but I've had bad buffalo wings before.  I love buffalo sauce in general and theirs was up to par. The other thing that surprised me was the cup of chili. I'm used to Zippy's chili. This chili had a different spice to it AND there were no beans! Obviously I'm not a fan of beans. Like i said earlier you get what you get at chain restaurants. The food isn't why we rated it four stars. The thing that made our dining experience memorable and enjoyable was our server, Joseph, who waited on us both times. On the two occasions we went in near closing time and was his last table both times.  Working in the restaurant industry for 15 years we expected some negligence. Contradicting our expectations he treated us like we were his first table with enthusiasm and attentiveness going above and beyond what most servers in his position would do.  When were ordered he suggested meal combos to save money.  Even though they were doing their closing duties he was still attentive in re-filling drinks and kept checking if we were OK.  And in all honesty we both consumed the beverages quickly and he perfectly timed our re-fills (one of us had three re-fills of lemonade).  There was not one thing that we had to wait for or flag someone else down to get including our check but at the same time never felt rushed for more than once he assured us to take our time. All in all it was the service that will make us return again. When we go back we will be requesting him. ----"There is no love sincerer than the love of food"----

mediocre food for a pretty hefty price tag.  started out with the spinach artichoke dip.  that was pretty good, tastes like the one at CPK.  i wish for the price they give more dip.  it came out in a little skillet and a huge basket of chips...makes no sense.  i ordered the guiltless salmon dish.  $17.99 for five pieces of broccoli, a bowl of beans, and a salmon fillet.  it was ok.  the only thing i la la LOVE is the molten chocolate cake.  that was the highlight  of my meal.  YUM. our server was super cool.  definitely made the experience better.

Ugh I wanted to give no stars. Yep none the experience & service my husband and I had tonight was out right TERRIBLE & UNACCEPTABLE if you want your business to thrive make sure YOUR WORKERS are on top of their A GAME. We had arrived at chilis about 7:00? We we're seated pretty quickly. Our server JESSICA being her name offered us drinks we order drinks & nachos it took 40 mins to get to us she then took our orders & that took another 40 mins as we ate she not once return to check up on us as we ate we became pretty thirsty being we only had one cup of whatever we had.. The other serves around everytime we tried to get their attention ignored us.. She ignored us & took care of everyone else around us giving them refills making sure there dinner time was comfortable but not once did she CHECK ON US the manager came out to apologize & comp a dessert for us but as we waited for our dessert we FINALLY got a refill of our drinks & again we had to wait 30 mins for our dessert.. As we waited for it our server came out with thee lamest excuse EVER! She said "oh I was looking and looking I couldn't find it I think it's in a to go box?" By that time I wanted to go kalihi on her ass but my husband being the gentleman that he is told her " oh no we'll just have it here thank you.." Called over the manager & told her what I had experience tonight was terrible she apologizes again & gave 5$ coupons yah no I won't be comin back! This place will be on my list of WORST places I've been too! Jessica girl I know you worked for bubba gumps before where did your A game from there go?..

If I could give zero stars I would. I don't even know why I waste my time even coming here. They sit us down and we don't even get a greeting or offered a drink for 20 mins. Several waiters and little bus boys pass us but nope we must be invisible. Horrible horrible horrible... Never again. If you want my suggestion get up and walk across the street to California pizza kitchen.

First with a warm and attentive welcome received and friendly professional answering to find me a single table. Apologized for not immediately getting a seat as the restaurant was almost full. Also hostess took to seat and ask for drinks. Water request came within 30 seconds. Excellent  start. But order taker did not come. After 10 minutes I flagged one down and she apologies as she thought order already taken by another person. Order taken just one simple flatbread but after 20 minutes I think the kitchen also has some problems getting the food. My waiteess did a good job by trying to apologies for her earlier mistake of order delay but she also knew they had some kitchen problems as most food was not coming out as seen by other tables. She stopped by several times and apologies and also offered another ready made similar dish if I could not wait. Finally after 30 minutes it came. Asst or mgr came by to apologies again for the ling delay. I informed her I was understanding as I know the business and informed her the waitress handled it well. In the end she gave me a complimentary lunch which was not necessary or expected. I thanked her and informed her the tip is still for the waitress. Hope they have better days. Will come again.
Service was solid, as was the burger, the bacon was excellent, the bacon quesadilla was very yummy, not a favorite but would definitely come back.

My wife loves and will always order the Chicken Crispers (deep fried chicken breast strips) which are super good and juicy.  I usually get the fajitas a sandwich which is ok.  My son will also get the kids meal and usually the crispers too. I admit it, the crispers are the best thing on the menu but I hate to ask if the juicyness of the chicken breast is from the oil or not.  We'd come here all the time just for the crispers and give a 4 or 5 star rating but we'd also be 50 lbs heavier; hence we only come here when we have gift cards to use up.

There is no way to mistake what this is.  Family style restaurant, tons of fat and cholesterol, and a neighborhood bar.  The help is usually pretty gracious, and the menu offers a wide variety of plaque makers.  If you have the munchies and you don't care about calories, there is nothing better at midnight.  The sliders are yummy, the french fries fabulous, and the hot wings - well just, so so. Gotta go now.  Have to run up a mountain for the next hour and a half to burn off last night's munchie meal fat.

45min for take if soup & salad!! unheard of!! girl told me 10-15min. so I sat and waited. not once did she inform me kitchen was running behind or sorry that it's taking so long! I only realized at the 30min mark when I looked at my receipt to see what time I order that I was waiting that long. then I had to wait for her to come to the window & the manager came up and told her the problem. 15 more minutes to make it happen. I might as well should've eaten at the bar! don't do the take out. waste of time!! there only one other person waiting & the phones weren't even ringing by hey were not busy in any way. bad service by Joye C & the blond manager.

Chili's is on of my favorite spots for a fun time with friends; its typically the place for margaritas on an almost weekly basis! The service: with a few exceptions- usually found in the bar area- is generally slow, and can lack personality and/or attentiveness. However, the chips and salsa and guacamole are amazing! The fajitas are bomb! The food keeps me coming back for more. Now let's talk drinks- many margaritas lack the amount of alcohol I desire, so fore go the classics and go for their newest: world's freshest margarita. You can taste the alcohol and its delicious, really can't go wrong! So Chili's may not be a top notch dining destination, but I will continue to be a regular, and always look forward to a fun meal and a couple of drinks!

horrible service- we had to wait 10 minutes for a hostess to even seat us and it took 30 minutes for us to get our food when the restaurant wasn't even busy.  on top of this, we saw employees just sitting around instead of helping customers.  i will never eat here again.

Absolutely terrible service.  When we brought that to the attention of the manager, she tried to give us extra unappetizing food.  Other Chili's on the island are fine, this one will never see my business again.

My friend and I came to Chilis today to watch Thursday Night Football and get some drinks/Pupus.  We sat at the bar around 2:15 and was approached by a woman who said we could order drinks through her but that she was not the bartender.  I had a house Margarita and my friend ordered a beer.  The Margarita she brought over tasted like pure sweet n sour, but I tried to give it a chance.  As she was talking to us we saw a blonde girl walking around the bar who happened to be the bartender.  We wanted to order some Pupus but the bartender never came up to us.  A couple had sat down at this point who she tended too immediately.  As she was walking away from them, I said when you get a chance can we order some food.  She looked at me as if I was bothering her and she said K.  She then was in the well making drinks and had her back turned to us, looked over her shoulder and said I can take your food order while I'm doing this.  We ordered our food and she proceeded to tell us how we could save a little money by ordering the Pupus a certain way, which I thought.... now she is warming up and being nice.  After that I asked her name and she said her name was Kelly.  Another couple sat down beside us and she seemed to know them as she did the other couple.  She was very attentive to them and the other couple the entire time, but not to us at all.  We watched her walk around to tables with an angry look on her face as if she didn't want to be there.  The manager brought out our food.  So naturally we thought Kelly would come over and ask how it was....of course she did not. The first couple who sat down... she asked how their food was and engaged in a conversation with them as well as the second couple.  She passed by us several times but did not even look or talk to us.  Finally we were so fed up with the lack of any kind of decent service and asked the manager for our bill.  She brought it to us and I put out money to pay it.  After awhile Kelly took the payment, mumbled to herself I got to get them change.  She brought our change and barely looked at us and said Thank You.  I am a bartender who tips anywhere from 30 percent to 100 percent depending on the service I get.  I couldn't even leave Kelly a 10 percent tip.  She does not belong in the service industry.  She only tends to regulars which is fine, but had she given us good service we could have been new regulars for her.  Maybe a desk job would be more appropriate for Kelly.  Well Chilis, I suggest you train your staff to actually be nice to their guests and hire people who want to be there!
My favorite place to eat. the servers are ALWAYS FABULOUS and I have never been disappointed!

Usually we have great service here but tonight was horrible.  We waited 30 minutes for cold food so the manager came out to replace it.  Our waitress was so weird too.  She wouldn't refill the beer fast but gave us double waters and plates.  She didn't come around a lot and wasn't friendly.  Not coming here for a while.  I was hoping for a great night out since I'm pregnant and don't have much nights out till I give birth.  So disappointed.

I am a huge Chili's fan, but this Chili's in Kahala just doesn't cut it.  I have been to this Chili's about five times and have had the same lacking service 3 out of 5 times I have went.   One time in particular, we sat at a table with our menus and went unnoticed by a server for 40 minutes!  The tables ALL around us were being helped and yet we went unnoticed.  There were servers going back and forth all around us and not one even stopped to asked if we had been helped.  I work in a restaurant and there is no excuse for a server to see a table that has been sat for 40 mins and notice they don't even have drinks, and not say anything.  Finally, after waiting forever we chimed in and asked to be served. I honestly wanted to leave, but my boyfriend was hungry so we stayed and ate.  Once we did get  server, service was slow but okay.  It seems like every time we go here there is always some snag in the service.  I love Chili's and have had positive experiences with them all over the world, but this one is the exception!  I know not all servers are bad and slow, but the times I went there, that is the service I got. :( And to top it all off it is extremely expensive! I never write negative reviews, but I had to on this one.  Be warned!

Stay away from this place!!!  Horrible experience on Friday night, 12/7/13.  Ate here after my daughter's dance recital at Kahala Mall thinking it would be a fun quick dinner.  Six people in our party.  Place was packed and we sat outside.  We waited ONE HOUR for our food.  This included 2 kids meals and the adults had burgers and salads.  One hour for burgers and salads???  (on a sidenote, my mother in law originally ordered ribs but was told they were out of ribs.  That's right, a place known for ribs is completely out) Waitress kept coming around filling our water glasses and asking if we needed anything.  We shouted "Yes, our food!"  Waitress seemed genuinely apologetic but it doesn't mean much when you have two starving kids that are on the verge of a meltdown.  I am curious how they prioritize tables because people who arrived AFTER us were finished with their meals before OUR food even came!  To add insult to injury, when our food came one hour later, they forgot my son's kid's meal.  Had to talk to another waitress and the manager to get his food.  Unbelievable.  When all was said and done, the manager came over and said she wouldn't charge us for the kids meals. WOW.  After all that, you would think they would comp us for the entire meal.  In any case, it didn't matter that the kids meals were free because by the time the food came, they just wanted to go home and sleep.  The next day, my son asked me why the restaurant gave everyone else their food but didn't want to give him his food.  Great job Chili's.

I hadn't been to Chili's in awhile (at least a good 6 months or so), until recently... It must have been the recent blue moon or something, because within the last 4 days I had gone to three different Chili's. The first one was Kahala, for lunch, with co-workers, the next was Mililani the very next night for dinner with family and the third time was at Waikele a couple days later for a senior dinner again with family. (senior dinner meaning around 4-ish). I usually like Kahala's location, bring seated right away with our party of 8. Our waitress was extemely friendly and accomodating.  Alot of us were deciding between the triple dipper and the lunch express.  With the triple dipper you can pick 3 different appetizers for one price, about $14, and  the lunch express, I believe was either soup salad and a sandwich, for about $11-12. I was surprised they had a lunch special that included the chicken fajita with a cup of soup for about $13, so I ordered that with a cup of the chicken tortilla soup.  Half way through our appetizers, one of co-workers let out a small gasp/scream.  She was drinking water and found a spider at the bottom of her cup, at the end of her straw.  EEeeeewww! We told another waitress who quickly apologized, took away the glass and replaced with another.  We were expecting the manager or at least acknowledgement from our waitress but nothing. As we were finishing our lunch... I also found an ant on my drinking water (outside not in...thank goodness!). Anyway, the manager came to our table afterwards and apologized AND comped my co-worker's lunch as well as my own.  Which helped since we also got dessert. Dessert is always good.   As for the other two locations.  Waitresses were also very friendly and eager to please, eventhough it was busy when we went.  The food is ok... Nothing to brag about or specifically go there for.  It is a good place to have appetizers and talk story.  It helps if you go during happy hour, since all appetizers are $2 off.
Food is just ok.  Hate when We walk in and have to stand around waiting to be seated.  Better off goin next door to the counter, at least they will show you some attention when you walk in.

food was good, but service a little slow. food was fine - nothing bad, nothing spectacular.  cpk had a 1 hr wait, chili's only 10 min for lunch, which is how we ended up here today. ** note to chili's - if you have 'heavy set' waiters working on a hot day, make sure they are not sweaty.

Order of fried onion strings take out amounted to $3.13.  Took it home because the hubby and I were making burger sliders.  We saw an episode of Diners, Drive-Inns, and Dives on the Food Network featuring burgers, and we just had to try this one diner's technique for ourselves.  We found an awesome cast iron griddle on sale at Macy's a couple of months ago for about $14, so we decided to go all out and do burger sliders diner style.  Chili's onion strings are awesome!  One order was enough for about 10 burgers.  We also had bacon, avocado, cheese, and tomato slices to mix and match.  We had such a good time and a great dinner!  We're definitely ordering Chili's fried onion strings again.

Sorry excuse of a restaurant.  Service bad, waitress had bad attitude, had to ask for utensils, ask for water to be refilled, yet she kept pushing the expensive drinks.  Lunch for two was $78.  Not worth it at all.

I don't know what to say.  This place runs warm and cold.  Never great, but sometimes pretty good  The bar is a decent experience.  The bartenders are all attentive and drinks usually come quickly and made well.  Not sure why they insist on seating families with kids in the area--not a fan of uncontrolled rug rats, here.   The rest of the restaurant...well, it's hit or miss depending on the quality of the server. Sometimes it's great, (like Star, who really is a star server!) and sometimes it's bad (like the Australian dude who only visited our table every fifteen minutes--we missed out on second drinks and dessert, and he missed out on our usual 20%+ tip).  The kitchen....well, it's more of a crap shoot than the server. We had great take-out ribs on Tuesday, and, hoping for a repeat, we were disappointed with inedible chicken fried steak and dried out ribs four days later.  Blech.  We chucked it.  I had to go out for Chinese take out.  We always drop Chili's from our repertoire for awhile when this happens. We're only there out of convenience, (so close to our home, but this time around may be permanent).  New management acknowledges the issues and cites these are the specific reasons they were brought in, but...we don't want to pay to be your guinea pigs.  Thanks for the partial reimbursement and gift certificate, Ms. Manager.  I'll try redeeming the gift certificate in a few months.  Maybe you'll be closer to your performance goals by then.

Beware....I used my Credit Card to pay for my Bill that included my intended tip. Next day, my review of my online bank account showed $4.00 more! I went to the Chilies at Waikiki and spoke with manager about this. He said that their policy is that they automatically add a 20% tip to the approval for credit card when presented regardless of the actual tip. He said that when they process the card, within 2 days it will adjust on my account...... This seemed very strange to me.  I watched my account and nothing changed!  I went back to the Chilies and this time, no manager, just Asst. Mng. there. He still maintained that there was no error, however he did say several of their customers had similiar concerns when they saw their on line statements but eventually they get balanced out!!!!!!  As we are tourists, we don't have time or want to spoil our vacation time over $4.00..... Our thoughts...they just take 20% tips.  Service and portions of food very mediocore, prices, especially for Waikiki, very high.  Last time we will go there!

DON'T BOTHER... seriously! 1)  Watered-down drinks 2)  Over-cooked food, steak was like leather 3)  Service was crazy slow, but they had plenty of staff talking story [help a team member out, guys!]  The staff came across, as not caring about their service. 4)  No greetings, no good-bye's, no thank you's 5)  Waitress never asked how the food was, or if she could bring anything; she only stopped by once ,after the food was dropped off, and it was to drop off the check. 6)  Much like several other reviewers, this was not my first choice/destination, and it was a bad decision to experience this place. This was my FIRST and LAST experience with Chili's

so chilis Kahala is alright. I always want to give them a chance so i always go back there and try something new... however i can't seem to bump them up a star. the service" the waiters" is good. but the food is ... all--right. The only reason why i find myself going back to chilis is because my bf enjoys drinking outside and the pupus are fairly good.

My husband and I hand the craving for the Jalapeno Smokehouse burger on Tuesday. The first time my husband ate the burger was last week (Kahala). I had it last week and a month ago (Waikele). Friend had one too. We all commented how we loved the applewood smoked bacon that went with it. So that Tues. night, we went to eat at Chili's Kahala. We were (especially me!) was very disappointed that there was NO applewood smoked bacon-just cheap bacon. I asked the waiter and he said that it's no longer available- for a month now. I told him (Kendi) that can't be since my husband and I had JUST had it last week-there & I had it last month at the Chili's Waikele. A mgr (I'm assuming she's a manager-did not introduce herself) came to our table. She stated the bacon has not been available for 2 months and the cooks did not know how to cook it correctly. What the..? I had already let the incident go...but Then another mgr came to our table and stated that it hasn't been available for 6 months. WHAT?! He too did not introduce himself. We've been going to Chili's Kahala since it first opened. And the menu has been updated and HAS the Applewood bacon. $14 hamburger! Extemely disappointed with no applewood bacon and the LIES! There's been other problematic time, but this took the cake-with the lies. My lemons was served in a plastic cup cap cover and Kendi the waiter states that the dishes were being washed. WTF?
